content: We went with a guide who rushed us along, so if I'd had more time in Shanghai I would've gone back. It wasn't too crowded when we went in late afternoon/early evening. On a practical note, there were restrooms inside the garden. Overall very impressive!

title: Beautiful gardens
content: During a business trip we took the time to visit the Gardens. Plenty of people around and a nice atmosphere to see the wonderful gardens as well as browse the street markets which were more of what is expected of China than the underground market. Overall really worthwhile visiting.

title: Too crowded for us
content: We toured the gardens with a private guide. It was SO crowded on a Sunday that it was hard to enjoy.

title: Visit in evening time highly recommend
content: Gardens and shops offer most atmosphere in evening time.

title: For souveniers and tradional chinese stuff only
content: Good place to shop for souveniers and traditional chinese stuff like jewellery, chinese fans etc. Architecture of the place gives ancient tradtional chinese experience.

title: Beautiful old architecture
content: Went there on a Saturday evening. It was teeming with local crowds and some tourists. The place is preserved beautifully. The architecture is impressive. Couldn’t escape the American chains though - KFC and Starbucks - could have done without them being there. There are many tea houses, silk stores and Shanghai snack shops. It adds to the feeling of an old oriental bazaar. They have done a great job of lighting, it accentuates the architectural features of the old roofs. A must see - especially in the evening.

title: Huge Market
content: There is a huge market around Yu garden. You can find all the things here. You need to bargain a lot to get the things at correct price.

title: Shanghai-Yu Garden: great view of opulent oriental garden
content: Shaghai’s Yu Garden offers an opportunity to see a classical Chinese garden in an accessible human scale setting. The buildings—small temple rooms dedicated to family elders, for example—are gorgeous and meaningful. One highlight of the gardens is the collection of natural rocks, making a kind of natural structure.

title: Greenery & history
content: A very nice garden with special storey why it was built, why it has a zigzag entrance, and how wooden roots are made into tables and chairs.

title: A Hive of Activity
content: Like all tourist attractions in China the Yu Gardens is popular with both local and international tourists. So the area is always busy.

title: Architecturally amazing
content: These buildings were built hundreds of years ago and they are still going strong

title: Wonderful gardens
content: This oasis of tranquility in the middle of a massive city was so enjoyable. Wonderful details throughout the garden.

title: It was very very busy - but beautiful
content: I must have picked a bad day -very busy, hot and very poor air quality. It was packed, but well worth a visit, beautiful building and a photo opportunity around every corner. Perfect for couples and families.

title: Loved visiting even though it was very crowded
content: Very enjoyable experience and some lovely shopping although it was very busy. Was very hot amongst all the crowds but worth visiting.

title: The Blend
content: Visited yu garden with Alice our tour guide arranged by Jenny .It was very interesting experience with exterior of urban hush bush and tranquility inside . Beautiful .

title: SHANGHAI
content:
This place very nice, have a lots of Typical China items. 
It show that how richest people in China how is their lifestyle in the old days.

title: A nice garden
content: The Yu Garden was beautiful - but perhaps a bit overrated. Many of the structures are new, restored versions of the originals, and not authentic. A highlight of the gardens is the rockery - an impressive, beautiful garden structure of stones that is actually authentic.

title: Pretty buildings
content: Went in the evening but it was closing soon. Had a quick view from the outside and would say it looks beautiful! Will definitely go in the day time the next time I visit!

title: Not so much green
content: It is less green than what I tho get it would be, more structures in a garden, the entrance to it can be tricky to find as in China with some places where you pay your ticket entrance can just be a shoe size hole in the wall to pay. Cheap enough good for a look about for one hour

title: Beautiful calming gardens in busy Shanghai
content: Visited a number of gardens in China but loved the Yuyuan Gardens to best. Many pathways to follow over small bridges with water beneath filled with large gold fish, so serene. Loved the way the dragon topped the walls and wound its way around the perimeter. Don't forget to look up, as there is plenty to see with carved Chinese figures decorating the tops of buildings. Small pavilions are dotted throughout the gardens. They seem to be a popular spot for contemplation. Some paths are quite rocky so you have to watch your step so would not be suitable for visitors with poor balance & flexibility. The gardens are surrounded by the Old Chinese market which seems worlds away when walking through the gardens.

user_loc: 印第安那印第安纳波利斯
title: If you go late in the afternoon, you get a discount
content: The gardens close at 5 pm and if you enter after 4 pm you get a large discount. We went late by accident - didn’t realize how long the subway would take - but found an hour to be plenty. The subway stops a couple of blocks from the entrance to the garden so you need to figure that out - it’s not in a straight line either. The gardens are spectacular. Maybe because we went late, it wasn’t as full as I’ve read others complain about. We enjoyed it very much.

title: Ok but crowded
content: Nice garden but overrun with people. You  really do need a guide or the history is lost on non-Chinese. Some signs in English but most are not.

title: An ancient treasure in the middle of a modern city
content: I can't imagine visiting Shanghai without spending an hour or so at the Yu Gardens. It's incredibly peaceful and satisfying to walk through such remarkable history in the middle of a thriving metropolis. It's a must-see.

title: Constructions on going to change this place to 80% over touristy
content: When i came here ten years back it was beautiful

title: Crowded
content: You visit this garden if you are in Shanghai and want to get a taste of Chinese garden. If you have the time, I would recommend you go to Su Zhou, about an hour way, which is famous for its gardens.

title: Visit to oldest market area of shanghai
content: very well maintained and clean area, good nearby market to shop for, various food options within the yuyuan market, must visit place especially in the evening where entire area is lit up with uplights to highlight its ancient look, lot of goodies like souvenier items, silk fabric available at budge range,

title: Worth a Visit
content: If you want to enjoy the old charm of China then this is the place worth visiting.

title: Very beautiful
content: Walk through a busy market area to enter this beautiful and tranquil garden with its waterways teaming with Koi. Very lovely and such a contrast to the busy city surrounding it.

title: nice but not super special
content: this was a nice place to see however I was a little disappointed as I thought it was only average. Too many people to experience the tranquility that it was intended to give and I feel I have seen much better gardens. The typical entry was taken up with hawkers selling cheap garbage...ho hum.

title: Just wonderful
content: Amazing gardens and beautiful old houses  and buildings. You will lost inside with so many nice places for that special photo. At the end of the visit even saw a live concert of traditional Chinese ceramic group music. A must in Shanghai.

title: The Complex is Amazing the Gardens are not worth it.
content: A very Classic Area. It is highly recommended for a visit; you can find many souvenirs and places to eat. The gardens are not really worth going.

title: Visit early
content: We originally went in the late afternoon but the area was packed with crowds so decided to visit the next morning instead. It opens at 8.45am and was much quieter. It is a beautiful place to wander around. One to two hours is recommended.

title: Great architecture
content: Monday was a Chinese holiday so there were too much people! The architecture was exquisite! We weren't Interested in shopping but tried some of the local delicacies

title: Exciting.
content: It was great to see such a collection of buildings showing the traditional styles of an earlier China. The old Tea House in the lake was a lovely feature and we enjoyed a few hours spent there very much. There are a lot of eateries and commercial aspects which are a stark contrast to the buildings, but still highly recommend.

title: Very authentic and a must see in Shanghai
content: Stayed in Shanghai for a few days before our sea cruise. Plenty to do and see, take the open top bus to get a good 360 round trip of the city. We visited You Garden early in the morning as it gets quite busy. Its just off the main centre of the shops and well worth the visit. Very well looked after and pretty. We visited in February 2018 and had a brilliant few days

title: Crowded
content: Chinese gardens are more about symbolism than looks so don't expect a tranquil green space. Get a guide to really appreciate what you are seeing. The garden is in a very crowded area which is noisy and busy. There are far better places in China to appreciate gardens.

title: A quaint and inviting spot!
content: The Garden is a beautiful spot but can get really crowded so you need to pick and chose your timing on it. It's in a popular area so many people visit. It won't take you too long to go through it.

title: Antient touch
content: Shanghai is a very modem and futuristic city. However, the Yuyuan is a different world - it's allowing you to peek through small window into the past. And it's just a few metro stations away! Fantastic place to visit for someone wanting to feel and experience a little bit of what it was that back in the old days in China.

title: Nice visit with lots of old architecture
content: Took a taxi there from Sofitel Shanghai Hyland hotel that we stayed. Rather short distance, costing about 20 yuan. Lots of shopping before we reached the main entrance of the garden. Many shops selling souvenirs and food. Got to pay an entrance fee before getting into the garden, about 20-25 yuan. Spent about 3 hours day.

title: Always a nice spot!
content: We’ve been there last month for my fourth time, always nice, except the crowd. But can be avoided on the weekdays. During sunset is the best time to go, I’d say. Lights make it a magical place!

title: temples, gift shops, local food, etc..
content: One of the most crowded places in Shanghai but i'd definitely go back if i have the chances. everything is in this place- gift shops, souvenirs, local foods and delicacies you name it.

title: Recommended place to go
content: It's recommended place to go when you were at Shanghai. This contains of palace, flower garden, old building which authentic old Chinese building. Easy to access and many shops near the Yuyuan garden that sell souvenirs and local food.

title: Not so oasis like!
content: This is on the tourist trail in Shanghai and accordingly there are crowds of people at Yu Yuan. While mostly are milling around outside the garden itself looking at food/restaurants/shopping, there are still a number of visitors paying for entry into the garden.

title: Amazing when you think how old this garden is
content: A beautiful example of a very large traditional Chinese garden - that must have been one very rich family that had this built 400 years ago. It was amazing to see specimens that are hundreds of years old in such a beautiful setting. I was there early in the day so avoided the worst of the crowds which built up very quickly.

title: Beautiful Yu Garden
content: Just 2 minutes from the subway line 10, entrance fee about RMB10. A lot of Chinese traditional shops, food courts and at least 2-3 Starbucks around this area. A must to visit in Shanghai

title: Not much to it
content: We were told to go here by an ex pat living in Shanghai, but when we got there it was just a bog standard grassy area. One of the least interesting parks we have been to in China! If you’re walking past anyway then pop in, but not worth going out of your way to see it, in my opinion.

user_loc: 印第安那印第安纳波利斯
title: Go early/weekdays while in the area
content: I have been here a few times over the last couple of years. As many reviewer have said, it can be extremely crowded if you go at the wrong time.

title: Stroll through historical Shanghai district that offers a unique experience.
content: Give yourself at least 2 hours to stroll through this entire complex which spans about six city blocks. Restaurants, shops, stalls, cafes and open market are some of the attractions here including 16th and 17th century Shanghainese temple architecture. No less than two STARBUCKS here! Beautiful pond with fountain and hundreds of Koy fish make for some interesting photography with the shanghai financial tower looming in the background.

title: Overly crowded and overrated
content: Came here before a dinner meeting. The garden, the only part of the place that’s worth visiting, had just closed so I walked around the pedestrian shopping streets surrounding the garden instead. The area was lined with cheesy souvenir shops and eateries. Jam-packed with group tourists.

title: Great place to visit
content: Located in Pudong, Yu Garden is a good place to visit for its nicely restored architecture, variety of food and craft. Beware to come before 9pm where the shops close on the dot. Hard to get a taxi after 9pm.

title: Beautiful but go early
content: We got there about mid-day and it was rammed, hat whole area out the front was full to the brim with people which is a shame because I wanted to get some decent photos of the zig zag bridge and all the koi.

title: Beautiful traditional feel - weekends are too busy
content: Beautiful place to get some nice photos of old Shanghai, with a few places having the new Shanghai in the background.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: The garden is beautiful.  It is also in an area the has many many shops and food stands.  We were able to get gifts for our family and a little something for ourselves after visiting the gardens.

title: Beautiful Yu Garden
content: Wonderful shops and walking areas through these lovely gardens.  Many, many tourists and we did much shopping in this area.

title: Go there early
content: Beautiful garden and the history behind it is beautiful too as it was built by an emperor for his parents to live their old days. I recommend to go early, we went in the middle of the day and it was absolutely packed.

title: Very crowded place
content: This is my second visit to this place and more people to meet in this area.

title: Beautiful
content: This is right beside Old Town and is absolutely beautiful and well worth the admission cost. The buildings are well preserved and the historical features amazing. It was crowded being a Sunday so leave yourself plenty of time to explore. Don't miss it!

title: Very interesting old city
content: One of the most old and local place in ShangHai , from there you can taste the delicious local dumplings, also taste the Chinese Tea .

title: Worth a visit, but mixed reviews
content: Our visit here was marred by the 95F+ degree temperature. The stores are a mix of very expensive and junk. Lots of food vendors, but hard to find food without pork or other meat. The gardens are much smaller than anticipated and very crowded with mostly Chinese tourists. Be sure to look up at the roofs of some of the buildings for interesting figures on top. There’s less here than the guidebooks extoll. Worth a visit, but not a top site.

title: Beautiful Yu Gardens
content:
Yuyuan Gardens are breathtakingly beautiful!
A must visit in Shanghai.
All visitors will fall in love with this beautiful garden!

title: Bustling place with shops
content: There is temple in the middle and shops / eating places all around..

title: Traditional Chinese Garden
content: During a official trip we went for our lunch for this place. inside of the garden there were some food courts. you can taste lot of Chinese foods there.price is reasonable and clean environment.

title: Delightful
content: Such a welcomed break in the hustle and bustle of the city! This beautiful , quiet garden with all the views, buildings, trees and ponds is a very pleasant place to rest. There were a lot of people but some how it did not feel crowded. After going on the nine twists bridge you have to pay to enter this private garden, originally built more than 500 years ago by a rich official for his aging parents . I found this better than the one we saw in Suzhou, so don't miss it.

title: Pick your visit time carefully
content: The gardens can get quite crowded and jostling through the crowds on the narrow paths diminishes the serenity of the garden. Pick a weekday morning for best visiting times.

title: Nice way to spend a morning
content: We visited Yu Gardens fairly early in the morning to beat the heavy crowds and were fairly impressed. The Gardens are well kept and the surrounding shop streets have plenty of places to eat and shop.

title: So Serene!
content: Yu Garden (Yuyuan) - Such serene gardens and so nice to have a walk in the evening with friends and family.

title: Crowded
content: The garden is pretty, but there's not much room to walk around and there was a massive crowd inside the garden. It might have been the time of day.

title: Insanely crowded
content: Went on a slightly rainy and otherwise unremarkable Sunday, only to find the crowds so vast that I turned around and left. Throngs of people and poor queue management lead to a very weakreview, even if I haven’t seen the garden.

title: Beautiful!
content: I LOVED IT! Although it was raining, the gardens are beautiful. All the architecture is very traditional and all the surrounding area is pretty cool. It's like you time travelled to the past. It's a good hideout from busy modern Shanghai. Don't miss it

title: A collection of historic buildings and structures, inside of a quiet and beautiful garden.
content: My only regret is not being able to stay longer and explore the beautiful gardens and buildings. It was inside of a busy and bustling surrounding shopping district and had a cost to enter. The sense of quiet compared to the outside is quite outstanding on the day I went there. The garden is walled in, which gives a nice sense of seclusion from the outside world. These gardens are absolutely something to check out if you are short on time and want to take in some local history and traditional garden.

title: Exquisite Chinese garden with a fascinating history.
content: Yu Garden or “Happiness Garden” was a private family garden built in the 17th century during the Ming Dynasty. Its zigzag pathway is easy to traverse, through six discrete display areas. Its classic Chinese halls and pagodas, with beautiful sculpt and carvings, are intertwined with rockeries, water features, and foliage.

title: Just Plain Beautiful !!!
content: Lucky enough to visit this magnificent site in downtown Shanghai only a few weeks ago. We were blown away by the magic of these Gardens, we will never forget the experience.

title: Lovely Chinese Gardens
content: Yu Garden is best visited early in the morning to avoid the crowds. The complex is very big with many old pavilions, towers and halls, mixed with lakes and many rocks. There are several trees older than 200-300 years. There are many places to have a quiet rest. The entrance fee is reasonable at RMB 40 for an adult. Seniors and students are half price.

title: a nice morning
content: It was fun to watch all the activities going on here: dancing to pop music,karaoke, a small live band, discussion groups, card playing.

title: Stunning
content: Really loved this place it was gorgeous, interesting and historic. The whole area around the garden is well worth a visit, hard to imagine it was created such a long time ago.

title: My kids would never consider building me my own compound
content: A crowed place to visit to be sure but worth the visit. Gardens and buildings are well kept and it really transports you to a part of china's past that is quickly disappearing from Chinese culture/.

title: Lovely Place Worth The Visit
content: We went as part of the day tour and the time spent was well worth it.

title: Beautiful garden, with nice architecture
content: A nice and beautiful place to visit! All the buildings inside Yu Garden are ancient-styled, the zig-zag bridge area is great for photos. However, the place is VERY crowded, but I would still recommend a visit here if you are in Shanghai.

title: Step back in time
content: The 450 year old garden can come to life if you visit with someone who knows the history of the compound. The background is fascinating and the sights are excellent.

title: Nice old market
content: It is a paradise for all those who love shopping and bargaining. The heritage structure of the market is very appealing and so are the shops. The rock garden is a unique garden and a must see.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: Yu Garden is a large garden, with lots of paths and bridges, and paths that pass through the large rocks. There were quite a few people there, but it was still possible to find a quiet corner to just sit. It was very peaceful and calming, a very enjoyable experience. I also visited The Lingering Garden in Suzhou, but I preferred Yu Garden.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Beautiful gardens tucked away right in the middle of Shanghai. I’m unsure how much it cost to enter as it was part of our day tour with Sunny Tours Shanghai. Highly recommend having a tour guide in Shanghai. It made the day stress free and completely enjoyable.

title: Sprawling gardens in the heart of the city
content: This garden is huge. It has many entrances and exits so please plan your visit according to what you would like to see inside. it is so huge that its impossible to walk and cover the entire garden. The day we decided to visit was a public holiday and the start of the spring festival so it was clearly a wrong time as it was crowded with locals. There was hardly any place to walk. The entire place was decorated in typical chinese lanterns. There are many restaurants and coffee shops inside. There were also many stalls selling local delicacies. Few souvenir shops too. We didn't enjoy as it was too crowded.

title: garden in city
content: these gardens were lovely but be prepared for the number of people who visit. The chance to enjoy the serenity,design and sit and take in the garden is lost because of the crowds

title: Beautiful are
content: Beautiful garden, would definitely recommend going and wandering around. Pop into the tea house for a break from the madness.

title: Peace, tranquility and beauty, Ahhhh!
content: During our four day visit to Shaghai this April we took a private guided tour of Yu Garden and found it a wonderful haven.

title: Nice Garden
content: Walking around this place in the winter will give more misty and different sensation.

title: Perfect green breath inside the crowded but amazing ShangHai
content: As we were in Shanghai for holidays with friend (1st coming in China), after all the crowded area and nightlife, we need to relax and breath. This garden is amazing old style and well preserved. A must enjoy early morning;)

title: A break from the city!
content: Definitely worth the visit, you could easily forget you are in a city as it’s all beautiful cobble streets with traditional Chinese buildings, lots of shops for souvenirs or gifts and food places outside the garden and it’s quite a busy area! We went around 1pm on a Monday so not sure what it would be like at the weekend!

title: Difficult to take the beautiful pictures without the crowded people
content: Crowds are on the bridge to watch the koi and the swans before the entrance of Yuyuan Garden.

title: Amazing Historic Residence
content:
Very cool and extremely old.
Best go early though as it gets wildly busy.
Easy to get to by cab. Allow an hour or two.

title: Classic Chinese gorgeousness
content: This site is so cheap to enter that we decided to give it a try and I’m so glad we did. It’s classic China of old in that it’s what you imagine when you think of China. The classic buildings, ornamental dragons and water gardens with rock garden areas. Gorgeous covered walkways and koi in all the pools. It’s just lovely and really romantic too.

title: need to be seen onces at least
content: It's a lovely place to see, in the middle of a modern city... old fashion buldinds next to big towers in the back ground! 40 rmb (up to 60 rmb during celebration weeks). Don't buy anything in the shops arounds : the quality is terrible ( if you really want something : bargain A LOT !!!). Very nice stones can be bought inside the Yu Garden ( you can engrave with your name or a chinese caracter) for a neckless or key holder

title: lovely garden
content: beautiful old garden in central city. lot of people during week end. be careful the,garden doors close at 4pm only

title: Beautiful Gardens and ponds
content: This is a must see. The gardens include many ponds,bridges and historic buildings. Makes you feel like you have walked into ancient past.

title: Beautiful garden
content: Many tourists jostled for position and the best place to take photos throughout the garden. But it is a beautiful, quiet, and tranquil place. Eventually, as you move through the garden, you will find a spot where there are few tourists and no students with sketch books, but one where people have come for hundreds of years to be one with nature. Most amazing is knowing what is on the outside of the garden - a noisy, bustling city!

title: Guided Tour Definitely Recommended
content: Just in the heart of bustling Shanghai, this beautiful garden of art and nature.

title: I LOVED THIS PLACE ! GO EARLY !!
content: I’m all about this place. Very beautiful and fun place to spend the morning. I’d definitely NOT show up at 12 noon, when it’s crazy busy. We got here by 8.30 and ENJOYED ourselves , walked through the bazaar and enjoyed the gardens and got great photos without the massive crowds.. ENJOY !

title: Space utilization at its best
content: Sad part of the garden is its recent history of having been confiscated from the original owners. However the silver lining is that it is now open to viewing by ordinary you and me. It used to be a private home in the heart of Shanghai with circumspect use of available space to create several mini gardens. It is now displayed as a long , stretched out garden of rocks, green and mini lakes with fish and eye catching flaura . The use of narrow pathways along windows , to enable refreshing flow of breeze in and around, is truly impressive. Should be on your list of to-do !

title: nice peaceful garden
content: We really enjoyed the whole experience. You have good contrast between the peaceful garden and the crazy shopping/eating areas that surround it. We spent around 3 hours there. Right next to subway station

title: Oasis near the old town
content: Lovely Chinese style garden - an oasis of calm near the bustling narrow streets of the old town. Lots of statues and weathered limestone rocks as well as plenty of nooksand crannies.

user_loc: 英国特伦特河畔纽瓦克
title: Wonderful place to visit
content: Lots of history associated with this magnificent former private dwelling confiscated from the family by the communist government. It is also adjacent to a nice shopping area.

title: Very nice Garden. We think even more interesting than forbidden city
content: The Garden is far from being very huge, however it is very beautiful and interesting. You can enter the garden by a zickzack Bridge and are already welcomed by a pond with Goldfish and Koi. Inside the Garden you have a variety of different area's and buildings where all of them are well maintained and nice to look at.

title: Beautiful sight of old town
content: Beautiful sight of old town city with beautiful historic design of old shanghai beautiful garden and good resturant’s and cafe such as Starbucks and herb shops and gift shops

title: Lovely
content: Loved walking around here. It was very quiet and the scenery is lovely. the Buildings look lovely and it gives a fantastic opportunity to see the old Shanghai.

title: Beautiful
content: The garden is breathtaking in beauty. There is plenty to see and the garden layout is beautiful with places to sit and look at the beautiful surroundings. We also went to the outside at night and the lights on the bridge to the entrance is lovely it looks completely different.

title: A stroll in the park with History
content: The park is different and it has a history behind it. The arches make interesting spaces for photo opportunities. The old trees are a sight to see.

title: Powerful
content: The history alone is remarkable. The quite, within the city, the gardens and tranquility, an artists palate. Up until this day I had never heard of this place, a great must of a tour.

title: Wonderful gem in Shanghai’s Old City...
content: ...But so mobbed that you may be in danger of getting trampled when you visit!

title: Ordinary gardens but great low end market and food outlets
content: I was expecting a great experience having read so many good reviews however the gardens themselves were somewhat disappointing, a bit unkempt and dirty, I guess keeping up with the maintenance must be difficult with the constant stream of visitors.

title: Would be fabulous if empty
content: Amazing place with so many fabulous little buildings and what would be a divine atmosphere if you weren’t surrounded by a million other people mainly taking selfies.

title: What a place ...
content: A must visit ..... Tucked away in the middle of Shanghai is the beautiful Yu Gardens where you can leave the hustle and bustle of the outside world behind and contemplate the rest of your day in peace. The rock pools, trees , greenery and the lack of outside noise make you forget that you are in a city with almost the population of Australia. Suggest going during the week as the weekends can be pretty busy.

title: a tourist place to visit
content: this is my second visit,many shops and good things to buy as presents.You can easily walk it from the Buud or Nanjing St in 15 minutes

title: Very enjoyable
content: A very enjoyable day, which I would recommend to families, solo travelers, or other visitors to Shanghai.

title: Old shanghai
content: A must to visit if you want to experience more the feeling of old shanghai and what ancient China looked like. Nice in the evenings too, especially with the lights, fewer people and cooler. Lots of stalls for food and nice souvenirs.

title: Do not miss the delicacy!
content: Do not leave this place without trying the XiaoLongBao and the TangBao! There is a stall in the middle of the bazaar selling these two types of dumplings. It is impossible to miss it as there will always be a queue.

title: A Must See
content: Very nice attraction, with much to see. Classic Chinese architecture, unique garden., ponds with koi-carps, halls and cloisters. The mark of the gardens are the Zig Zag bridge, the jade rock and the mid-lake pavilion.

title: Busy tourist attraction but gardens are lovely
content: Be prepared for crowds but it’s worth it as once you get in to the gardens it is a lot more relaxed. It’s not particularly friendly for those with limited mobility and it’s quite small, surrounded by lots of stalls and shops, and people ... but it’s cool to see something so old surrounded by the skyscrapers of Shanghai. And it really is a lovely garden. My tip - take some water with you as the only shop is near the exit for the gardens. There are volunteers in the square outside in pink shirts who try and help you, I was suspicious at first but they were actually handy to help navigate through the hustle and bustle to the garden entrance and also to find a place for a cold beer after.

title: History Stop
content: Yu Garden is a good activity for non holidays, not to get trampled. The building, arches and walkways are beautifully put together along with the fauna and flora. It might be a little difficult to find due to the amount of people and small shops right outside, look for the signs.

title: Best place for traditional shopping
content: The place is so much crowded. But a must try if you want to buy some traditional things. Alot of food variety is available. Most impotantly there is a mosque for the Muslims

title: Must Visit
content: Actually a historical residence around which there is a garden. It is not like an open and expansive garden. Time required to visit approximately 45 minutes to one hour.

title: Visit to a lovely garden
content: We had a guide who shared with us the history about Yu Garden and the traditions about the olden days. I would recommend to have a guide as you will be understand the Chinese culture better. Had a nice afternoon at the garden and that afternoon we were entertained by a Chinese orchestra where porcelain instruments were used to perform. What a treat we had.

title: A busy tourist area
content: Very hectic place, you should visit here in weekdays do not in weekend. Many tea stalls, souvennirs and ofcourse various food stall

title: lovely place but so noisy
content: A lovely place to see and visit but it is too large and you will need to have a very soft shoes otherwise soar feet will be the result of this visit.

title: yu garden
content: the premier garden in Shanghai. Excellently maintained. Great for walking and people watching. Easy access from Nanjing East pedestrian mall and subway. Right next to Old Town.

title: Beautiful place
content: Magical beautiful place. A spot you cannot miss while in shanghai! a little bit crowded but absolutely a must when visiting shanghai

title: Peaceful Pong
content: We start dinner had a drink at the bar and the centre of the gardens a little bit pricey but very nice. They have food cocktails and Beers. It was nice walking through the gardens and seeing all the families out with umbrellas trying to find dates for the kids. I have never heard of that haha. The gardens are very close to multiple Subway stations in the centre of the city definitely worth a look.

title: One of the best location in Shanghai
content: I would recommend you to visit the place at around 04 in the evening and then stay at this location till it gets dark. You would be able to see both the sides of this beautiful place. The place is pretty crowded though, but I am sure you won't find it too crowded. Lots of option to shop around local stuff and souvenirs for your friends and relatives. The place lights up pretty amazingly at night. Overall a very happening place to try out regional cuisines, shopping etc.

title: CHINA AT IT'S BEST - A MUST SEE!
content: With one free day left on a SNA Panda China Discovery tour I took a taxi to the Yu Garden which our tour guide had not even bothered to mention. This garden was the absolute highlight of what was an extremely disappointing tour. At only 40¥ entry fee it was the best money I spent on tour. I did not expect to see so many wonderful Chinese Garden rooms in central Shanghai and I was completely blown away by the beauty of the gardens. It is a photographer's Nirvana even for an amateur like me who just points and shoots. The many gardens featured varying designs and there were plenty of places to rest and take in the scenery.

title: Must visit
content: The Yu Garden (or Garden of Happiness) is a large Chinese garden located beside the City God Temple in the northeast of the Old City of Shanghai.

title: Nice
content:
Garden is more over like a walk way, located in center position as if Nanjing road, bund and people's square is too near by.
First I felt it's a bamboo garden but it's just one side entry. Beautiful garden with many entrance.

title: Amazing Garden
content: Beautiful architecture and green spaces all around.Nicely done Asian garden must visit places in Shanghai.Really enjoyed.

title: Fantastic Chinese Garden
content: If you are expecting a garden with lots of flowers and plants then this is not going to meet that expectation. Like most Chinese and Japanese gardens the hard landscaping is equally important and there are lots of pergodas and rivers and ponds. It is still very nice and there are a lot of 'rocks' which although interesting do seem a little bit of a waste. This said, the gardens are tranquil (apart from the crowds of people) and worth visiting. Go early before the real crush. Walking on the bridge to get to the gardens is a lot easier in the morning and crushed in the afternoon.

title: Amazing
content: Very crowded and many places to see and eat. If you’re used to Alipay, don’t, almost all places here were cash only so we had a hard time finding something to eat or drink without any cash.

title: Just lovely!
content: We spent about 2 hrs wandering around these gardens, and although near the city centre are quiet, relaxing & really lovely. A proper piece of Chinese history, gorgeous with two charmings shops to browse & maybe treat yourself. A definite must on the to do list when visiting Shanghai. I'm not particularly interested in gardens but found this delightful!!

title: Beautiful place for a relaxing walk
content: We.enjoyed a relaxing walk through the beautiful gardens. I was fun to watch different groups, one was playing instruments, one dancing, others doing yoga. Great place to visit and relax.

title: Awesome place to visit
content: It's a very beautiful and serene place. The garden is filled with beautiful views and amazing architecture.it a must visit in Shanghai.

title: Little peaceful oasis in Shanghai
content: Located in the heart of old Shanghai next to City God Temple. Beautiful Chinese garden, oases of peace, great place to relax from noisy Shanghai. There is lots beautiful temples like buildings, little lakes and bridges, very photogenic and beautiful, specially when trees blossoming. Extensive collection of trees and plants ..

title: Lovely garden and interesting surrounding shops
content: The garden itself is lovely, especially as we went in spring, with azaleas, peonies and wisteria flowering. However it was a bit crowded, even on a Wednesday. And if you are over 60, bring your passport to get 1/2 price admission. The shops and snack places around the garden are also really interesting to wander around. We especially liked the Crab Soup dumplings - you first drink the contents with a straw and then eat the dumpling!

title: Alright for a walk around
content: Pay the small entrance fee and have a mooch around. Fairly interesting gardens and quite a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the shopping streets outside. I’d say it’s worth a visit, but it isn’t going to be the highlight of your trip.

title: Very pretty
content: There gardens were well laid out in a circular route. The day we visited was extremely busy and we had difficulty keeping together with the group. There are a series of steps and uneven ground but it is well worth a visit.

title: Go there early to avoid the crowds
content: Head to the gardens first thing in the morning, because it can get very busy and crowded, and we were advised to keep an eye on our belongings. Make sure that you visit the nearby Shanghai Temple Of the Town God (Chenghung Miao). Entry fee is minimal at both places. You will definitely need between two to three hours, especially as the crowd gets denser and moves slower.

title: Very crowded
content: There is a big market place all around it. Pushy vendors. Lots of people in the Gardens. There were lots of rocks and trees some water features. To be fair it was a very hot day that we went. Lots of pushing and shoving and getting into personal space

title: A gem in Shanghai, not to be missed
content: A very special garden in China town of Shanghai.built in the 16 century, Ming Dynasty. Built 18 years long by a rich son dedicated to his parents. Very nicely planned with a few buildings inside , beautiful gardening , many water pools . A real gem .

title: Wow what a special place
content: You need to see this.

title: Full day experience
content: This was my 3rd time here and I loved it, the tea House, the temple, the garden, the shopping and the people watching of course. The garden with the lake is really amazing and I think for a price of around $7usd it is worth it.

title: No biggie
content: Don't know what's the fuzz about this place. Go in the morning to avoid the crowds, but nothing really to look at.

title: A green oasis
content: Despite the adjacent ancient buildings were transformed into a tourist catch market (of a fantastic scenery though), the garden inside is more peaceful and definitely beautiful. Take some time to walk around and enjoy this beautiful garden with lakes, ancient pavilions and marvellous trees.

title: Beautiful garden tucked in the middle of a shopping area
content: Our guide led us to this beautiful, yet small garden area that was tucked in the middle of a busy shopping area. We were there during a national holiday so the area was very busy, but the line over the zig-zag bridge and through the garden moved quickly. Because there were so many people, we were not able to leisurely stroll about the area, but I felt confident we saw everything there was to see and snap lots of photos during our walk through. The garden is mostly a water garden with sculptures, rocks and a few plants throughout. It is a nice little oasis in the middle of a busy shopping area.

title: Interesting but oh so crowded
content: It is an interesting visit but not a must do. The crowds are huge and although interesting an hour or so is probably enough. The shops outside are also very crowded, but you are in China and that is part of the experience.

title: Iconic Shanghai
content:
Go early to avoid the crowds!
Be aware that the zigzag bridge and tearooms are outside the gardens so entry ticket not required!
The area is packed with tourists both internal and from overseas...think Trevi fountain in Rome!!

title: Stunning gardens
content: We visited here with our own private guide as part of a full day of touring.  The gardens really are so picturesque and well worth a visit.

title: An Oasis in the Middle of the City
content: This was by far the most beautiful of any of the gardens we visited during our time in China. It is nestled in the center of the city near busy overpasses, yet when you walk into the Gardens you are met with beauty, calm and serenity. A great place to reflect and realize how fortunate we were to be able to come to such a quiet and wonderful place.

title: Lovely
content: Lovely garden. With fish And plants And great plants And trees. We loved this place so much. When You visit Shanghai, visit this garden!!!

title: Nice garden/old neighbourhood
content: A very peaceful little garden and very crowded surroundings with old houses. A must if in Shanghai. Also walk around outside the garden for a very authentic experience of how people live and breathe nowadays in Shanghai.

title: Lovely garden
content: Lovely Chinese garden with nice architectural pavilions in Shanghai.

title: Great place to shop and eat
content: The Gardens are actually inside of this big tourist attraction full of restaurants and shops. You can actually get lost in the Gardens and I had a hard time finding my way out. But it was pretty and peaceful.

title: A must-see in Shanghai
content: There is quite a touching story behind Yu Garden construction and it is an absolute must-see when visiting Shanghai, especially in spring and autumn seasons when dramatical changes occur to the flora of the garden causing an explosion of colors and patterns in this hidden gem of tranquility in the middle of roaring metropolitan jungle. Make it sure that you have enough time to complete your visit as the garden closes at 5pm. Visiting on weekdays is definitely better than on the week-ends, as it might get very crowded. Yu Garden is surrounded by a beautiful reproduction of an old town, with restaurants and souvenir shops. Make sure to grab a couple of souvenirs as well as to eat Ningbo balls soup - a local delicacy made with sticky rice and black sesame and sugar filling.

title: Stunning stmosohere
content: I loved Yu Garden for the spectacular beauty and peaceful calming environment! It’s such s nice place to wander around, sitting down at various small seats to just observe either the scenery or the people!

title: The Gardern is nice and the area of shops around it are a must see.
content: The garden attraction is nice, maybe not Suzhou level but worth seeing. Make time to visit the shops, there is much variety and if you want to buy, try to pay 25% on the dollar of their asking price. If not, walk away.

title: Beautyful
content: This garden is wonderful, very clean and perfect to relax. I wish there woud be more signs inside to find the way around and the exit as well.

title: Simply a must see
content: If you're in shanghai you simply must visit these gardens. It only costs about £4 entry. Expect to spend 2 or 3 hours there. The gardens, ponds and buildings are simply beautiful and immaculately well kept. There are lots of little paths - some a little hidden - to take around the gardens all offering unique, beautiful views of the gardens. There are also some great views of shanghai tower from the gardens so you get a wonderful mix of old and new, nature and man-made. There are people offering there services as a guide but generally would say you don't really need to shell out for one. Enjoy!

title: Beautiful garden with high entry fee
content: It was very crowded. Please visit this place early in the morning or you encounter a mass of tourists preventing you from watching its beauties in serene atmosphere. The entry fee was 40 RMB.

title: Beautiful Garden
content: A lovely ancient Garden in the middle of the city but it’s overcrowded. Not complaining though, what else to expect being in world most populous country?

title: Nice place to relax
content: The garden is a wonderful place to spend some time after visiting the bazaar. Beautiful rock formations and buildings are throughout the garden and there are so many places to just sit and enjoy the natural beauty or people watch.

title: Beautiful old hidden garden in Shanghai
content: Lovely garden of the old royal palace in Shanghai. One can easily get there with the subway and then walk for about 10-15 minutes to the garden itself. Finding the entrance was a bit challenging as you have to go through a fairly large bazaar area to get to it. The cost of the ticket was minimal and there were no lines at the ticket windows. Depending on how much you want to see one could walk around the garden and over footbridges and ponds within half an hour or could take a more leisurely and longer time time to stroll through and look at the buildings of the old royal palace that are part of the garden. The feel and look of the place takes you back in time. It was quite chilly when I visited so I did a short walkabout. There are some clean toilets within the garden as well, which was great. One could also visit the old Bhuddist temple just and the many shops of the bazaar just next to the garden, and also stop there for tea and snacks. All in all it’s a place worth visiting.

title: Lovely
content: We got in the last minute before closing. It was a lovely garden and well packed (holiday weekend) and a bit confusing to find but well worth the visit. I wouldn’t mind trying and going back to visit it on a non holiday, day.

title: Not Bad
content: The Yu Garden is good if you have a tour guide who can explain this history, but, even still, it was less than I expected. It's kinda run down and very crowded. If you decide to go, go early/mid-morning. By 11:00, the Garden and Market are packed.

title: Yu Garden
content: Yu Gardens are a tranquil cultural & historical oasis in the middle of a modern, busy city! The sites bring you back into China's past.

title: Old Shanghai
content:
Very famous place in Shanghai.
If you want to see a place with a lot of heritage. If your shopping for a souvenir.
If you want to taste some authentic fast bite.
I think this is the place to see.

user_loc: 明尼苏达明尼阿波利斯
title: Nice area to walk through
content: We fought jetlag by getting up and spending some time walking around the Bund, including the Yu Garden. Not exceptional, but worth a stop if you're in Shanghai and have the time.

title: Peaceful gardens surrounded by shopping bliss/chaos!
content: The gardens are nice, historic, but not as amazing as some others in Shanghai (People's Park, for example). But they are surrounded by a crazy scene of shopping - from little booths to mid-range stores - all less expensive than the pricey stores in other parts of the city.

title: lovely spot in middle of the city
content: it was very crowded the day we visited. We walked from the Bund about 10mins. entrance fees very reasonable and you get reduction for over 60yr but must have proof. lovely place to spend a couple of hours. Lots of shops in the surrounding area from market stall to high end fashion

title: Lovely peaceful location
content: Escaping the stress of the buzzing city this is a great place to go. Even though it was full of people (holiday weekend) it was still calm and relaxing.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Dating back to the Ming dynasty these gardens are a pleasure to explore. It is divided by dragon walls. You see orange Carp swimming in the pools,fantastic rockeries and a charming Teahouse. Very pretty area and lovely for taking photos.

title: Great Garden to be seen!
content: An amazing garden to be seen for sure. Very pleasant calm and beautiful area in the center of the city

title: Interesting
content: This garden seems to ramble on endlessly from courtyard to courtyard. Not well maintained as a garden, yet the rock work and variety is impressive. The many traditional buildings frame the views as you are led through an ever changing series of doorways. The zig zag bridge is a hit as well as many places to sit on verandahs in the shade. It was a steamy 27 degrees when we visited

title: An absolute must do
content: If you are taking a taxi, get the name written in Chinese. Taxi drivers are helpful but mostly they don`t speak English. We enjoyed the gardens so much we did it twice. Once in daylight and then went back at night. Take Cash. English Visa cards not accepted. Go early to avoid the crowds as it gets really busy. Not a flower garden but an idyllic landscaped area with stunning architecture, as well as lakes full of golden carp and shady covered walkways. Lots of touristy gift shops within the larger buildings, but pay the extra to explore the garden, where we found a special exhibition of Chinese pictures and higher quality jade and silk gifts to buy. It had a different atmosphere at night as the buildings were beautifully lit up. We bought quite a few gifts here for a reasonable price. We were invited to follow a young man who had watches to sell. After much friendly but firm bartering we bought two " copy watches" We`re pleased with them and they`re still keeping perfect time 6 weeks later. If you want a bargain don`t have a big wad of cash, keep most of your cash separate and only show a small amount.

title: One of the oldest Garden in Shanghai
content: One of the oldest Garden in Shanghai, made in Ming Dinasty

title: Relaxing.....
content: Yuyuan Garden is a lovely place to visit! Relaxing and peaceful place with a lot of nice buildings, flowers and historical monuments.

title: Chinese gardens, market and Taoist temple all in one location
content: Very busy when we were here in a Saturday but a great place to visit. We ate good cheap food at a huge buffet/self service restaurant full of Chinese families but there are international cafes here too. Smallish market compared to others but plenty to buy: chopsticks, calligraphy items, tea, tea sets etc (don' forget to bargain hard!)

title: Peaceful getaway back in time
content: I spent two hours wandering around the garden, enjoying blossoming flowers and spring smells.

title: When in the Old City, be sure to visit!
content: I took a half-day tour of Shanghai courtesy of China Vacations (see my review), and this was one of the major stops. I had not heard of it before, but it was one of the highlights of the day.

title: Fun place to check out
content: Fun to walk around and talk photos. Lots of souvenir shops -make sure to haggle-many places to enjoy soup dumplings and local snacks.

title: Fun Afternoon
content: Beautiful garden full of gorgeous plants, bamboo and flowers. We also very much enjoyed the adjacent markets. Tons to see and do. Plenty of food and drink as well as anything you can imagine to purchase.

title: A sanctuary in a big city
content: A lovely small hidden gem. Entrance fee, but free if your over 70. The history of the garden is well worth being acquainted with, rocks and buildings, and the very big goldfish.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: In love with this place!
content: This is definitely a tourist trap, but a beautiful one at that. Around the area there is a buzzing vibe of restaurants, gift shops, street vendors & the best Turkish ice cream I've eaten!!

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Lovely Garden, Very Popular
content: A lovely garden which is worth visiting if you have time (although the ticket price is a little high from memory). The surrounding area has some interesting shops/eateries. Go early to avoid the crowds/massive tour groups!

title: Beautiful and serene.
content: The whole key to this garden is to go when there are no tourists. Otherwise it’s a mob scene and you will not enjoy yourself. I went on a Monday morning and I was the first one in. I had such a lovely time and was even able to journal. Other friends of mine said they hated it because it was wall-to-wall people. It’s definitely worth going but only if you can get there early enough to enjoy its beauty.

title: A nice walk.
content: Next to Old Town, Yu Garden offers a pleasant stroll through a beautiful setting. My favorite part was finding a bit of local living. One of coy ponds in the park had a fishing activity setup for kids (catch and release) which was bustling with excited children and their parents.

title: Very Heritage
content: Try to find the old feeling of Chinese heritage so you need to come here. Buy alot of souvenirs here

title: A Gem In The City
content: This beautiful space was right beside our hotel. The old architecture is fabulous, the whole area is kept beautifully, it was many of the lovely peaceful tranquil places we visited.

title: Crowded Tourist Trap that is Worth One Visit
content: Yu Yuan is a tourist trap that has everything from fast Chinese food to vendors offering everything from Jewelry to trinkets and toys. Go once and enjoy watching people. DO NOT waste your time paying to enter the "Jade" Garden ... it's a bunch of rocks that wind around and offer no real enjoyment or benefit. Grab a cup of coffee at Starbucks and sit outside and watch the mass of humanity walk and wind their way through the area.

title: Busy busy busy
content: Went on a Sunday big mistake. Great area to see leading to the gardens but you just shuffle along in a horde of people. Didn't realise, stupidly, that you had to pay to get into the actual garden and due to so many people decided to give the actual garden a miss. Looks beautiful on the pictures though.

title: Beautiful garden
content: This place is stunning, and so tranquil.

title: Beautiful and very Chinese!
content: A lovely tea house for traditional teas (A chamomile flower in my teapot) with authentic music. A vast array of little shops to walk around, a beautiful pond full of turtles and koi carp..

title: Very crowded
content: Found Yuyuan over-crowded and too touristy for my liking. It's lots its charm in all the commercialism, unfortunately.

title: Excellent
content: Beautiful place. Gardens are stunning and serene. Very accessible with plenty to enjoy for all tastes.

title: Worth a visit - nice garden but crowded
content: It took us a bit to find the entrance to the garden. Our GPS led us in some interesting directions so we got a nice tour of the outer walls first.

title: Peaceful garden with excellent chinese architecture and beautiful plants - COME EARLY !
content: Dont go there on Sunday or Saturday afternoon - it's packed!

title: A step back in time
content: After elbowing our way through the throngs of tourists and souvenir sellers it was a treat to find some quiet gardens and pavilions to reflect in and ancient architectural style to appreciate which hard to find in the ever changing face of Shanghai.

title: Sanctuary in the Madhouse
content: Stepping into the Yu Gardens was a little like stepping into a a den of tranquility with its ancient Chinese architecture, gardens and water pools/features. Inside seemed a long way from the hustle and bustle of modern Shanghai right outside. It was fairly busy when we were there but it seemed miles quieter than the city we'd stepped-in from.

title: Worth a visit ...
content: But be prepared for massive crowds. Worth a wander and look for the quiet tea rooms upstairs and if you leave the core area you get a glimpse into local markets. Have to say seeing Starbucks, Macdonald's and KFC in the environs was a bit jarring

title: Best place at shanghai
content: This is one of few place that you should visit in shanghai. Many local street food, small souvenir store and old building. Here is one tip : buy souvenirs near mrt entrance, more cheaper than inside yu garden

title: Oasis in the middle of the city
content: This is a beautiful garden built in the 1500's that is a must see as a contrast to the more modern side of Shanghai.  Peaceful ponds, intricate carvings, numerous buildings to explore - very lovely.

title: Simply stunning.
content: This is the perfect place to get some peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle of the old town. It was magical. The gardens, rocks, temples, fish, water. Stunning.

title: Surprisingly peaceful
content: The gardens were surprisingly peaceful despite the hustle and bustle in the gardens and being so close to the centre.

title: A special piece of local culture
content: It was a busy day, what with the Labour Day weekend, but this just made for better people watching and more inclusiveness. The street food was delicious, especially the Crab Soup Dumplings.

title: Lovely ancient garden in the old town of the City
content: Yuyuan Garden is located in the centre of Shanghai old quarters. Then entrance is hidden away in the Old Street Market, you'll pass many hawkers and stores on route, be careful of your belongings at all times and start early if you can as it can get extremely busy.

title: Okay for a short walk
content: Very touristy but it is good to take a short walk to look at the culture of the place. It’s about 5-7mins walk from the subway and it was easy for us to get a didi or taxi leaving the place, just Ensure that you state the entrance/exit number in your booking. (There are several exits)

title: Yuyuan Gardens
content: Worth a visit, it is surrounded by the Bazaar and a 200 year old tea house. The bazaar is a large area so I would make a day of it.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: We went here as part of a guided tour of Shanghai. Our guide told us about its history. We also had tome wander around the lovely gardens.

title: A lovely way to spend a morning or afternoon
content: This garden like most Chinese gardens is beautiful.  While there are always crowds of people the design, layout and history to these gardens is wonderful.  If you enjoy wandering through Chinese history you will enjoy these gardens.

title: Beautiful Garden
content: Not too crowded the day we went so we enjoyed just leisurely strolling around and taking in everything. There are a number of buildings you go through, each with something different to see. Worth the visit if you have the time.

title: Wow garden
content: highlight of shanghai for sure. also try to leave the day free when visiting as it is located in old shanghai that is a must for visitors. The shopping is good in the area but need to negotiate.

title: It's pretty but quite crowded with tourists
content: Not much peaceful about it, but you have to go because everyone does. Go early in the morning if you want any dumplings.

title: FOOD
content: I wanted to TRY EVERYTHING!!! The Food looked so good.  I think the best would be to go with friends and split everything.  So you are able TRY EVERYTHING.

title: Beautiful
content: Very beautiful garden. Interesting to tour the old home and gardens. Sing were in English so it helped to explain what I was seeing.

title: Huge place, need a few hours!
content: The Yu Garden is huge! First, you go through a big shopping area where you can get souveniers, clothes, etc.

title: Lovely but so crowded
content: We were on tour of the country and Shanghai was our last stop. We were brought here by a local guide. The gardens are really beautiful but so many people were there during the late morning on a Thursday! We were moved through at a rather quick pace and I did enjoy seeing it, just would have appreciated more time.

title: Quiet within the madness
content: The Yu Garden is within a market and well worth the cost to see it.

title: China’s Chinatown
content: Best place to shop around for Chinese style tschochkes, silk scarves and snacks, but seemingly overlooked was a delightful tea service in the tea house at the center of the complex. You can freely walk right in, order up your favorite tea, and they give you little snacks with it, while you rise above the activity of the streets and look out at the traditional architecture, in view of the modern skyline as well. A park that leads from the area to the waterfront has now been built, making access easy, and pleasant.

title: A must-see if you visit Shanghai
content: The Yu Garden is absolutely stunning. A must see if you go to Shanghai. Take a leisurely walk through the numerous sections and enjoy the tranquility. Children will love the nooks and crannies that they can explore and the gorgeous fish pond. Its large so leave at least 1-1.5 hrs to see it proprrly.

title: Yu Garden Shaghai
content: We took a walking tour with our guide Celine, courtesy of Jenny's Tours in Shanghai. One of the sites we visited was the exquisite centuries' old Yu, or Yuyuan, Garden. Despite the thousands of tourist visiting there everyday, it still is a "must see and do". It's described as a "an extensive Chinese garden located beside the City God Temple in the northeast of the Old City of Shanghai, and abuts the the very popular Yuyuan Tourist Mart". Try and get there before the crowds do - maybe that's possible in the morning.

title: Beautiful gardens. Big crowds.
content: It almost goes without saying that there are crowds here, as it is in Shanghai. I visited when the decorations for the Chinese New Year and Lantern festival were up in the tourist mart. Gorgeous. Great photo opportunities. There are basically three “layers” to this area. There are tons of tourist shops outside the walled Tourist Mart area. There is the tourist mart. And then there is Yu Gardens. It took me a bit of wandering about to finally get to the actual entrance to the garden. There’s a small fee to tour the garden but worth a few rmb to see the beautiful architecture and plants. Take your camera and your patience.

title: An ancient oasis
content: Yuyuan Garden is another destination to visit in Shanghai. Also called "the old town" has been completely renovated in style, today it has become a typical tourist center to visit with many shops and restaurants offering a variety of merchandise and food. Inside it is located an ancient residence with a wonderful Chinese garden, and can be accessed by paying a ticket of a few RMB. A nice maze of small narrow streets, made even more 'tight by weekend tourists. An ancient oasis in the heart of the capital of modernity, a journey through time between past and future.

title: A beautiful walk in a busy city
content: The Yu Gardens are such a beautiful escape from the busy market and city streets. We visited this location with a private local guide, and it is the way to go. You can walk at your own pace and enjoy the knowledge shared about its history. Alternatively, you can easily see this location on your own and enjoy it simply for its beauty.

title: Good night out
content: Ended up here for dinner and had a 20 mins wait. Used this to walk around and soaking in some touristy fun - clicking pictures and finding our way through a mad rush of people. Amazing light up and very traditional. Must for all visiting the City to see some tradition and cultural stuff.

title: Just another garden you have to see
content: If you have visited other gardens in China or Japan you would probably be disappointed. But since this is one of the landmarks of SH and it is in the Middle of “old” SH it is full of tourists so go and visit othervise you will think that you missed something important, but you wouldn’t.

title: Absolutely gorgeous
content: We loved Yuyuan Garden -- what a beautiful site. It was quite crowded so not as peaceful as I would have liked, but still a lovely place to explore. Be sure to take note of the architectural details and don't miss the theater area.

title: Yu Mustn't Miss This...
content: Our second time at Yu Gardens was as good as the first. These are beautifully laid out and constructed gardens that look a little different depending on the way you walk ~ a sign of a well designed garden in my book. 40 RMB entrance fee is well worth it and there is a peacefulness to it even when it is crowded. The shopping extravaganza that is just outside the walls of the garden caters from trinkets to high end clothing.

title: Buzzy area
content: Nice area with shops and old style temple buildings. Did not actually go in the garden as long queues at ticket counter. But walked the zigzag bridge which is free. Do go early to avoid crowds, anywhere in China.

title: Beautiful but ridiculously crowded
content: The garden was beautiful, divided into many rooms, each with a different feel. Husband said it reminded him of IKEA! So many people though made it the opposite of restful and peaceful but we have some really beautiful photographs of the buildings, carvings and designs. Last entry is at 4 .30pm. miles of bazaar before you get to the gardens with some great food outlets

title: Scammed nicely
content: It was my first time in Shanghai. I met a colleague from Austria, we are working in the same company, but different countries. We decide to visit the Yu Garden, later the Pearl Tower. We arrived one day before, but we stay in different Hotels. Our meeting point was the Bund than we were walking to the Yu Garden together. In the mean time we were talking about the Nanjing Rd. and the many scammers how are offering watches, bags, massage or sex services on the next street or not far away from the Nanjing Rd. Also you can find a lot of reviews about this topic on the internet.

title: Spend half day at least
content: Yes, it is very kitschy Chinese but everything is here. Roam around and seek out the goodies. Bought ginseng stuff on the 2nd floor ( the whole floor is the medicinal products ). More shopping across the old building across the station, they do better prices here.

title: A foretaste of Suzhou
content: Lots of hidden pathways to little gardens. Good for a quick feel and right in the middle of thriving market. Food at the market was like a mix between tapas and buffet in style but not flavour. Easy to take too many plates!

title: Beautiful gardens
content: A must place to visit while in Shanghai. The architecture surrounding the garden is very quaint. Walking in the garden also transports you to the Ming Dynasty.

title: Beautiful well maintained gardens
content: Beautiful well maintained gardens with lovely Bonsai around the place, gives a feeling of peace and tranquility , though like all the attractions in China, very crowded with people all around but really enjoyed the time spent here

title: Lovely Garden
content: A bit crowded, but quite lovely. We were lucky as a small opera group was there and we were allowed to watch them perform. There were not as many flowers as I would have liked but I was there in early March and I understand not much has bloomed at this time. There were birds in the gardens and as an avid birdwatcher this was one of the only places I visited that I was not disappointed by lack of bird activity. This is a lovely area in an otherwise bustling, high rise, constantly being built city. I was told a new sky scraper goes up every day in Shanghai. There is a population of 24 million in Shanghai ( California the most populate US state has 27 million in the entire state and Missouri has 6 million for comparison). Shanghai feels like 24 million.

title: Went Twice
content: The price is kinda steep. 40 yuan. The place is beautiful and vast. I highly enjoyed walking through. It gets very, very crowded so try to get there early. Even on week days.

user_loc: 新罕布什尔州埃克塞特
title: Facinating Garden in a Small Space
content: The garden is behind the Chengaung Miao BaZoar and surrounded by the modern city. It is a interlude of peace. It contains many old buildings of beautiful design. There are walkways, bridges, ponds, treek and flowers.

title: Lovely garden
content: If you like gardens this is a must. Totally different from European gardens. In the middle of the old Chinese part of the city. You feel that your are miles away from the noise of Shanghai

title: Crowded, But Nice
content: I am not a huge flower/plant person, so maybe I am biased, but all of the gardens kind of ran together after a while. Very nice, but hard to enjoy what is meant to be serene with crowds of people.

title: Photogenic oasis
content: Pleasantly surprised with the serene landscape and architectural combination in this quiet garden. The meandering paths and buildings were still quiet and beautiful though thronging with tourists. People tended to be more polite than outside the garden, waiting for others to take unobstructed photos among flowering trees, ornate lattice walls, Dr Seuss like carved stone and clear reflecting waters teaming with a beautiful array of unique koi and sunbathing turtles on the shoreline stones.

title: Beautiful garden and picturesque. Getting to the garden is a hassle
content: We visited this place on a Sunday. Inside the garden, it is really pretty , peaceful and picturesque. Plenty of photos opportunities. It can get crowded at times. However getting into the garden is a hassle. It is very crowded and please be careful with your possessions. It really reminded me of going to Ikea on a weekend.

title: It was super crowded, beyond crowded
content: We came here to visit the tea houses and enjoy some Shanghai dim sum, thinking that we would stop by the Garden. Well, it was impossible to get in. With the crowds squishing and squashing at our fronts and backs. We did get a really good late lunch, nonetheless. The whole area is a good place to visit where you won't go hungry; however, finding a toilet might be a challenge.

title: Knew it would be busy on a Saturday
content: The zigzag bridge was heaving but if you worked your way towards the rail and looked outward and put in earplugs you could sense some of what was intended. Away from that bridge the rest of the gardens were more tranquil and less crowded. The little pavilions and ponds were very photogenic and the dragon wall charming. The bazaar outside is madness so enjoy a quiet contemplative moment before rejoining the throng outside.

title: Classic historic Chinese garden
content: Take a step back in time and enjoy the beauties of this well-planned historic garden. The winding paths, the rock walls the many historic buildings and beautiful furniture all lead to a wonderful time. Expect a crowd this is a very popular place. There are many restaurants in gift shops in the area.

title: cater at least 2 hours
content: the gardens are huge. I went with a guide and there was just so much to learn about culture and history from the garden - the sculptures, plants, architecture, garden layout, furniture. A very enjoyable destination. Can get quite crowded, plan to get there early morn or late aftn n give yourself 2 hours for a leisurely exploratory experience

title: Beautiful but crowded
content: I visited on a Sunday and the crowds were overwhelming! However it was a nice place to visit and view the amazing gardens. Some areas weren’t open to the public.

title: Traditional and crowded
content: It’s a must to walk through Yu Garden, especially when you are new to Shanghai. Its traditional buildings and the street food is a big part of the Chinese culture. Pay the extra fee and walk into the garden on the middle of Yu Garden, it’s worth it.

title: Very crowded but interesting
content: Hard to comprehend the number of people who visit this place. However it does some have some interesting buildings. A ‘volunteer ‘ showed us a very nice tea house on the 3rd or 4th floor of one of the buildings which was definitely a great place to visit to get away from the crowds and still get a good view looking down on the area. I wouldn’t recommend it for shopping as it is just too crowded.

title: Fake bamboo
content: It is not a garden but a courtyard. The buildings are beautiful but come on, plastic bamboo trees???

title: Classic Chinese architecture
content: Enjoyed my visit to the garden and the Tea House. First time was during New Years but I don’t recommend that. Incredibly busy. Other times were very pleasant.

title: Bustling historical area!
content: The Yu Gardens is a beautiful courtyard garden with teahouse in the heart of the pond in the garden. There many large jade and jewellery shops at the entrance of Yu Gardens. The grounds are large, and full of small shops that sells all things Chinese, including nick-nacks. It’s good fun place to just explore and spend an evening.

title: Crowded place
content: I do not recommend this place especially on weekends or at the afternoon.you will find thousands of people here and you can hardly make a picture of anything while walking around but I believe this garden is beautiful when there is only a few people around.

title: Good not great
content: Decent example of a traditional Chinese garden but with absolutely phenomenal crowds - and I went on a Tuesday in March. There's a huge bazaar next door selling xiaolongbao etc but the queues are insane around normal mealtimes.

title: Very nice
content: This is one of the larger gardens in Shanghai, it is very peaceful even though there might be a large crowd. It is a lovely walk passing several pagodas and archways between each section. Hundreds of different types of Coe carps. Well worth the visit.

title: Hey lady...Want a watch or bag
content: I guess if you want a watch or a bag this would be a good thing. If you want to haggle for prices on counterfeit merchandise, go for it. This is the place. I am happy with my Apple Watch so I found this annoying....and they don’t take no. But it was an interesting area...definitely worth the visit, just not the haggle for me.

title: Looks nice
content: We stayed here for a while just to see the fishes and turtless in the pond. There was a lot of people at the same time, so place seems to be very popular but again its shanghai there is a lot of people in this city

title: Beautiful
content: .. and slightly over rated. The queue for the tickets was long, many people, still worth the short visit.

title: Too crowded and aggressive sellers
content: I walked to the Yu Garden from the Waldorf Astoria on the Bund. It was only about half a mile so very close. As soon as you start getting close the local shop owners are all over you. I was clearly a tourist and traveling alone so it got overwhelming. I just wanted a nice Sunday walk. You have to walk down side streets lined with stores to get to the entrance of the garden. I went around 10 a.m. and it was already packed with people. I finally got to the entrance and it was literally a parking lot of people pushing their way in and out. Crowds like this are not for me so I gave up and left.

title: Actually a garden in a food and stall area
content: Interesting and something we did on our first day. It is very compact and you can see a lot of things in one place which would be great if you didn't have much time in Shanghai. The use of water in gardens is unique and being spring the blossoms and trees were all coming out. You can feel the peace in these gardens which were made by wealthy people using a lot of labour a long time ago. They were made to be walked in and viewed from different pavilions and angles. Rocks are always a big part of the gardens as are water lillies which don't come up until summer.

title: Quiet place in the noisy city
content: The garden is an island of quiet and peace in the old heart of the noisy city. And you can also explore narrow streets in the nearby. Both worth a visit.

title: Beautiful
content: Very highly recommended for all visitors.

title: Yu garden
content: This place is too much crowded but again a must visit to get the feel of chinese architecture in the modern city of shanghai. U can shop souvenirs ( this area is flooded with shops ) and enjoy the mini pond and fountain. Good for cliking pictures. Honestly i only had a Häägen Dazs belgium chocolate abd headed toward bund area via the central park just near to it

title: Yu Yuan Garden
content: The Garden was inside the Yu Yuan Street. Beautiful with landscape garden. Not all parts was open at that time. 3 area was under renovation. Need a tourist guide to assist you where to go cause its like a maze. You didnt know if you went to all of the part of the garden.

title: Crowded
content: This place is beautiful. A garden in the old town of Shanghai. The downside is that everybody goes there making the place sooooo crowded.

title: Beautiful
content: A lovely garden worth the trip to see. Tranquil with something lovely to see around every corner. The Bonsai garden is spectacular.

title: 300 years old plus.
content: Very interesting garden with a great use of rocks. Lots of interesting things to see. We were with a guide that helped a lot to explain things about the garden and culture.

title: Beautiful
content: Walked through Yu Garden today. Very beautiful, very restful - in the midst of huge Shanghai, a nice retreat. Great glimpses to what traditional Chinese architecture was.

title: Yu Yuan Garden
content: I was in the area twice. Didnt know that the garden is inside the YuYuan street. Some of the area were closed when we went there. Love the landscape, the garden and old house. Didnt love the idea that new houses were build beside them. But then I enjoy my vacation here. Love the weather and place. A little too crowded at the start.

title: Beautiful respite
content: Our tour here was enjoyable enough but it was very crowded which made the narrow spaces difficult to navigate with kids.

title: Yu Garden crowded but nice
