content: Walking around this garden is a treat. It has so many little nooks with special plantings, you can wander for hours.

title: Great location
content: The yu gardens are very busy but a good location to see a sense of old Shanghai. The dumpling shop is very crowded but quality is great

title: Crowded
content: Nice place to visit but mostly commercial selling cheap souvenirs. There are some good photo ops here.

title: Nice 👍
content: Very pleasant garden and frenetic market tucked into the area. Go early to beat the crowds. Plenty of food options. Not that different than the water towns or old cities, so balance your itinerary to avoid too many of the same led cities.

title: Excellent Model of Classical Chinese Gardening Architecture
content: It is indeed an excellent model of classical chinese gardening architecture as described on the stone engraving at the entrance to the garden. Yu garden is the only chinese garden in the heart of the city not far from the bund. First time visitors to a chinese classical garden will be thoroughly impressed by the ponds, caves, trees and the pavilions.

title: Plan During the Week
content: Plan your trip to the Yu Garden during the week when the crowds are thinner. Just as easily a place that you could spend multiple hours as you could a short stroll. Rich cultural displays and exhibits, as well as opportunities for sketching, painting, photography, or just quietly reading.

title: A taste of old Shanghai in the heart of the city
content: A small hidden gem in the heart of the city.  Traditional style gardens, impressive architecture and wonderful views.  A must visit when in Shanghai.

title: Yu Garden
content: Even more beautiful in the rain.  Leaves and paths glistening and such a peaceful place.  Wish we had more time here!

title: Great night walk
content: We didn't get chance to walk around during the day, but the night bazaar around the garden was definitely a lovely thing to do in the evening. Beautiful traditional Chinese architecture all around, and very intriguing market shops where it is only customary to barter prices upwards of 50% off the initial asking price (anything less and you definitely got ripped off)

title: Interesting gardern
content: An interesting garden divided into six areas with something different to see at every turn. You'll need a couple of hours to wander round. The architecture recreates an atmosphere from the past. A busy tourist attraction but worth a visit.

title: Halfway House!
content: Great idea to have a super speed train right from the arrival terminal only to end up miles away from the centre. It's fine if you don't have heavy luggage or if you are young and agile to continue on the MRT but to take a taxi to your final destination was not easy and a long que, a long wait and a long way!

title: A Glimpse of old Shanghai
content: Shanghai with all its modern architecture, Yu Gardens gives a glimpse of old Shanghai and China. Extremely busy but well worth visiting with its beautiful buildings.

title: A green oasis in the middle of the city
content: One would never suspect such quiet wonder next to the bustling shopping area. The garden is beautifully designed and preserved. With small sections separated form each other by walls and stone structures seems much smaller than it really is. Proves that old Chinese were really good in landscaping in setting up gardens

title: A beautiful garden
content: Although the place was quite crowded it offered a calm area when coming out from Chinatown. There are beautyful areas of the garden that are worth resting a few minutes

title: Nice place
content: Lovely gardens and interesting surrounding areas.  Remarkable to think this was all put together when it was.  Nice interaction between buildings, water and plants

title: Delightful
content: Quaint old world charm. Its worth a visit. Some lovely restaurants. Shopping is well priced. The 9 cnr bridge is a good photo opportunity for something traditional

title: Worth visiting for the Chinese architecture
content: Entrance fee of 40 RMB. Garden was quite big and you could spend maybe an hour or two strolling and chilling. Worth visiting if you have the time.

title: Magical hidden wonder
content: Found this place on the map decided to catch the metro there as we had time to kill, what a great decision . It did take a bit to find as entry was hidden away in a walled market place. Once in the place was like a maze of great buildings, bridge walk ways , history and trees . Some of the buildings contained shops which gave you a break for a bit. We went in the morning round 9.30 which seemed a good time to go as no tour groups had arrived yet . We left just after 11am and was getting rather busy .

title: Busy Saturday
content: Yes, crowded, but still worth a visit. Shops, though I did not show. The nine turn bridge over pond moved like the 405 during rush hour. The architecture is beautiful and I was lucky to visit on a sunny moderate day. One week after national holiday, but the weekend crowd made moving a bit difficult. Still, a must visit.

title: Nice place, but way to much people here
content: It's a nice garden to visit, but it would be much nicer if there wasn't so many people here; this way it looses most of it's charm.

title: very interesting Garden surrounded by rebuild old chinese architectural Tourist Centre
content: Coming from Renmin Road it is quite an experience to see this packed with Chinese ornaments Centre in the middle of a modern City. When you enter and walk across the zig zag bridge you need to make your way through a very commercialised shopping area that still hides some jems, However, heading for the old imperial gardens is quite an experience. Take time to really enjoy the attention to detail in the gardens and think about the historical grounds you are visiting. So many beautiful scenes, the bridges, the inner places, the buildings, the lake, river-like pedicured. I really enjoyed spending time there and look into the details, even the finish of the roofs or the Dragon Sculptures on the wall tops to cap them off.

title: Fake fake fake
content: Don't expect to go in and see anything if any authenticity. This place in its entirety looks like it was botched together about 10 years ago.

title: Nice but really crowded
content: The garden is lovely to see but suggest you go early to afford you the experience without a crowd of people. There were times when we could not even move because of the large number of tour groups. There is a nice gift shop that has many hand made items. They wrapped everything in bubble wrap to help with the trip home. There are some steps involved and areas that are not wheelchair accessible. You should then walk through the Old Shanghai area and enjoy the delicious street food.

title: Its very ordinary
content: It's very ordinary place, it does not look very authentic rather touristy. The street in front of the garden is quite popular for souvenirs. I believe the entry fee was too high for the sights offered.

title: Heaven for shopping
content: Yuyuan has the garden and shopping area. The garden is beautiful like in Chinese historical movie, but the crowd make it harder to explore more. If you had more time, it will be better, so you can enjoy each spot longer.

title: Turn back time
content: A must visit when in Shanghai. This circa 1500 garden is just a delight. Best early to avoid crowds, it will not disappoint. Tranquil, beautiful, and feels like you've stepped back in time - something like a movie scene. Well worth a visit.

title: Go early!
content: A lovely Classical Chinese garden, with fish pools, lovely buildings, dragon mosaics and more. Entry is 40rmb and you can easily spend 1-2 hours wondering about. But - at the weekend it does get busy by 11.00am , we enjoyed an early visit and were happy to move on.

title: Living Old Shanghai
content: Yu Garden or known as Yu Yuan is the unique complex in Shanghai where you can see the well preserved and restored historical architecture. It is in a very central location. The area is called garden but it is full of buildings serving as restaurants and shops today. There is a small pond and a garden now. Probably it had a greater garden fields in the past. It is one of the historical landmarks of Shanghai. It is free of charge to visit the area.

title: Peaceful Gardens
content: These peaceful gardens in Shanghai are a must see. I found the Yu Gardens far more attractive and beautiful than the Lingering Gardens in Suzhou. The ying yang and the balance of design are inspiring making this a lovely destination to read, write, or draw and a great place to relax.

title: arguably the best attraction in shanghai
content: shanghai with its 30million inhabitants may not have so many tourist attractions but this one is unique and really nice. just get a taxi or get a guide to take you round. tip, some taxis can rip you off but other goverment taxis are straight as a die, get your hotel to advise.

title: Happy Fish in the middle of Shanghai
content: A really impressive Chinese garden in the heart of the old town area of Shanghai, where the four component elements of buildings, plants, water and rock are laid out in a fascinating way around several distinct areas of this garden. Covering 20,000 square meters there are six main scenic areas of the garden , namely the Sansui Hall, Wanhua Chamber, Dianchun Hall, Huijing Hall, Yuhua Hall with its so named exquisite Jade rock, and the Inner Garden.

title: Great piece of history
content: A very nice place to visit even if getting tickets can be a bit of hassle. The garden is huge and full of many plants, mini temples and installationas showcasing calligraphy and other arts. A great break from the otherwise concrete city and a welcome bit of history.

title: Beautiful Yu Garden
content: If you like well manicured gardens, peaceful setting and just a joyful place to visit this is fantastic. No one is trying to sell you anything, just let your self relax. I'm not sure what the price is because we were on a private tour, but after all the busyness going on the the city is is nice to find someplace to unwind.

title: NICE CHINESE GARDEN
content: Worth a visit if you're in the area, quite  a lot to see in  tranquil surroundings. One or two shops selling usual tourist things.

title: Beautiful!!
content: This is a must see if you have any interest in gardens or Chinese architecture. We had very little interest in either but our guide strongly recommended it and I'm so glad she did. It is just beautiful and has a wonderful history to it. It is also right next to some wonderful shopping and food areas.

title: Fantastic
content: Great to see, and learn the history, great shoping and food and bars close by, a must see , snapshot of old china

title: Connecting with history
content: Always a great experience to explore something with almost 500 years of history. A real treasure buried deep in the heart of Shanghai.

title: Beautiful spot
content: This place is very crowded on weekends but we decided to give it a try. Very beautiful, and cozy. You can also buy small gifts for family and friends with a good price. There is a small pond and ducks, so great to be there!

title: Exquisite, Tranquil, Historic, and Beautiful - What More Could You Want?
content: I rate The Yuyuan Garden with five stars. It was one of my favorite attractions in Shanghai. Super tranquil, beautiful, and full of history. Truly, it felt like you were walking through a different century. The garden is large, so I recommend taking your time and enjoying everything there is to see.

title: One of the best for me
content: I really enjoy this gardens it’s like a gem hidden in the concrete jungle of Shanghai with all the skyscrapers and roads, very traditional and relaxing place to be.

title: Tranquility
content: Visited the garden which is relaxing and interesting. You need to study the Chinese model of a garden quite different from European gardens. The use of rocks creats a surprisingly effective landscape

title: A trip through ancient time!
content: This place is a bit difficult to find. It's in the middle of the busy shopping area. Once inside it's like being in the ancient world of China. This was the former home of the an upperclass nobleman. There are gardens, ponds, and rooms...its a maze! Go early as it does get crowded and you won't be able to really get the feel of this serene place. Of course there is gift shop inside....just bargain or get your souvenir in the shopping area outside of this place.

title: Culture Wise
content: one of the best place to visit in Shanghai. lots of chinese though...but you'll survive.

title: Disneyland
content: All the buildings are renovated, Yuyuan is in the middle of the skyscraper and it feels like "disneyland garden". Full of people during week-end, with Mc Donald's, KFC & co around. If you want authentic, don't go there

title: Serenity In A Big City
content: This five acre park is nestled in Old Shanghai and is an oasis. The park includes beautiful ponds, pagodas and landscaping that will make you forget you are in the middle of a huge city. Go early to enjoy this treasure as it gets very busy later in the day. Don't forget to take in the street bazaar at the entrance of the park - it is also a jewel!

title: A good respite from the city
content: We forgot we are still in the middle of the city. Theres lots of places to sit as you wander around from ponds to ponds, bridge and pavillion. Sitting in the shade and watching the kois and chat was relaxing. The place is picturesque too and the photos came out grear

title: beautiful
content: The most beautiful garden I've seen so far. It was a rainy day when I went there, but the rain wasn't so heavy, so it only gave an extra charm to the place. :)

title: a new idea around every corner
content: Do get a map - don't go in a group- the garden courtyards are quite small and when there was a group they just clogged pathways, but we just took a diversion and (not being in a hurry) just meandered through - so worth the effort of finding it.

title: Very pretty, but lots of people
content: This historic garden is right in the heart of Old Shanghai, an area teaming with tons of locals and tourists. The gardens are very popular and can be crowded, but they are beautiful. This is not the type of garden I normally think of. There are no fields of flowers or anything like that. Instead, there are rocks, ponds, buildings, and old trees in a relatively small, compact area.

title: Pretty gardens, busy
content: These gardens are very pretty and worth the 40 RMB entrance fee. In the early November weather it was nice to walk around and enjoy the cool, dry air. The drawback is that on Sunday they were very busy. The area surrounding them was crazy in places!! You could barely move. Anyway, I spent about an hour there and it was enough. If you want to eat, there is a lot of local and delicious looking food all around the area just outside the gardens. They are easy to reach by metro and make for beautiful photos.

title: Historical spot in the city.
content: Feel the history of China and enjoy the taste of dumpling at a famous dumpling restaurant inside the garden. It's in the city and not far from the center of the city. 2~3 hours should be good enough for a short tour to this place. Enjoy.

title: The crowds are as large as prefucted
content: I think I would have been able to appreciate this garden better if there were less people there. The structures were lovely. I particularly loved the ancient furniture in one of the buildings

title: Way too crowded for my liking
content: I really still do not know what exactly we went to see there. It is basically a market place in old Chinese temple like buildings. Lots of street food and other items being sold.

user_loc: 英国特伦特河畔斯托克
title: Unexpected.
content: In such a packed city it was strange to visit these 'private' gardens. Some lovely old buildings and nice areas of trees and ponds with some of the biggest 'goldfish' I've ever seen. But it was very busy due to national holiday so maybe it's better in quieter times.

title: Striking example of a traditional garden
content: Right in the middle of the bustling centre is this marvellous old Chinese garden - actually more of a park.

title: Price crazy high for what they offer
content: Super crowded on the golden week but we don't complain about this rather than for the unreasonable high price you have to pay for getting into the garden... Half the price should be OK.

title: Interesting
content: A nice garden to stroll around and have a look, though it’s confusing as there isn’t any real signs pointing you in the direction to go. This can be difficult to navigate if not part of a tour group.

title: Avoid weekends and public holidays
content: Definitely avoid weekends or any public holiday because it will be super crowded and you won't get to enjoy the garden. It's not very big garden but a lot to see. You can easily spend half a day here. The interesting attraction is the dragon on the roof, with big dragon head and body on the long roof. See if you can spot it.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: These gardens are an easy walk from The Bund and are very beautiful. They are quite busy but you can take your time getting around them. The ponds full of fish and turtles are gorgeous and lovely to sit by for photos. The area around the gardens is bustling so they are a little peaceful haven right in the middle of these bright light and noisy bizarres.

title: Avoid at the weekend!!!! Far too busy
content: We made the mistake of visiting this place at mid day on a Saturday and actually found it quite hard to find the Gardens given that the Market surrounding it was absolutely rammed with people. You could hardly move, and when we thought we had found an entrance we discovered it was in fact an exit and had to fight our way through the crowds again to the entrance. Many reviews say go early, or mid week and I can't recommend this enough. I'm sure the Gardens are lovely but by the time we got in and walked about a bit we just wanted to get out of there. Lovely buildings and gardens but way too many people.

title: Reproduction buidings
content: Shopping and crowds is what you will encounter in Yu Garden. The buildings are built to look like authentic Chinese, but some say they are "knock off" buildings! We were there during National Holiday, so it was really too crowded to enjoy.

title: it's ok to high rated for a commercial place !!
content: Nice place but to commercial specially during the Chinese days holidays always crowded ! the place it's historic and nice but it's to commercial !!

title: Aberage
content: After touring Beijing and xi’an, this was just an average garden. It was raining, so we rushed through it and felt we saw enough. Definitely not stroller friendly.

title: Beautiful
content: Yu Garden is lovely and very serene. Well worth a visit as this place feels very tranquil and special. A must visit.

title: Fascinating
content: Shanghai is a very metropolitan and modern city.  The gardens provide a glimpse of more historic China.   A great place to walk through to shop and eat some authentic Chinese food.

title: Quaint n clean
content:
Very peaceful and calm garden
The koi pond is beautiful and right outside the garden there r good place for dimsum

title: Lovely
content: What a lovely relaxing beautiful spot ti get away from the hustle and bustle of Shanghai.  Take a stroll through the park when you are going to or from the market area.  There is a place to enjoy a drink too.

title: An oasis of calm in the big city!
content: On our recent tour of China We spent six days Shanghai and particularly loved this beautiful garden which is quintessentially Chinese. Even though it was busy during our visit, there was a sense of serenity. We could have spent hours soaking in the calm atmosphere and being amazed by the huge Coy Carp.

title: Very Interesting Gardens
content: The gardens can get crowded at times but they are worth a look anyway. Nice rock gardens and an interesting history. It was good to have a local guide that explained the gardens and avoided the shops and market .

title: If only it didn't rain!
content: A really beautiful garden, ponds, fish, sculptures and pretty rooms. We would have spent more time there but were soaked. Please don't miss it if the weather is good.

title: beautiful!
content:
this was a stunning day out, so much history. Truly magical!!
Was very busy and lots of touristy shops for food and souvenirs before you get into the actual gardens.
Easy to get to from the subway

title: Beautiful setting
content: Visited this garden in Shanghai with friends. It was quite crowded with foreign and Chinese tourists even on a weekday afternoon. It is still possible to find a quiet spot to enjoy the trees, ponds and bridges.

title: Beautiful garden
content: This villa set up on a lakeside by a business man in the past. He created an entrancing garden , very picturesque and peaceful, a classic garden. Very few tourists there, more locals.

title: Tourist Shopping
content: If it's your first time to Shanghai, Yu Garden should be on your list to do. It's a nice walk around with many shops and restaurants.

title: Beautiful example of a classic Chinese garden
content: We visited with a private guide, which was helpful to understand and appreciate this classic Chinese garden.

title: Must see garden in Shanghai
content: The gardens are very nice. Unfortunately we went there on the first day of the golden week. There were loads of people, 99% of them were Chinese, so it means a lot of pushing and unfriendly behavior...

title: Excellent place for eating and shopping
content: Great place for eating. You can see duck pancakes being made and have 4 small ones for less than £1 - excellent and fresh.

title: Beautiful place, but many tourists
content: It is a quite beautiful place if you're into old chinese buildings and gardens, but there's a lot of tourists. If you've been to Suzhou and seen the gardens there, then this isn't really that impressive, but still nice.

title: Re: Family w/older kids
content:
Very pleasant. End of Sept didn't see that much flowers but very nice landscape! 
The bldg's & architecture amazing w/details. Another must see.

title: Yet another iconic garden but nothing new to many otherts
content: Sadly there is little to stand this garden apart from the others in the region (we visited 4 in 3 days). The rock formations are great and the bridges are similar to many of the others

title: A Haven in the City
content: Not a peaceful haven. As it is attached to a busy tourist shopping hotspot it receives many visitors, some of whom would be looking just for photo opportunities. But it is an interesting historical creation featuring many rock enhanced plantings and numerous buildings. Fascinating dragon sculptures illustrate it as an ex royal residence and as such we thought there is some similarity with a part of the Forbidden City in Beijing.

title: Touristy and too busy
content: This Yu Garden was high on our list before we visited, and it turned out to be a bit disappointing. Simply too many tourists, you could not even walk properly in the alleys as they always will be some people want to push through the crowd. Still a nice Chinese garden, well maintained, and we also did wait in line for the famous Xiao Long Bao (Soup dumpling). The dimpling was alright but given the cheap price, it is of great value!

title: Beautiful gardens
content: This is a beautiful and tranquil park in bustling Shanghai and well worth taking the time to see. Despite being crowded, the place felt peaceful and the combination of water and plant features made for a beautiful environment. I thoroughly enjoyed these gardens and could happily have sat here and absorbed the atmosphere for much longer. Worth seeing.

title: Nice park and pavilions
content: This is a place where you can see how Shanghai used to be. There are many shops and restaurants nearby where you can find some souvenirs and typical Chinese food. Also, it can be very crowded since it is a popular tourist attraction.

title: Little Gem
content: Spend two hours in the garden. Just exploring all the hidden places around. I could feel the old spirit. This place gives you so much energy and it definitely calms you down. There is a bit of history there too.

title: Lots of tourists
content: This place is a "must-go" place for a lot of tour groups so it can be very very crowded. You can have a feel of old shanghai garden architecture here. You can also get some good buys here especially souvenirs and snacks. But it is nanxiang steamed bun that makes us go twice!

title: Avoid This Place Especially on Weekends
content: You may want to come and experience old Shanghai, but hold these urges in check and avoid the place unless you can come very, very early in the morning...Otherwise the place is mobbed and you will have a hard time even walking around....There are many other better places to visit in Shanghai and the surrounding areas.

title: Nice quiet retreat
content: Peaceful with excellent food and shopping nearby. Lovely ponds and pavilions. Gets crowded after 10 AM. Nearby shopping areas are fun and don't forget to haggle and drive a good bargain.

title: Lively; varied and colourful - China in one stop
content: Well-worth a visit. This is very much a tourist place and not only for foreigners, but also very popular amongst Chinese from all over the country. Despite this, it never feels like a rip off.

title: Very crowded but okay
content: With a visit.   My 2nd time in 3 years.  Some decent food stalls.   You can skip it though if your schedule is tight.

title: One of the Best Gardens
content: This garden is definitely worth having a look at. Don't expect tranquility due to the shoulder to shoulder crowds. There are toilets in the garden complex. It is a good rainy day activity due to the number of pavilions. But if wet expect slippery conditions on the paths.

title: Peaceful
content: Very pretty with some interesting history.  Pretty inside the garden but outside there are many touristy shops.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚曼哈顿海滩
title: So old, so historic and so cool
content: The greatest experiance that I had at this inceredible garden is that when I was there on a semi rainy, misty day in January was that I was the only Westerner there which I found as very intriguing and a first for me in my 47 years of living. Words cannot describe this place and I will end by saying you have to see this place when in Shanghai.

title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful gardens that gave a true perception of the local culture, style and way of life. Worth a visit while in the city.

title: Not that impressive
content: Walked around the gardens without a tour. Didn't seem all that really, I was expecting some more from the views, took me about 30mins to get through it. If you're short on time, don't worry about needing to come here.

title: Yu garden
content: Absolutely beautiful and well worth the time.  Lovely ponds, gardens and buildings.  Easy area to walk around

title: Ordinary
content: Its not a good attraction for visiting. An ordinary and small garden. You can see more better than this attraction in other parts of shanghai. there is a good starbucks for buying cofee and juice in this place.

title: Nice garden in busy city
content: Short but sweet walk though garden.  Great photo ops.  Oasis in busy city.   Next to good shopping area.

title: Tranquil
content: Come here to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Quiet waters, lovers, families all enjoying the serenity of this park.

title: Shanghai's Tranquil Yuyuan Garden
content: The Yuyuan Garden is a beautiful, tranquil location near Shanghai's waterfront district, the Bund, a pleasant green space with ancient buildings, lush plantings, flowing water, and significant rocks that tell a story.

title: Stunning Garden
content: If you want to see a spectacular garden in old world style this is the place.  Beautiful design and interesting architecture.

title: Garden in the City
content: We decided to tour around Shanghai using the traditional Hop on Hop off bus routes which were a lot of fun! A number of escorted trips went to Yu Gardens which turned out to be right in the centre of the city so we got off to have a look. They are beautifully laid out gardens with many ornate buildings, temples etc and boast a magnificent pool which is brimming with Koi carp of all colours. Definitely worth getting off the bus to explore :-)

title: Wonderfull place
content: Wonderfull place in the middle of the big city with a long history. Surely worth a visit when you're in Shanghai ! Entrance price was only 40rmb.

title: Stunning
content: so beautiful, i recommend going with a group or guide as it's so big and like a maze to walk around!

user_loc: 明尼苏达明尼阿波利斯
title: Really busy
content: Was there on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  It's an interesting piece of history.  Some beautiful scenery.  Lots of people.

title: Holiday on Sunday
content: Great shopping on the side streets. No problems and easy to negotiate with the sellers. Easy walking distance to the bund from the Yu Garden.

title: Fast train trip on magnetic train
content: We did a trip to the airport and back on this train and was really worth the experience. Runs over a magnetic track and no wheels . Went from a standing start to 433kph in a very short time.Did this as a part of a tour and well worth the experience.w

title: Nice Ancient House
content: It's nice one to have walks around the beautiful corridors of the house and have a morning walk and see the house of the ancient business man.

title: A must include ~ when visiting Shanghai
content: To avoid the crowds that can become overwhelming - come to see these gardens early.

title: Nice place
content: Visited this garden with friends. Un fortunately it was raining all day, so couldn't really spend enough time in the place. We had a tour guide with us who gave us a very good explanation about this garden.

title: Try to avoid the weekend
content: This would appear to be the most popular tourist attraction in Shanghai, partly because it now forms part of a massive complex of shops, built to resemble old Shanghai, but actually achieving a ghastly Disney version of China. The gardens are pleasant and interesting, but at a whopping RMB40 to see them, they're simply don't live up to the price tag. At the weekends, they are heaving with visitors, so if you can visit at a less busy time, you'll have a much better experience.

title: Historical family garden
content: One of the highly recommended tourist attraction for first timer who visited Shanghai, but I would say that it is not a place for people who don't like so much of sight-seeing.

title: Relaxing park
content: If you have time a very peaceful and relaxing park- great for local watching. Well looked after and maintained ie clean.

title: If you like overwhelming crowds . . .
content: Full disclosure - I have never actually been into the Gardens themselves. There is an admission fee, the lines are long, and I've been to plenty of Chinese formal gardens. However, the blocks surrounding the Gardens that you must pass through are packed full of touristy shops and restaurants, all housed within "reproduction" Chinese architecture. Some of the shops are interesting, but the overarching experience is one of noise and crowdedness of thousands of people, many following the yellow flags of Korean, Malaysian, or Chinese tour guides, pushing against one another in a quest to get from one place to another equally crowded place. Every tourist to Shanghai should experience it, if only to say that they have truly experienced the crowdedness of an Asian mega-city. Interesting, cultural, memorable, but not a "must do this again" experience.

title: Traditional Chinese buildings
content: One of the very few places in Shanghai where you can still see traditional Chinese style buildings. Beautiful to take pictures whether at Day or night. Quaint place to explore but best avoided on public holidays. It can get pretty crowded. Great for shopping for souvenirs but bargain hard.

title: Artistic garden architecture
content: Believed to be built in the Ming Dynasty the layout and style was intriguing. Covers a large area but understandable when over 100 people would have lived there.

title: Nice oasis in tall building city.
content: Is right next to old town shopping place. Nice little garden but can get very crowned and you have to pay to get in. If you go to suzhou in your trip you can skip this.

title: Heaven for souvenirs and knicks knacks
content: If you want to find all sorts of souvenirs from each parts of China practically you can find here !

title: Traditional China
content: A beautiful traditional garden in the middle of Shanghai!! Be warned that there are millions of local visitors during half moon festival holiday season, you will not encounter a quaint park for yourself

title: Traditional
content: We went many times with friends! If you want to see something traditional, go there. All my friends that came with us were very happy to be there.

title: Very nice historical gardens - have to do with a tour to enjoy best
content: We visited as part of a tour - we soon noticed others not having a guide had nothing to tell them what each part or building or garden setting meant. So we got a lot out of the visit as we had a guide.

title: What a beautiful part of history
content: Unfortunately it was rainy when we were there but did not distract from the incredible architecture of the buildings . Well worth a visit including surrounding markets . Great place to spend half a day

title: Beautiful Gardens and interesting surroundings, definitely worth a visit!
content: Recommend to buy tickets and go inside the gardens, very interesting! Surrounding area is great for shopping and food, and is quite beautiful at night.

title: The legacies!
content: This place is historical and full of Chinese legacies. It is in the middle of the city, and easily accessible by public transport. There is a renowned xiaolong bao restaurant there too. A must-visit place if you travel to Shanghai!

title: Beautiful
content: One of the most popular gardens in shanghai, a perfect place to enjoy the Chinese garden style, special for fang shwei.

title: Beautiful garden
content: This garden is beautiful and relaxing. Get there early. My friend and I arrived right at opening (8:30am) on a Friday morning. By 9:15am it was getting crowded. We got some amazing pics and were able to experience the serenity. The architecture was also great.

title: Not what I was expecting
content: When I visited the gardens with my tour group, it was raining heavily and there were so many people about I could hardly take any decent photos. To be honest, I thought the gardens would be a lot bigger, but they were still very pretty. Loved the koi fish and turtles swimming about in the water.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: This is one of the most beautiful gardens I've ever been in and although they don't look big on the map it does take a long time to see all the parts of it as it is a little like a maze. The entrance is a little hard to find, you have to cross the zigzag bridge and buy a ticket on the right side of the actual entrance of the garden. Although busy you can still find areas of peace and quiet in the garden. It's a beautiful array of round and square pavilions, ponds, hanging willow trees and rocky paths. There are some souvenir shops where you have to haggle and also a concert pavilion where they play classical Chinese music at regular intervals. I would definitely come back here, you can easily spend a whole day just relaxing and enjoying the gardens.

title: Wonderful
content: These gardens are not very big (so you do not get garden fatigue!) but there is so much to see. Unfortunately on the day I was there in September 2017 there were far more people that when I was there in 1990 and so it was a bit overcrowded. There is a large lively shopping/market area adjacent to the gardens as well

title: Just OK
content: I went here in the national holiday, too many people plus raining (just imagine), so it was really unpleasant. Overall, what you can see is a portrait of ancient miniature with modern touch. The park is inside the shopping area. For me, Beijing is more ancient compare to anywhere in Shanghai. So it was just ok for me.

title: China highlights
content: Visited here on the recent tour and a great experience with the tour guide Ocean Blue. Travel agency provided great service and availability as we needed.

title: Wonderful Gardens & shopping Area
content: This is a great area to visit. Wonderful Chinese style gardens worth the ticket price. Also a great shopping and eating area surrounding the garden. the place to pick up souvenirs to take home.

title: A lovely garden with some over-the-top architecture
content: Mixing history with lots of touristy shops and eateries, Yu Garden is a lovely way to spend a few hours

user_loc: 印度德里国家首都辖区
title: Shopping place
content: If you are Chinese architecture, clothes, shopping, souvenir lover this your place.

title: Exceeded my expectation
content: It was a lovely garden hidden away in the famous Cheng Huang Temple (don't know the proper English reference). Must see if you are in the area, it was worth the money.

title: A good place to buy souvenir
content: We finish our lunch in this area, then spent about 1 hour for shopping. It is a good place to walk around.

title: Great journey in history
content: 400 year old garden that is worth the visit. A must for new china visitors. It belonged to a rich family way back then. Although Not an imperial monument but very well done and designed considering the 400 year history.

title: Oasis
content: I really like this place of peace in the middle of bustle( except when it's busy!). An ancient enclave with great walls, trees and water. And the Yu Garden Renaissance close by is nice too

title: Nice, but not a "must-do"
content: I always like to begin my reviews with a disclaimer. Reviews are subjective, and the opinion is only as good as the traveler’s trust in the reviewer. So I try to provide a little information about my personal travel style so you can decide whether my opinion is relevant to you. Typically, I am not a “go and see” type traveler. I prefer interactive experiences—ie hiking, performances, or eating. Therefore, Yuyuan Gardens was never high on my “must-do” list since it mostly consists of strolling through gardens and looking around. But, I live in Shanghai and it is a tourist “must-do”, so I gave it a try.

title: Friends
content: I nice serene place with pools filled with koi, foot bridges and lovely painted wooden buildings. Lots of shopping out side this peaceful area.

title: Tranquility for the soul
content: If time permits, try and visit this place early in the day, before the hordes of visitors impact the tranquility within this ancient space. A refuge from the hustle and bustle in the rest of the city. A beautiful place to quiten your life and reflect on the soul.

title: A little bit of the old surrounded by the new
content: This is a place to see what China was like years ago. Lots of history within the building walls and very pretty and calm.

title: a good shopping and location
content: went to the gardens by metro, the food is good of various styles. the shopping is good for souvenirs etc, dont forget the the muslem at the bottom on the left for its 10rmb shops little gems can be found here.

title: Beautiful and Exquisite Garden
content: A walk in the garden can make you fell like strolling in an Ancient China Garden as reflected in the movie. There are bridges, pagodas, pavilions, sculptures, trees and flowers. Alas, there were too many people when I visited that made it less enjoyable.

title: Excellent Market
content: One of the more tourist oriented markets in Shanghai. But nestled in the middle is a lovely koi pond that's worth a look. Street food is good. Helps to know how to say "I don't want that" in mandarin!

title: HYPNOTISED
content: the most mesmerised and beautiful scenery in Shanghai,

title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful well presented gardens! A nice change when in a big built up city. The surrounding market is also lovely to stroll through. We took the subway here, lost our barings a little as it doesnt stand out where the gardens are when you exit the station but we managed to find it! Probably more by chance!

title: Busy but beautiful
content: We were in Shanghai for only 24 hours and this was one of the highlights for us and our first stop. It was quite difficult to find the entrance as we expected it to be on the main road but you had to go right into the shopping area to get in. The shopping area is quite busy but full of atmosphere and certainly worth browsing a little. You have to pay to get in to the gardens but it's worth it as they are quite beautiful. It was busy since it was the weekend but it was still lovely to see. It is bigger inside than you might imagine and quite easy to get a little lost inside. I'd say this is a must see for any visitor.

title: Worth a visit
content: These gardens have everything from pretty flowers to unusual looking rocks and statues to the most detailed architectural structures.  Nothing has been left undetailed.  Absolutely stunning.  The best by far is the fingernail painter!  A must see and a must purchase.

title: A perfectly formed garden in the heart of a Shanghai Shopping District
content: A must see so that you can relax and get away from the Shanghai heat and humidity. This provides some great shelter and some great photo opportunities as well as learning a little about Chinese history. The Coy carp and terrapins were a treat for the eyes too. Take a cold flannel to help cool yourself and go early in the morning before the crowds emerge. The shopping district is a must see and do too.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: We went close opening time (9am) and Friday morning so less crowded, it gets really busy later in the day

title: Beautiful Garden Views
content: We went in July so it was SUPER hot and humid, but we definitely enjoyed it.  The views are beautiful and there are great places to take pictures so don't forget your camera.

title: A oasis of calm in the centre of retail madness
content: Well worth the entry fee to escape from the bustling crowds in the shops in the surrounding areas. Very pleasant and relacing gardens designed in the Ming style.

title: Very quiet
content:
Gardens are very quiet and gets you away from modern noisy shanghai

Amazing the detail in every aspect

title: Not as busy as expected
content: Outside the gardens in Yuyuan Bazaar it is BUSY, BUSY, BUSY but on entering the garden I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was not too crowded at all. There is a half price discount for Seniors over 60 years of age. The garden is interesting with lots of separate areas to view. The fish pond was really "alive" with large, beautifully coloured koi. The "Exquisite Jade Rock" was not as exquisite as I expected but overall the gardens were lovely. The walls formed to look like dragons were incredible. There are many great photo opportunities in the gardens.

title: Interesting, but not a must see
content: Yu Garden is a short walk from the Bund and from the main shopping street of Shanghai. Not surprisingly therefore, it is crowded!

title: Tranquil.
content: Tranquil and elaborate, extensive for the 30 y entrance fee. Some rare peace and beautiful photo ops. Mosquitos are around so use repellent before you visit. Limited restaurants take snacks. Don't bother with the elaborate tea house on the zig zag bridge as you enter unless you want to fork out 130 y for a cup !

title: Tour of China
content: Unfortunately, the gardens were shut due to some work being carried out at the time of my visit. Visited the area near the gardens and saw the temple and the Old Town.

title: Shoping surrounding with beautiful architecture garden and shopping center buildings
content: This place is the best choice to shopping. Many thing you can buy here, start from Chinese tea and scarf till toys and sophisticated paper cut Handy craft. Recommended place to buy souvenirs.

title: history revisited
content: it is a must visit of shanghai. the zigzag bridge upon entrance is very interesting.& after ur entry to this garden took me to the ancient time when i saw the used thing of the very family. Very interesting

title: Just Perfect !!!
content: It is a place that you can wonder and take beautiful photos of the garden the water ponds. It is a garden of 400years old and is a must in Shanghai. You can go there by metro at the yu garden station or by foot from the band and have a nice experience of Shanghai. Around the garden there are many traditional shops that you can bargain and get very nice souvenirs.

title: A small cost for a big experience.
content: There is not much historically in Shanghai and this is a little gem of a display of historical gardens in the City. It is within the 'Old Town' which is in essence a shoppers paradise looking authentic (but very very cool). There is a small entry fee and the gardens and water ponds are beautiful. It takes about an hour to cruise around and the experience is fantastic.

title: Nice place
content: Nice place to visit and take pictures , but too many people always. Very quiet if you are able to be for a minute alone

title: Peaceful oasis in the middle of chaos
content: This lovely little place serves as a source of shade and beauty in the centre of the chaos that is Shanghai.

title: Busy
content: Well worth a visit but very hectic. The gardens are easy to get to, very clean and well maintained. Lots of places to buy cold drinks and inexpensive food.

title: Enjoyed this garden
content: We almost didn't come to this garden but were happy we did. There are a lot of nice spots in this garden with interesting buildings and gazebos. The walls are also topped with a dragon-- an interesting feature. It is great to see an "old fashioned" garden in the middle of modern Shanghai.

title: Lovely gardens
content: The gardens are lovely and there is a lot to see. They have ponds with koi goldfish that are of all sizes.

title: A tranquil corner of a frantic city!
content: These traditional gardens are a must see - their setting in the old city, and the history connected to them, make them very worthwhile to visit. It pays to get there early to beat the crowds, and senior citizens get a discount. The gardens are absolutely beautiful, and the way they are set out with different halls, and ponds, and the juxtaposition of rocks and trees are just magic.

title: A trip down memory lane to ancient Shanghai
content: My family and I visited on a Thursday afternoon. We really enjoyed our trip as we love exploring the ancient parts of Shanghai. The architecture is beautiful. There are many souvenir shops and eateries around the area.

title: Amazing Gardens.
content: The day we went here the sun was beating down and the Gardens were seen in all there beauty, you can stroll around here for hours, and it is right in the centre of Huangpu district.

title: Relax
content: Nice place to seeing and interesting place to shop 😘. But you shoul go shoping windows first if you want a good price. 👍🏼

title: Interesting but smaller than expected
content: I really enjoyed walking through but I was expecting more of a path to follow. I am not sure if I saw all of it and backtracked 3 or 4 times. I really should have looked better at the map near the entrance. Regardless, it was very beautiful and peaceful. There were areas to sit, and they were quite busy, it appeared many people brought snacks or light lunches to eat inside. I think the cost of entry was 30rmb which was definitely worth it

title: Busy but interesting
content: This is an interesting piece of Chinese history. The gardens are beautiful and the zigzag bridge over the water were lovely. It was hot and busy but I can't let that detract from the beauty and I would like to go again with my family

title: Shanghai's tradition in full display
content: Yu Garden is at a prime location in Puxi of Shanghai off the Huangpu River. This is easily accessible virtually wherever you are staying within Shanghai minus the traffic.

title: Crowds prevented full enjoyment
content: This garden was extremely hard to locate through the heaves of people in and around the market and stalls surrounding the entrance. My best advice is to look for the stone bridge.

title: Disappointed
content: Far too many people, no chance to admire the garden in full! And far too many fish in the water, too!

title: Beautiful Gardens with the Market Nearby
content: We visited here during our cruise ship bus tour. The home and gardens are very pretty and display some interesting facets of Chinese culture and architecture. Be prepared for crowds and plan accordingly. The place is not very large but takes a while to see because of the crowds. The nearby market is massive and incredibly crowded, so beware of scammers and pick pockets, as well as those selling "knock off" purses and other items.

title: Peaceful place
content: It was so peaceful, a lot of tourists and big market just behind it.

title: Stunning and tranquil garden in the heart of the city
content: This place is definitely worth the visit. The area outside is street after street of shops and food stalls with mobs of tourists. We visited on a Friday afternoon so the crowds weren't too bad but have heard that this place is a mob scene on the weekend. You could easily spend several hours here because just when you think you have seen it all, there's more around the corner. There are tons of temples both big and small, ponds, koi, walkways, benches, bridges, statues, lanterns, etc. There are several areas with rocks and tunnels that kids would definitely enjoy. Each place is a photo opportunity better than the last. There are ample restrooms inside with modern toilets.

title: Beautiful place but extremely crowded
content: Thought there will be less crowd on a weekday but no! The crowd was insane and to be honest, didn't get to enjoy the beautiful garden very much, but I guess that's just something you have to tolerate with in china init. Do not buy the souvenirs, very expensive.

title: Must see of Shanghai
content:
It reminds me of suzhou, really nice garden but it can be crowded really fast so we went at the opening of the garden. 
It was a great experience. Really enjoyed this garden

title: Must see
content: this is near the old town. there is a tea house nearby which is worth the wait. great view of the mob of people plus great tea. the garden is worth the fee, neat design.

title: Absolutely rammed
content: The Gardens and the surrounding area were overcrowded when we visited, the Bazaar area building have all had Starbucks and Mcdonalds conversions

title: Nice Garden in Shanghai
content: Wasn't really wow. But it was interesting. Might be more interesting if we had a tour guide with us to explain everything.

title: Watch out for knock off sellers , they gather here.
content: Old style town , definitely quaint and so pretty it's a must on any Shanghai visit. Some nice restaurants , dim sum and Dan Dan noodle abound and a great pearl shop ( be sure and pay exactly half of what they ask initially ) .

title: A must see in Shanghai!
content: This is a beautiful place in a busy city! We were there on a weekend and it was very crowded but still a must see. There is a nominal fee to enter but it is worth the price to see the beauty. The garden is surrounding with lots of shops and restaurants. Very crowed.

title: Historic and calm walk in the Garden
content: Visited the historic and beautiful Yuyuan with my girlfriend. It was a really beautiful place. But it was very crowded. It was a nice experience and worth a visit when in Shanghai.

title: Beautiful garden
content: What a beautiful garden surrounded by a very interesting market. In the hustle and bustle of the city is a wonderful bit of peace and tranquility. It is a place that every visitor to Shanghai must see. The entrance is very affordable and the gardens and buildings are very well looked after and maintained. To find the entrance locate the zigzag bridge, the entrance is located close to it.

title: Charming scenery with great shopping
content: Yu garden is great for an afternoon walk with great shopping! Lots of souvenirs can be purchased here and there are beautiful old style Chinese houses to get nice photos! There is great street food here as well! I recommend trying the crab soup dumplings so yummy!

user_loc: 菲律宾马尼拉大都会区
title: Lovely garden
content: Before my flight back home, I visited this lovely garden called Yu Garden. I used to only see pictures of this place on the internet but last Friday, I was fortunate to see it in person. Not only is this place beautiful but is historical as well, it used to be a private Garden of a dynasty (Song dynasty I think). You can take picture outside of restaurants that look like temples, but the actual garden itself has an entrance fee of 40 yuan. If you get hungry while there, don't worry there are a lot of restaurants and even Starbucks.

title: Picture Perfect
content: If you're walking around Yuyuan Old Street then this garden is a must see. It's beautiful! There's many places to walk around and capture some amazing pictures. My friend and I walked around for at least 2.5-3 hours so give yourself a decent chunk of time to enjoy the garden!

title: Green and peaceful
content: This is considered one of the nicest places in Shanghai. It is a nice a peaceful garden where you can walk and relax. Unfortunately it is too crowded and it is impossible to walk easily through the narrow paths. Worth a visit anyway.

title: Great place to visit
content: A great traditional kept market surrounded by little stalls selling many different little things both old and new

title: Pretty but crowded
content:
A Beautiful ancient garden - with lots of water Gardens, rockeries, fish & lots to explore. 
If you don't like crowds stay away in the school
Holidays. It's also quite hot & humid in July/August. Wait till September. Still enjoyed it & loved the history.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: There is a vast array of beautiful Chinese buildings in the gardens.  The ponds blend in with the gardens and have a lot of beautiful fish in them.

title: Best part of our visit in Shanghai
content: The city of Shanghai is so overwhelming and crowded and polluted... Visiting Yu Garden was a little reprieve from it all... even though it is packed with people prior to entering the place... once you pay for your ticket and go inside, it is much less crowded.at certain hours of the day, and you can start to unwind in that lovely garden which can be used as setting for movies... Enjoy!!!

title: Strictly for tourist
content: Typical Chinatown style which you can find in most Asian country. Goods and souvenirs sold here can be purchase much cheaper on line.

title: Nice place to check out
content: This is a nice, but busy and crowded place to check out. It has everything - shopping, eating, sightseeing and people watching and culture observing.

title: Souvenirs seekers' paradise
content: All types of typical Chinese souvenirs are presented in a historical part of downtown. Buildings looks impressive and it is a must see for each Shanghai visitor. Everyone can find here some staff which he/she would like to have at home. But if you are looking for real history, this maybe not the right place.

title: Beautiful place!!!
content: Yu Garden is an amazing place. A great place to take pictures especially during the night when the lights are on. There are many places to buy gifts and restaurants to eat local food. Don't forget to bargain. Usually they give you a very high price but if you bargain you can pay half or less than the price they told you.

title: Great tourist location.
content: This is tourist central.  Good place to visit first time to Shanghai, but not needed again.  Many tourist shops and resturants.  Check out the tea house.

title: Eating and Shopping - Great Day Out
content:
Lots of cheap, but very cool stuff here to but, especially souvenirs and traditional Chinese clothes (great for the kids too!)
Had dinner at the large foodhall - crowded but great food - big choice.

title: LUXURY TRASPORTATION
content: We have used Maglev from Longyang roud Station to the Pudong Airport Station. It is 30 km away and it takes 7 minute!

title: Beautiful-Worth the Search
content: First, this is a very hard place to find. From the metro, turn right, down the tree-lined path, then right again down the wide avenue lined with shops. Eventually, turn left and follow the signs for "YuYuan Classical Street" (better signage than the gardens). Walk towards the back where it seems to get narrow, perpendicular to the wide shopping street. You'll walk into some food stalls, and the entrance will be on your left. Google maps will take you to the wall, but you can't get to the entrance from there (though it was a cool walk through a local neighborhood, and fun shopping).

title: best attractions near to the city
content: To me yuyuan garden is a must see spot in Shanghai, it is close to the city, and u can literally spend the whole day over there. The garden is really beautiful and it is huge! and i like to shop for souvenirs over there, price wise i find it reasonable and so much choices. Food wise, there's a few nice restaurant and also tea shop over there that u can slowly enjoy the tea or food. And there's this beautiful temple as well, take note of the closing time tho.

title: Beautiful garden
content: The garden is a really interesting layout. It has lots of hidden design tricks to make it feel much larger than it is.

title: Very busy in the afternoon - go early!
content: The gardens are one of the best things to do in Shanghai, and provide a welcome break from all the buildings and non-natural scenery.

title: Beautiful gem in the middle of a modern city
content: You can't miss this place. Is located in the middle of old shanghai market. Youll never be disspapointed visiting. And befote or after that you can est dummpling soap from a worldwide recognized restaurant.

title: Not much to see
content: Nothing special in comparison with the other cities. Shanghai is young and commercial, so not suitable to whom liked Chinese traditions.

title: Just beautiful, you must visit here
content: Totally stunning? Peace and tranquility inside a crazy packed market area, beautiful way to spend 3 hours strolling through history and watching the fish and turtles

title: Amazingly relaxing
content: My favorite garden in the 8 Chinese cities I visited. A wonderful combination of coi ponds, flowers, trees, rock formations, and small chinese buildings makes this a must see. The builder took many years to achieve this little miracle, in a tribute to his parents. Enjoy.

title: Shanghai
content:
Boring. Could not see what all the fuss was about this place. Uk has better gardens than this.
Too many people and not worth the money. Easily reached by the subway.

title: great history
content: It is very crowded, but still you should not miss it. Beautiful architecture, There are also tea houses.

title: Worth a visit
content: I recommend going here at least for a visit. The garden is beautiful and the surrounding buildings remind you of old China. But definitely a tourist trap. If you buy here be prepared to bargain. Also very crowded. Take your time and look around.

title: Lovely place to see
content: Lovely traditional Chinese garden, highly recommend to visit it. But don't expect a quiet place, it is really busy. A bit difficult to find the entrance, you need to get there through a busy Chinese quarter with many shops. Admission 30¥ per person. They close quite early, around 4:30pm.

user_loc: 澳大利亚大墨尔本地区
title: Definitely worth visiting
content: So Beautiful and very well maintained so many hidden little gardens amongst the larger garden very easy to find and some lovely places to sit and enjoy the beauty

title: Traditional Chinese place of interest
content: This is located in the North West part of the City of Shanghai where the City God Temple is also co-located. The Chinese heritage & tradition is very visible for experiencing in this place.

title: Nice shopping Place
content: I loved shopping in this place, were you get lots of good items for cheap especially if you want to buy gifts for friends and relatives. Be careful with the some vendor who approaches you they try giving you fake currencies in exchange. There is no problem with the shop vendors.

title: Typical and classic Shanghai place
content: Yu Garden is the MUST place for tourists when visit Shanghai; very classic architeture and you can find many typical foods and products. Recommended to feel Shanghai!

title: You've seen one and you've seen them all
content: Aside from the lotus flower pond, and the beautiful flowers, the park does not have any outstanding characteristics: it's pretty much just any other park in world. I suggest that if it's on your way to something, walk through it, but don't waste your time unless you just want to sit and rest.

title: Something to do
content: Nice little route of authenticity in Shanghai, costing very little. The quiet yet busy gardens, and stone ledges provide a nice walk to relax and take in a bit of scenery without going out of the city. There are various shops with artefacts and souvenirs inside, some more authentic than others, which add another dimension to it. But good for seating areas to watch the world go by.

title: Great!
content: Yu Gardens was completely remodeled and refurbished just prior to the World Expo in 2010. Since then it has continued to grow into a sprawling shopping area aimed mainly at tourists. You should choose one of those beautiful Shanghai days when it's not too hot and not too cold to just walk through it all. It's a good place to pick up some souvenirs for the folks back home and have some good Chinese food.

title: Very interesting
content: This a a beautiful meandering garden, but because of the number of buildings on the property, it's not nearly as beautiful as similar gardens south of Shanghai. It's on all the tour companies' itineraries, as it should be, but it's just not as spectacular as the gardens in Suzhou and other towns.

title: Very nice place to visit
content: Enjoyed our visit here. Lovely gardens to walk around. Almost difficult to believe you are smack in the middle of Shanghai. Well worth a visit.

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州温斯顿塞勒姆
title: This is a great traditional Chinese Garden....,
content: With a large amount of Chinese / Shanghai tradition this garden is overflowing with beauty and architecture.  Think of it as Shanghai's "Humble Administrator's Garden" (the real one is in Suzhou), but much more convenient to visitors already in Shanghai.

title: Beautiful Heritage Place to Visit
content: You will see the typical Chinese scene in this garden and its sorroundings. It's an oasis in the middle of the city. We went on a Saturday, so of course there was a lot of people. There are many shops around which you could spend the whole day visiting as the place is very nice.

title: Pretty place but crowded
content: We had an enjoyable afternoon wandering through Yu garden. We did get stopped a few times with people wanting to photograph their children with our young adult blonde daughters. That was a bit weird.  Yu garden is a must do when visiting Shanghai.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: The gardens are beautiful. The lotus flowers are spectacular. Very peaceful setting. Ponds and pools full of koi and turtles. Interesting pavilions. Somewhat crowded, but still very enjoyable. I did get bitten several times, though, by something (my tour escort thought perhaps jumping black ants,) that caused a severe burning sensation, lasting for about a half hour. Insect repellent recommended.

title: Amazing
content: I've been to Shanghai many times but only this time decided to visit it with my wife. The garden and old buildings are amazing, its like travelling back in time. I really recommend visiting it. Should take 1-2 hours.

title: Very nice, but crowded
content: Nice park, weike the Chinese style. It as most attractions in China, you won't feel relaxed here. Just try to see through to madness and enjoy the architecture here.

title: Great atmosphere!
content: You can find any thing around this beautiful place! Don't forget to try street foods! Crab dumpling ! I never forget the taste of these food! At the day and night both are nice place for visiting time! If you buy something from there just pay 1/3 of the price the buyers told you;)))

user_loc: 斯洛文尼亚卢布尔雅那
title: There are better gardens around
content: Yu garden is beautiful, don't get me wrong. However, after spending a few days in Shanghai and getting a look around you come to find there are many other, even more stunning gardens around. The issue with Yu garden is also, that it is way to crowded to the point when you can hardly move around. An important city landmark, however don't except too much. They also close quite early, take that into considertaion while planning your trip.

title: Rich Heritage
content:
Nice Rich Heritage preserved in the heart of shanghai . Enjoyed seeing this place ...

You require around 1 hour . Lots of street shopping around ...

title: Great Shopping
content: Was here before and wanted to come back. There is unbelievable shopping and the independent who wants to sell you their knock-offs. Crime is very low in Shanghai as people are not allowed to carry guns. The people are nice and the stores have great prices. I would recommend you pursue the places before you buy to make sure you get the best deal

title: Must see but overcrowded
content: Need to see in Shanghai but very touristy and crowded. We were lucky that it rained to be able to avoid the herds.

title: Beautiful and Peaceful
content: Nice place to walk around and sit and rest away from all the hustle bustle of the city. Must see in Shanghai.

title: Peace
content: This is a lovely hideaway from the hectic nature of the city. You enter the gardens and go into a quiet, peaceful haven of rocks, greenery and running water. Coi carp abound. It is pleasant just to sit and contemplate.

title: Over crowded but very beautiful
content: China is overall really crowded place. Yu garden was also extremely crowded but its a place not to be missed. Amazingly beautiful garden.

title: Beautiful and tranquil...
content: ...even when very busy and in low 40s heat! This maze-like, deceptively large series of courtyards and pavilions, pools and rockeries was a pleasure to wander round. Even though it's right next to a packed shopping district, it maintains a peaceful quality which makes all the more relaxing to visit.

title: A lovely garden in the middle of Shanghai
content: Yu garden is well worth a visit while in Shanghai. Established 400 years ago, it is now only half the size it once was - but still has a lot to see. There are many old buildings, some still original, trees that are hundreds of years old, and rocks from rivers and lakes that are piled in ways that make them look original to the location. A peaceful and beautiful place in the middle of a busy city.

title: Visited April 2013- my favourite Shanghai site to visit
content: Was still new to travel but my cousin lived there. This was and still is one of my favourite places in Shanghai!! Chinese gardens are unlike any others I've been to, filled with water, bridges, rock formations, flowers, benches and beauty. Visiting in the spring and fall are the best times of the year to visit. I would most definitely visit again if I were to catch a plane back.

title: Wonderful
content: It is a beautiful garden with a wonderful landscapes.You may spend there a couple of hours just walking or taking some photos.If you go to the gift shops you need to bargain ,do not accept the first price they are offering you because it is high with approximately 30-40 %.

title: wonderful chinese garden!
content: The Yu garden is really a must see in Shanghai. On hot days you find little nice places to rest and just watch and enjoy the ambiance and peace of the garden.

title: Stunning!
content: Disappointed we did not have more time to explore this gorgeous garden! Such a pretty sight and amazing architecture.

title: attractive gardens in old town
content: Don't be mislead into thinking this will be a cool and shady retreat in the heat of summer! the gardens are lovely and worth a visit but the walls keep in the humidity, so it was airless and boiling hot!

title: Oke but nut very impressive
content: It is an historical small part in Shanghai and therefor you Shouf go there however the Chinese "spoil" a bit the ancient style by surroundings with popmusic or stores.

title: Tourist trap
content: If you are looking for a beautiful garden, forget it.

title: You can't skip this one
content: The garden is pretty, but smaller than you imagine.  The shops are great fun and the crowds are perfect for people watching.  Be sure to have a map in your language, all of the maps in the area are in Chinese and hard to navigate.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚费尔菲尔德
title: Lovely gardens from China past
content: We strolled through the Yu Garden complex in Shanghai. It is a lovely sight with ponds, walkways, large rocks from river beds, lotus pool, pogodas and winding caves. It can be packed with people for it is a prime tourist and locals family attraction. The day we were it was very hot so it was nice to have covered areas to sit and get out of the sun. It is a must see if you visit Shanghai just see how it was centuries ago.

title: Lovely garden in the center of the city
content: A hidden gem. Visit with a guide to get the inside of the history. It has beautiful old palace with a garden and a fish pond. The art graft is in good restoration condition and you will see marvellous wood graft work.

title: Classic Shanghai Experience
content: If you don't go to Yuyuan, you missed the most iconic part of Shanghai - don't miss it! Crowded at times but worth the crowds.

title: A gorgeous maze of gardens
content: A must see in Shanghai. Didn't really know what to expect and I was blown away with how lovely this site was - and it felt like the gardens just kept going! Skip the shops in here, definitely overpriced. Come here solo or with your traveling companions and enjoy new discoveries around every corner and lots of photo ops!

title: Ming dynasty
content: Beautiful serene gardens within the walls. Many different rooms that zig zag throughout the premises each having a different use. Pay attention to the groundwork as patterns and pictograms have symbolic meanings. There is an admission cost to enter but I expected a better maintenance of the beautiful premises.

title: Beautiful Garden
content: This place is right in the middle of Old Shanghai and a beautiful must visit place. It transports you to an olden time.

title: Hard to Find
content: Maybe it's unfair to review this place, because I never actually FOUND it while I was in Shanghai.

title: beautiful ancient Chinese architecture
content: At certain times of the year this place is overrun by Chinese and international tourists, which allows one hardly a short stop to take a photo of this beautiful ancient Chines architecture. Good place to see in spring and auumn. Souvenir shops abound and sondo the beggars. Beware of tauts and pickpockets. Definitely a must see in Shanghai.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Came here on my last afternoon in Shanghai. The humidity was making it hard to properly enjoy, but I did love these gardens. Although, when I had decided I had had enough, it took me a good five minutes to find the exit again as it felt quite like a maze.

title: Peaceful but not empty
content: Very tranquil and calm, but there is also peace to be found here in observing other people do tai chi.

title: Seems unique in Shanghai
content: Much of old Shanghai seems to be gone. It was refreshing to find something 500 years old there. Very peaceful and an interesting walk through if you can get there early enough to beat the crowds. Especially charming since you enter through a market area of what seems like thousands of noisy tourist-oriented shops.

title: Love the historical building
content: Although it has lots of tourist here, the beautiful garden and architecture still amaze us.

title: Decent at best
content: If it's your first time to China and your first time going to a garden type of place with old traditional Chinese buildings then it's a nice visit. I've been to China 12 times and my visit to this garden left me wondering what the hype is all about. I've been to some pretty amazing places in China so this didn't really have that "wow factor" for me. However, it may for you and you might love it! It's very crowded to get inside the garden, but once you do it's nice. Still crowded, but nice. I would recommend this to someone who is wanting to experience their first or second China feel activity, but if you've been to the Big Buddha, the Great Wall, the Temple of Heaven, and the Summer Palace, then this just doesn't compare. Hope this helped!

title: Yu Gardens In July
content: We toured the Yu Gardens on our Viking "Imperial Jewels of China" River Cruise in July of 2017 and found them fascinating.

title: The Old Shanghai
content: Our conducted tour included this garden and we were impressed by the well maintained state of the historical buildings and the beautiful garden layout. Another world right in the centre of a very modern city. A must when you visit Shanghai.

title: Fairly Nice but Crowded Spot for Chinese Tourists
content: Many restaurants and souvenirshops in that area. It's actually a built shopping distrcit with a completly crowded garden in the back. You can get some nice pcitures and grab some street food. Just be prepared of not beeing the only one.

title: Beautiful quiet garden in the middle of the busy city
content: For a small fee, you can access a very large tranquil classical garden with historical buildings, pavillons, rockeries, ponds and beautiful trees.It takes about two hours to see most of it and take amazing pictures. It also has an art exhibition where you can purchase traditional Chinese art pieces.

title: Beautiful part of Shanghai
content:
This was part of our tour in Shanghai.  We were in there for about an hour.  Just so lovely that this little piece of history was preserved.

GO early!

title: Yu gardens thru an expat eyes
content: We lived in shanghai for about 4 years. One of our favorite places to take our tourist friends was Yu gardens. China has been quick to industrialize and grow bulldozing most of its historical record along the way. This is one area that kept its culture and heritage. A respite from the busy whirl of shanghai life, the ponds and buildings provide shade and a glimpse into once wealthy privacy. My kids love to peek around the many circular doorways and cave looking entrances. They swear dragons live in the waterways and some of the humongous koi make you wonder too. Don't miss the dumplings outside the gates for a quick yummy lunch. The teahouse is also a nice photo opp, but not worth the prices. Bring sunscreen, water and cameras! Must do while in shanghai

title: Interesting stop
content: This was an interesting stop and good for some photos.  It can be crowded.  You really need a guide to make the most of this location.

title: Beautiful
content: First of all, it was dificult to find the entrance! Once we got it it was truly wonderfull, a sens of old China (however a little crowded, like everything in China). Such a shame the garden is too small!

title: Lovely place to spend an hour or so
content: This garden is really sweet, especially in spring time. Be aware there in an entry fee and you'd do well to try and avoid crowds (really early on week days in my favourite). Been there a bunch of times and really enjoy it. Good for making some drawings.

title: Yu Garden, the must to be seen
content:
Every time when visiting Shanghai go to the Yu Garden, always different and always even attective but do not go during Holiday or a Sunday, over crowded.
You wil find everything as gadget but you really have to look for the better quality

title: Crowded and hot
content: If you like crowds, you feel great here. The architecture is beautiful and the stores offer all types of touristy stuff. The vendors are very pushy and follow you around. Bargain to half of the price. Don't eat the food outside of real restaurants except at international chains like Starbucks etc.

title: Wonderful place for a walk
content: Great place to walk and very peaceful. Lots of locals out celebrating in the park. A great meeting place.

title: Nice to visit
content: A good visit to the garden but be careful with shops around. The cost is about $7 to get in. Do not at any cost go into shops where they sell fake as they only sell garbage.

title: A glimpse of old Shanghai
content: Breathtaking glimpse of old Shanghai. Amazing to think this walled compound of graceful buildings, gardens, ponds and rockeries has survived for over 500 years in the heart of one of the biggest and rapidly modernising cities in the world. Kids loved it and so did we. If it hadn't been a high summer day we would have stayed longer. Truly beautiful.

title: family holiday
content: I have lived and worked in China (Shanghai and other regions) over ten years ago. When I was asked by my Brother to travel to China to celebrate my Nephew's 21st along with my 78-year mum, I was little apprehensive at first. This was purely due to previous experience. However, I was pleasantly amazed and absolutely blown away by the changes, growth and diversity of the city of Shanghai.

title: Great Chinese Garden
content: We really enjoyed visiting the garden. It was a very relaxing break after walking though the bazaar!

title: Most beautiful place in Shanghai
content: We visited the garden when it was drizzling so the crowds were not that bad. A must do when you are in Shanghai. It is a beautiful place and you feel the tranquility. Go spend a couple of hours in this piece of heaven in the middle of one of the bussiest cities in the world.

title: Very good attraction
content: This garden is lovely and highly recommended to see an authentic Chinese garden. Be careful though as it's easy to get lost! Easy walking distance from centre of shanghai.

title: Beautiful garden but crowded
content: Very beautiful and interesting chinese garden, and would have been wonderful to experience in solitude... But the were so many visitors we almost had to stand in line to move between sections. If possible visit early in the morning.

title: Excellent
content: Charming Chinese architecture and culture. It can be visited just for photo shooting. Always crowded but worth to see it.

title: Nice for a short visit
content: we were there with a tour group, so a bit crowded. It was a beautiful place to see and enjoy the architecture and sights. Would have been more relaxing and enjoyable if it hadn't been so crowded.

title: Crowded, but a Must-See
content: This place was bustling with tourists and locals alike when I visited in March. A great place to shop for some souvenirs and eat delicious 小笼包 (soup dumplings).
