title: What a beautiful garden, Yu Yuan Garden!
content: If you are an experienced traveler, Yu Yuan Garden of Shanghai is a place you cannot miss! The garden is very pretty and cute. Although, In size, it is not as large as the Summer Palace of Beijing, it is still so beautiful,so wonderful,so elegant! You don't move your she's away from the views! Especially, Yu Garden is so cute!

title: Bustling Shops and Tranquil Garden
content: We stayed the next street from here and found it to be a fascinating place. Lots of different shops and eateries. It seems very busy no matter the time of day or night. In the middle of all this hustle and bustle was the gardens, 30 yuan pp to visit. Once inside it felt miles away from the outside, walking round it felt quite calm and tranquil. Would recommend the shops and the gardens. It should be noted that everything closes at 9 pm.

title: Beautiful
content: Nice atmosphere with lots of people and lots of little shops, so many things to see, and buy amazing, loved it.

title: A nice place turned in a large-scale Chinese tourists attraction
content: As most of "tourist attractive old neighborhoods" in big Chinese cities, this corner of the old Chinese town has been somehow well preserved but also turned into a huge trap and millions of national (+ foreign) tourist fled here just because of its name. Overall its nice if you pass by when there is not TOO MUCH crowd. The garden with entry fee is awesome and of course less people inside.

title: Nice Chinese Garden if you have no time for Suzhou
content: I visited Yu Garden together with a group of friends who can for a visit and they did enjoy the hustle and bustle of the area surrounding Yu Garden. The actual attraction however was disappointing to them. In the style of a traditional Chinese garden with lots of water shaped stones arranged in all variations it is somewhat typical for the garden aesthetic and thus a "good to see" place if you have little one or only visit Shanghai.However, if you have a little more time at hand and are a garden enthusiast a visit to Suzhou with its larger variety might be more worth it.

title: Super day tour - must see!
content: Full of shops and restaurants, and so peaceful, a beautiful oasis in the middle of Shanghai. Great walking tour, lots of photo ops, and many gist shops to practice your bargaining skills in. You can literally offer 15-20% of the original asking price for goods of your liking and win a good deal if you're good at it or are willing to walk away. The vendors still make a profit, they just don't rip you off unless you let them.

title: Special atmosphere
content:
A really interesting and photographic place.
Lots of tiny stores with interesting and pretty cheap stuff. The restaurants are surprisingly good, especially the "xiaolongbao" which is a soup and meat filled dumpling.

title: Yu Yuan Garden visit
content:
Second time I visited Yu Yuan Gardens, truly a must see for everyone. 

Peaceful & beautiful setting. Taken there by a Chinese friend who's added explanations made me appreciate my surroundings even more.

title: One island in the midle of Shangai
content: Also known as Stone Garden: it shows a very well organized house where the several divisions have been built in midle of a garden or a garden with several divisons! Place to see.

title: Gardens were very important for the Chinese and oriental people in general
content: We were there a couple of years ago. It is nice that tourist see how Chinese loved Gardens, lakes, nature in general. The Windows have different designs and lot of places to rest. To think, to enjoy nature...

title: Enjoyed it!
content: I didn't know what to expect since it was part of our tour itinerary. We ended up enjoying the garden very much. Despite the crowds, it was nice to walk around and take in the beauty.

title: Quick Stop
content: We have been here several times before. We took our friend here, as she was new to Shanghai.

title: Beautiful architecture, too busy and commercialized
content: The old buildings are well maintained and beautiful. But now are used as restaurants, coffee shops and stores. Overcrowded on weekends.

title: Goid
content: Very beautiful garden. Dont miss it. Very Chinese that worth seeing it. You can also buy goods at the place.

title: Ok
content: ... though nothing compared to what you can see in other places in China. It might be the most/more interesting old sightings in Shanghai

title: lovely afternoon
content:
enjoyed pleasant afternoon strolling through gardens
Old buildings ,lovely ponds with large fish ,
great photo opportunity

title: An old Chinese Garden
content: Located in the older part of Shanghai, I had read a lot of good reviews about this place but found it over rated. That fact that it had rained that day didnt help matters, and the peaceful walk through a scenic garden I had hoped for didnt happen. Its more a primitive structure showcasing old Chinese architecture.

title: Relaxing
content:
A relaxing little spot of green in the middle of the city.

A nice place to stroll and unwind or just sit and chill out.

title: Good place for buying souvenir
content: I like this place! Nice view during the night, a lot of shops and has one of the best xiaolongbao in town.

title: A bit of relax
content: A magnificent place to relax. Very beautiful place to walk and try to be in peace.

title: Good one to see
content: This is a garden with Royal buildings in the heart of the city.  It has a history of 400+ years and provides you the glimps of life then.  Garden and the buildings are well maintained now.  Its a good tourist attraction of Shanghai.

title: Wonderful, if busy, oasis
content: A real gem in the middle of the city.  We really enjoyed our visit and the gardens were both interesting and relatively peaceful.   Lots to see and we could easily have spent longer

user_loc: 爱荷华康瑟尔布拉夫斯
title: Beautiful Experience in the middle of Shanghai
content: We walked through a bamboo park with people doing Tai Chi and then entered a beautiful grounds that included some of the most beautiful buildings I have seen in Shanghai. The gardens included palaces, moats, koi, surrounded by an incredible retail experience. Of course we spoke no Chinese but the staff were so helpful that we even had a few walk us to find a vendor that we were looking for. We had an excellent experience.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: This is another beautiful place to visit if you are in Shanghai. Lovely people around and also I had a great experience shopping in the local markets. The place is well maintained and I several travellers there.

title: Worth a visit
content:
Really lovely garden and well worth a visit. Especially good if you'd like to shop afterwards. Great street shopping. Beautiful photo opportunities. 
Highly recommend.

title: A gem in the middle of the city!
content: Located in the middle of a busy shopping district, explore the winding paths, landscape, and unique buildings. Enjoy the shade of a 400 year-old ginko tree!

title: A garden trip
content: What a lovely spot we really enjoyed the gardens.

title: Crowded and busy with lots of shopping
content: Does not feel as quaint or peaceful like ten years ago. New buildings in "old style Chinese" architecture combined with modern bright Windows etc give off an amusement park feel. But lots of shopping. Shanghai is after all quite westernized in many ways. Good food available.

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Amazing!
content: I absolutely loved the Yuyuan Garden. Probably my favorite place in Shanghai. Once I found it, which it may be hard (for me it was, at least), it's totally worth it. You have the chance to sit and have a super peaceful time, seeing little temples or just the calm of the lake. I'm looking forward to going back.

title: Too much crowd. Dirty water. Place stinks with smell of non-veg
content: Too much crowd. Dirty water. Place stinks with smell of non-veg. Could have been maintained better. Good view of old China though

title: Too crowded
content: While this might be interesting, I found the crowd too thick to enjoy the site. There are far more beautiful gardens in less crowded areas.

title: Pretty
content: Very interesting and attractive gardens with the history attached to it, worth a visit, very relaxing after the busy city.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
content: A beautiful and peaceful place in Shanghai, away from the chaos of the city. It can get busy but it's still a lovely place to visit. The ponds are beautiful and full of fish and turtles! Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the view. We went on a very hot day and it was cool from the trees.

title: Beautiful garden
content: Beautiful remains of a Ming dynasty garden from the 1500's. Visit together with Yu Bazaar and stay there until it becomes dark to see the lights !

title: A lovely example of a Chinese garden
content: In the middle of a busy old fashioned shopping market here is a lovely Chinese garden, many individual courtyards, many historical buildings and ponds, jade sculptures and ornate trees. A must whilst you visit Shanghai. It's cheap to get in to!

title: Great place but a lot of people
content: Is a really pretty place and it really worst it to go, but is a lot of people every were and is impossible to take pictures...

title: Classic visit of Shanghai
content: If you come at Shanghai, Yu Garden is a classic visit to do. Chinese classic architecture. Unfortunately, it's overcrowded (forget in Chinese public holiday), really too much tourist shop.

title: Yu Courtyards
content: Maybe I just have an over westernised view of what a garden or a tourist destination should be, but I felt a little disappointed here. Don't get me wrong, it is a place worth visiting, offering some calm from the modern Shanghai but there are few plants or flowers and it is really a series of courtyards, ponds and empty chinese buildings. There is little explanation of what you are looking at and little to see in the actual buildings themselves. Be careful if it is raining, some of the stone paths are quite slippery.

title: Peaceful gardens and great markets nearby
content: I loved the gardens! The architecture is amazing and so peaceful. You can eat good food or shop at the markets outside the garden. Bring a school ID if you have one. Definitely a must!

title: Picturesque
content: Everywhere you look, from whatever angle, is perfect for a photograph. Just wish we could have spent more time here. The exit is into an outdoor shopping mall.

title: Plenty of people here
content: This is your typical tourist trap location. Very crowded and packed but of course all of the things to see as a tourist you come for are here.

title: Nice visit!
content:
Well preserved classical Chinese garden dated back to about 400 years. 

Try going early in the morning to avoid the crowds, and to take advantage of the great photo opportunities.

Beautiful scenery all around!

title: nice ancient spot
content: a nice place to visit and rest a bit after a noisy overcrowded Shanghai. Here it is quiet and peaceful and despite lot of tourists one can still find peace. Beautiful chinese ponds with red fish. Loved the spot.

title: Tourist trap
content: Wanna buy cheap stuff to take back home? This is the place. Wanna get ripped off for said cheap stuff? This is the place. Wanna take touristy pictures to share on social media? This is the place. Yu garden is a one-and-done kind of place in Shanghai. Vapid and crowded, but pleasing if you need to show some visitors something that is "Chinese"

title: very nice district
content: this area is not ancient the way we think it in Europe, but charming although very crowded with tourists.

title: Enter or not, interesting are to explore, with lots of street shopping options
content: Yu garden is a touristy area. You need to pay to get inside the garden. Inside you will find quite peaceful Chinese style garden and ponds full of fish. Whether you want to pay for visiting Chinese garden or not is a personal preference. But even without entering the garden, you can see the zigzag bridge. That is free of charge. There are a lot of shops in the area. Actually, except the inside gardens, the whole area has only stores and stores. From outside the buildings will look very historical, but actually those consist of only shopping places.

title: Historical and Tranquil
content: Yu Gardens is a must for visitors to shanghai, close to the bund and easily accessible , its worth taking your time to appreciate the garden and read the history associated with the gardens.

title: Fake and Crowded
content: I would definitely avoid this place. It's always frenetically busy with mainland Chinese and western tourists. Most buildings were built in recent time to look like those old ones because chinese believe they can attract more tourists. Goods sold at shops are more expensive than other places.

title: Very nice
content: Yu Garden is very nice and can be relaxing when it is not crowded. We visited in March, during a nice sunny day. I recommend it, it is not a place to be missed in Shanghai.

title: Another Don't Miss it
content: An amazing beautiful garden and traditional buildings right in the middle of busy Shanghai. Many cheap touristy shops around. Plenty of great photo opportunities. Don't miss it.

title: Great Chinese Garden ... but NOT if you hate crowds!
content: Actually NOT easy to find ... it's in the CENTRE of the maze of shops... look for the 'temple' signs.

title: Good but the highlight is the Yuyuan teahouse outside
content: If you do not have time to go elsewhere, such as the exquisite gardens in Suzhou, only a couple of hours away by train, this is an important destination. A fine Ming dynasty garden but made a bit wearing by the huge mass of people constantly pulsing through it - and it shows the wear and tear itself! The garden is one of 4 attractions here. It is approached through the Yuyuan (Yu Garden) Bazaar which is a very impressive edifice but not for shopping - full of dreary tourist tat and a magnet for scammers and pickpockets - and just beside it are the Yuyuan teahouse and the City God Temple. My recommendation is take some time out upstairs in the tearoom and have a tea set while looking out of the little windows to the mass below. It is usually quieter and has a lovely old-fashioned, Chinese tearoom interior. The City God temple is not much to see.

title: Really beautiful
content: The garden is amazing. Recommend to come there with a tour guide for a more full experience, otherwise the scenery may be a bit repetative.

title: A well worth a visit.
content: Best to go early before mobs of tourists arrive. Well maintained and a great way to learn a bit of local history

title: Quiet, even when crowded
content: YuYuan is a welcoming oasis of calm and beauty after you've managed to get through the crowded and noisy market outside. The contrast is stark as you leave the busy city behind and start walking through like lake areas and rocky paths. Set aside at least an hour to see everything.

title: Crowded
content: It has beautiful gardens and lovely spots to take pictures. You should go on a day that is not so hot because it is way too crowded. There are many shops around with cheap prices! Really nice visit! In Shanghai, it is a definite must!

title: Old Historical Garden in the center of Shangahi
content: Shanghai is noww a modern city, but this place is amazing.

title: Totally worth it
content: I came on a very hot Shanghai afternoon, which I thanked a lot because it's fresher inside the garden and also have AC rooms.

title: Quiet area in a big city
content: The Yu gardens area is a pretty and scenic spot to wander around and enjoy. I wish I had taken a guided tour to learn about the history and about what I was actually seeing.

title: Well informed guides
content:
The ladies who there to receive us and inform us of the green tea were very well informed and prepared.

Green tea can be purchased on site with a variety of other Chinese specialties.
Will take about 2 hours

title: Not that exciting
content: Not really gardens. Lovely old buildings with a few small lakes. Very cheap entry so it's worth walking through. Right in the middle of the old area which is very touristy.

title: Lovely garden
content: Lovely Chinese garden with beautiful old buildings, pretty ponds, and many pictures opportunities. Definitely worth the time and entry ticket.

title: Pick your day right
content:
I was there in July, so it was hellishly hot and over-crowded. However, during the night, lights looked good. 
Would recommend going there during more colder seasons, so it would be more enjoyable

title: trip
content: what a beautiful garden and olden buoldings. our guide was knowledgeable and well informed regarding the history of the gardens.

title: Just beautiful
content: A traditional Chinese garden , very beautiful. While there visit the tea shop and get a demonstration of Chinese tea and tasting. Very informative.

title: nice but soo crowded
content: very crowded, but nice and narrow area. better to visit in low season. a nice place to see when visiting shanghai

title: Positive Energy
content: This garden is amazing... full of positive energy... there are loads of souvenir shops and vendors outside but when you come inside the garden nothing but a calm and relaxing environment... highly recommand it...

title: Great snacks to try!
content: We loved walking around and enjoying the "old" architecture. We tried lots of great food and snacks here. Very memorable and unique Shanghai experience. Lots of shopping for souvenirs also available, but food is a must try here!

title: Place for the eyes
content: Very well preserved mansion of the olden Chinese architecture, with sculptures and ponds within the mansion. A good look into the living style of the ancient Chinese.

title: oasis in a big city
content: Lots of people so not hugely peaceful but quite pretty.  lots of history uncovered with our great guide Eva :)

title: Must visit to see traditional Chinese Garden
content: Beautiful Chinese traditional garden. It is pretty wide and many different aspects to see. Architecture, nature, art within the building etc. It is pretty crowded, but enough room to take a break.

title: A no go during peak times
content: This place shows a place that the Chinese elite used to go to relax in Shanghai. Therefore, the emotion that is supposed to be presented here is serenity. Unfortunately, when I went, there were simply too many people to feel that. There were too many people outside the garden shopping and milling about and too many people inside walking, climbing, sitting. Other than that, the garden is maintained quite well. The architecture and landscaping is quite Chinese in nature. The place is great for some photography. Just make sure you don't go on weekends or holidays.

title: yu garden
content: we were taken to this attraction, and it wasn't untill we got inside that we realised what a hidden gem it was, beautifull gardens and area around the pool, a lovely way to spend some time away from the hustle and bustle of busy china

title: Beautiful garden - brilliant garden architecture
content: It's a must see, if you are close to Shanghai "Old Town". Yuyuan is a quite small but beautiful garden created around 500 years ago. The architecture with lots of corners, small hills and only few straight paths makes it feel much bigger than it actually is.

title: One of my favorite places...
content: This is one of my favorite places that I went on my last trip to Shanghai. Yes, it is fairly touristy but it is very beautiful at the same time. Take a walk around the garden and then explore a little outside of this area. I highly recommend it!

title: A must-see site in Shanghai
content: Avoid crowds by visiting during off-peak periods; take your time, late autumn or early spring if you can choose

title: An extraordinary experience!
content: The Ya Garden is attached to Temple of God. When you visit the temple .. you cannot but contemplete on the fact of people used to wake up every morning to those stunning views.. absolutely breathtaking!enjoy watching dancing groups at the garden as dancing is a daily routine for the people there .. then make your way to the bazaar at the temple and enjoy sipping starbucks the chinese way.. do not forget to buy your gifts .. there is an abundance of silk scarves ,tea and other chinese paintings and jewerly. The traditional part of shanghai is a life moving experience.

title: Nice place, but crowed
content: I really like this chinese garden, but it was crowed. Many people around. I suggest take your water bottle and patience.

title: Nice, but under the expectation
content: In fact, kind of disappointing. It is a nice area, but after visiting Beijing this garden and buildings make no such impression

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: A touch of culture
content: Finally got to see this beautiful place.  The intricate designs in the buildings , furniture and art was awe inspiring.  So much to appreciate.

title: Peaceful spot in the middle of Shanghai
content: As the title says, you do not feel like being downtown, the calm and the relaxing atmosphere are unique. Do not miss also the old small streets around the garden

title: A PLACE on a MUST DO LIST IN SHANGHAI
content: Over the last 15 years i have been to YU gardens several times.

title: Great place - bigger than I thought
content: It was really nice to escape the concrete jungle of Shanghai and enter this enchanted garden. Strolling around gave me an insight into traditional Chinese architecture as the place looks like a movie set. As I went in the October holiday, it was very busy outside the Gardens and I was a bit reluctant to enter because of this. But as I entered I was very surprised at how many people didn't pay to come in. Student discounts are also offered which is great. The gardens are much bigger than I thought also and I spent more time in there than I thought I would.

title: Pretty Gardens
content: These gardens, although small, have been cleverly designed to make them appear as if they go on forever.  This is a very popular place but despite the crowds it is still a delightful and peaceful place to visit.

title: Good - if a little crowded
content: Before I went to Yu Gardens I conjured up the images that I had seen in books of serene gardens and small tea shops. It did have elements of this although you will find it is largely a shopping plaza, it even has a MacDonald's! I was waiting for my family when I went and was encumbered by Shanghai residents wanting to take photos of the bridge standing with a white man! Nice day out though!

title: See the garden then enjoy the dumplings!
content: Well worth the trip. Beautiful gardens.lovely to think that someone built this for their elderly father. Enjoy the tea in the building of the middle of the bridge with 9 bends first! Afterwards try the famous dumplings from the shop nearby!

title: Great experience
content: We've been to the Garden a few times now, and each time I think I like it more.

title: One of the best places to visit!
content: I didn't know what to expect from this place, but once we visited it, it was worth the walk and the time exploring.

title: beautiful! A must!
content: i love this place!!! i've been here a few times and it surprises me every time, how a son would build this beautiful and creative place for his parents to retire there with their friends. go on a nice day and catch people laying on the benches catches a quick nap

title: Yuyuan garden
content: Best place for shopping...near to bund...well connected by metro...return taxi is a challenge sometimes....bargain bargain and bargain to get best price...food is awesome

title: Old style place
content: Yuyuan Garden is located in the center of Shanghai's Old City, a few blocks south of the Bund.It built in the Ming dynasty.When i was there,i feel crowded,all of the china tourists fill every inch of the space.But luckily i taste some awesome food there-Xiaolong bao.This food full of gravy,when you bite it you can feel the soup is splash in your mouth.

user_loc: 加利福尼亚米逊维耶荷
title: Worth seeing!
content: The gardens are beautiful. The shopping is like any other place in Shanghai for shopping. Just be aware when leaving the area that the taxi's may take advantage of you if you're not a local. Go with the green cabs as they are meters. We seem to have bad luck with the red cabs as they are not legal cabs.

title: Great, pleasant place to visit
content: Beautiful gardens, bring your camera. We enjoyed a couple of hours just wandering around marvelous gardens, statues. The neighbourhood is amazing with lots of places to eat

title: Great place for souvenirs
content: Over here one can see the old shanghai buildings including garden n temple.one can sample all shanghai snacks at the snack square however the food served disappoint gourmet like me.eg the pastry xiaolong bao were too thick the shaomai were frozen food the chicken feet overcooked.but there are many shops to buy souvenirs from shanghai and one must be patient as the price varies from shops.shanghai tidbits chocolates and cookies can be bought also from the big mart.

title: Best in Shanghai, but that's not saying much
content: Yu Yuan is an old garden in the middle of Puxi, Shanghai. While there are stunning pagodas and neat rock formations, this is NOT a quiet garden retreat. The place is always filled to the brim with Chinese tourists, the water/ponds are putrid and its easy to get lost.

title: OASIS OF PEACE
content: After the busy city this place is an oasis of peace, the ancient gardens are beautifully preserved and show how priviledged the few were in the old times. The streets and shops around the garden are photographic, if not the original, give you the sense of the real China we came to see.

title: A splendid Chinese Oasis in the heart of Shanghai
content: Yu Garden is a really good showcase of the Ming dynasty, It is basically one of the top destinations in Shanghai that you can enjoy a peaceful a day at the garden (mind the crowdedness!), enjoy the local shops around and have a good authentic bite for dinner!.

title: Fun place to explore.
content: Market concept stalls, well maintained.  Great zig-zag walk way over the water, very scenic.  Bring lots of memory cards and have your extra battery for your camera.

title: Lovely Gardens - Bring your Camera / CamCorder
content: We took the HO-HO bus here and enjoyed a few hours strolling through the gardens.  Lots of food choices, and many dumpling places to eat.  Watch out for watch vendors!

title: Lovely gardens. An oasis in the city!
content: A bit crowded on the weekend but a stunning and peaceful garden that showcases the lovely architecture from 500 years ago!

title: Yuyuan garden
content: Excellent place for shopping for Silk scarves and mandarin neck dresses and tops.You have to bargain here.Small cute souveniers can be bought.You can see city God Temple and the garden. There are Tea houses to enjoy your green tea and one can also buy green and white tea.Authentic chineese food can also be enjoyed here.

user_loc: 俄克拉何马州俄克拉何马城
title: A Good Place to Visit for Tourists
content: Yu Garden is a lovely garden with carefully designed layout for ponds and plants. It is small yet full of man-made beauties. For the locals, Yu Yuan refers to the area that includes the garden, and streets lined with numerous shops for souvenirs, jewelry, and (fake and genuine) antiques. Additionally, there are many restaurants, cafes, and eateries in Yu Yuan. A fun place to visit, locals and tourists alike.

title: Tour
content: If you are in Beijing you must go to Yu Garden. A photographers dream and so much history. A complete look around this area will likely take at least 2 hours and more if you want to dig deep into its history. A don't miss attraction.

title: What a nice surprise
content: Easily accessed by metro. In addition to the gardens, there is a huge shopping center nearby. Old Shanghai road sells retail while the adjoining building sells retail and wholesale. Be prepared for hard bargaining. Please be cautious, there are many con-artists trying to lure travelers to practice English, have tea or massages resulting in loss of money. I warned some young girls to keep walking and the scammers got quite angry.

title: Nice gardens
content: Although not super crowed this as the place it more visitors I see on Shanghai, but since the place is quite big you can easily get away from the more crowed spots. Just don't buy anything in the stores inside is much more expensive.

title: Gold fish garden
content: The garden of happines is a great place. Garden is not a typical garden instead its a palace. There are some green areas and ponds full of golden fish among the buildings.

title: Beautiful ancient Chinese garden
content: An ancient garden built for the owners father who died before completion. It typifies all the 4 elements that make a Chinese garden. The proximity to 'China Town'was a bonus. Great shopping!

title: A splendid Ming Dynasty garden
content: A splendid Ming Dynasty garden, large enough to require an entire day to explore. There are found artists and photographers admiring the delightful flowers, the lotuses in bloom in July, in every imaginable variety. There are found musicians and performers adorning the pavilions, in period costumes, of all ages. And revelers enjoying the scenes.

title: Yu Garden a must see Pleasant place to see
content: The Yu Garden (Yuyuan) built in 1577 it contains pools and a tea house and the most amazing zig zag bridge you can take a stroll over This zig zag is a Ceremonial Bridge

title: China Highlights Tour, Yu garden
content: This garden, or should I say gardens, is absolutely amazing. The layout is beautiful and although there were many visitors went we were there, there was still an air of tranquillity

title: Tranquil and beautiful
content: This garden is a lovely beautiful garden, well laid out with lots of history and tranquillity. It is set out to include the Zen items expected of a Chinese garden - follows Ying and Yang, but gets quite busy with visitors which can spoil the atmosphere.

title: Pity about the crowds
content: At the time of its creation in the Ming period this would have been a tranquil retreat from the world. Now it is mobbed by hordes of visiting tourists and, despite its beauty, it is offers only a glimpse of its former purpose.

title: Nice Garden Walk
content: Beautiful gardens and meditation buildings and tea houses. Can get very crowded on the weekends. The building architecture was amazing.

title: Yuyuan.
content: This is an old chines mansion with beautiful chinese-style gardens. Around there, there are lots of shops and restaurants. Why don't you try a chinese food - chudoufu.

title: Restful, in spite of the tourists.
content: Lots of spaces and gardens to explore, with interesting buildings as well.  Best visited with a local guide.

title: Don't bother
content: Not really great. It's just a garden with a few ponds around, I don't think it's anything you won't see anywhere else in the world. Wouldn't really waste your time going there.

title: Picturesque
content: Lovely gardens with many intriguing nooks and crannies. Different shaped windows give unique pictures.

title: Shopping along Nature !
content: This beautiful but small garden has a lake passing through with a tiny bridge in the centre . Numerous colour fishes add to the beauty of the lake ! The old Chinese architectural buildings and rocks are interesting ! The small shops around the garden offer a wide variety of curios which are cheap ! Dr.K.Sundar,Dubai .

title: Lovely garden
content: We spent around 1 hour wandering around Yuyuan, occasionally stopping to rest our feet and soak up the ambience. The garden was very crowded but it remained a peaceful place. The rock gardens are interesting although many spots were blocked off. The shops outside the garden were full of typical tourist paraphernalia, food stalls sold huge dumplings which came with straws for the soup inside, touts were abundant and the place was buzzing.

title: Gorgeous Gardens
content: A wonderful way to spend a sunny day in Shanghai and a GREAT photo opportunity!  The ponds, buildings, and statues are beautifully done.  You will not be disappointed.

title: A Classical Chinese Garden
content: Yuyuan ( Yu Garden) is a classical Chinese garden from the Ming Dynasty. A great place to go see Chinese architecture from 400 years ago. Everything is well preserved and showcases the beauty, of landscaping, rockery, and buildings all blending in harmoniously.

title: Beautiful Chinese Heritage
content: The scenery was truly amazing and the architecture was very interesting to look at. A really big contrast to the skyscrapers and busy lifestyle. It was peaceful, clean and exciting. Do prepare to spend approx 2 hours there as it is huge and takes a while to get out. Definitely worth a visit to learn more about Chinese culture.

title: Worth the walk thru
content: The garden is easy to walk thru and worth the visit . Not a rainy day activity . The serenity of the garden is something you feel if the crowd is at I minimum . This is a tourist attraction .

title: Perfect old Chinese garden
content: An amazing oasis in a crowded city.  It is wonderful to see this old garden preserved and it is a gem.  We enjoyed our time there very much.

title: worth a stop
content: 400 year old garden and water ways.  Old buildings and a large area of concessions, food places.   Crowded

title: Beautiful old china in the heart of modern shanghai
content: This beautiful park is quite a find. Hidden in the back of the touristy markets it is a refreshing piece of old China. It has so many hidden gems and cubby holes. It's a much bigger park than first glance suggests. I spent a good hour and a half here and will be coming back with my five year old who will love the hidden rock corridors and big fish ponds.

title: Yu gardens
content: These were well worth seeing. I particularly liked the carp pool also the old, very old buildings.a lovely afternoon

title: History and beauty
content: Beautiful and interesting gardens in the middle of old town. We were fortunate to have a guide, Lisa from Miki Tours who was able to explain the intricacies of the Chinese garden and the history of this very special garden. It was one of the highlights of our trip to Shanghai.

title: Best Dumplings!!
content: Fun place to visit ..... Very touristy though so be warned !! Great food though dumplings to die for

title: Beautiful Ming Garden
content: Well worth a visit to see the gardens. There is also much commercial surrounding the gardens, but you probably won't get a good price there. If you are looking for pearls, jewelry or jade, you will probably do better at a place like HongQiao Pearl Market. It is not very easy to get a cab after you have visited the gardens - be prepared to walk a ways to the nearest Metro station.

title: Ancient Yu Garden (Yuyuan)
content: Ornate buildings with a blend of unique and natural elements makes this a beautiful garden to visit. There is a fee to enter but worth the visit. This is a typical Chinese garden that contains architecture, decorative rock formations, plants, trees, flowers and water elements along a winding path. There are many elements to this garden, with hidden features to find.

title: A step back in time.
content: Very busy, but worth a visit. A glance at old China in the middle of New China. Adjacent to a re-creation of an old Chinese city which is really just a tourist rip-off.

title: Lovely and inexpensive
content: Lovely garden in busy Shanghai.  The cost was about 50 cents (10 RMB) to get in.  There were miles of walking trails.  It is truly delightful.

title: Expected more, so we were a little disappointed.
content: Interesting in places, but some of the exhibits aren't well lit, so they're difficult to fully appreciate or photograph.  Overall, the place seems overhyped.  Still, if you're in the area, it's worth a little of your time.

title: Too crowded and too touristy
content: It was interesting to note that Yu Garden had a very high proportion of Chinese tourists than foreigners. Although I understand that Yu Garden is well known by many Chinese, I would have expected them to settle for more authentic places and much less crowded. For Yu Garden is for me much too much crowded!

title: Enjoy the garden and shop.
content: Lovely garden in the middle of the city encircled with shopping options from street vendors to high end shops.

title: Yu Garden & Market
content: Well worth the visit.

title: Many nice stuffs (souvenirs) for family and friends
content: Dont expect quality but you can find a lot of stuffs, from traditional handicrafts up to modern toys such as drones with cheap price. Dont forget to start bargaining process with your lowest price.

title: Simply stunning
content: I made it to the gardens just before it closed and didn't have long to enjoy it. But from what I saw, I'd love to go back. The gardens were beautiful and serene. There were quite a few people there, but it stil felt like a calm relaxing place. The koi pond is stunning. And the various buildings and pavilions complement the environment perfectly.

title: Beautiful place
content: When visiting Shanghai you must absolutely make your way to the Yuyuan Gardens. It was truly an amazing place despite the fact that it was super crowded. We went super early in the morning to avoid the even bigger afternoon crowds and it was still super crowded. Once you get over that fact and just “got with it” you’ll have a great time.

title: Yu Garden- Be careful
content: IT was a great experience, but beware that so many people are around you and there are alot of pick pockets in the area.  The garden was crowded, but well worth a visit.

title: A dive in Shanghai's History
content: We, my wife and me, did visit this garden during a busy time in the city.

title: Very crowded Garden
content: Before you enter the Garden, you would have to go past crowds of people along the shop houses. Majority of the people are taking pictures and as the lanes are quite narrow, be prepared for a little shoving and pushing. Keep a look out for kids running around. Lots of stores selling Chinese baos and fried snacks (crabs, octopus balls, potatoes etc). If you look Caucasian, you would be stopped by Chinese asking if you would like to buy fake bags or watches.

title: Too many people
content: The view was nice, but there was too many people inside the Yuyuan garden. People were annoying, they convinced and even forced us to buy their stupid products by using rollerskates to catch us up, and what we did was avoid or shout at them. Too crowded place to go......

title: interesting mix of old and new china.
content: lovely garden,lot's of photo ops.aimed at tourists so very busy,even at less than peak times.the buidings are authentic-600 years old.

title: Tranquil and peaceful
content: After battling the hustle and bustle of crowds in the old Chinese quarter and I mean wall to wall people this Chinese garden offers you peace and tranquility which is a complete contrast to what you experience outside this garden . The ponds are stocked with large Carp

title: It's OK
content: Interesting, but a bit disappointing in my view.  Nice, but not outstanding gardens in the heart of the city.

title: Wonderful. Out of the time.
content: I loved walking in this garden, in the hearth of Shanghai downtown. Crossing its door, you have the feeling you are traveling in a time machine. Everything is quite, silent, magic, slow! It's really wonderful and extremely cheap!

title: Great walking and shoppping spot.
content: This whole area before you get into Yu Garden is full of tourist shops and eating places.All the buildings are magnificently carved and very exotic.Great place for photo's around the ponds and waterways.Yu Garden is tucked away amidst the shops and an entry fee has to be paid.Once inside you wander around old rock carvings and waterways.Nothing spectacular.Nice place for a couple hours but not all in Yu Garden.

title: The Garden in the city.
content: Great garden to visit. It also has a great history. One can really enjoy Chinese landscape gardens visiting this garden. There are huge & old trees. Also a big pond with carper fishes.

title: Nice small garden park, in interesting Old Town area
content: This is a small park, in the Old Town just near the zig zag bridge. Would get there early 9 or so if possible as it can get busy. A few interesting small buildings inside and views over to Pudong. Good to combine this with a visit to the rest of the local Old Town area and also close to the Bund

title: Nice Place in Shanghai
content: It is a nice place in the industrial Shanghai. Been there two times. However it looks like too commercialized- I do not need pear earings when visiting the gardens. Anyway- I have some art pieces hanging on the walls at home I bought here...

title: Amazing oasis in the middle of chaos
content: Take the time to spent half a day here wandering through various entrances to find another hidden space. Just amazing to think that the garden has been in Shanghai for thousands of years. You can get get some great photos with the skyscrapers in the background of your photos - mix of old and new Shanghai.

title: nice part of Shanghai
content: When you are in Shanghai do not miss that attraction, It is really nice especially for european people. Worth to visit

title: Not too exciting
content: It is quite interesting to visit Yu Garden: it gives a god idea of the real traditional chinese garden. The problem is that it is not a big garden and only few spots are interesting. The other issue is that the place is too crowded. As a whole, Yu Garden is a small island in a modern Shanghai. It is better to spare time and visit the gardens in Suzhou

title: A good garden to visit if you are only seeing Shanghai
content: Go early, really early. The place is swarming with people mid-day. There are better gardens to see in places like Suzhou, but if you will only be in Shanghai, it is worth a look.

title: Not Worth to Pay the Entrance Fees
content: There was nothing special, and it cost a lot to get into the garden. You may get better photos, views and information on website and tripadvisor, and you may avoid the crowd.

title: Tourist attraction with buy stuff for real cheap
content: There are lot of cheap stuff in there, while you are walking to the Garden. If you are visiting better plan to visit Jade Buddha temple also at the same time. Buy stuff from there but make sure to bargain. If the price is 400, actually value may be around 100.

title: Yu Garden
content: Gorgeous and a must in Shanghai. Near the Yuyuan Market. Took many beautiful pictures. This was very crowded however you just move with the flow. A nice mix of architecture, greenery and stunning shots of the old and the new.

title: Go early!
content: Plan to hit the ground at YuYuan by 8 a.m. This will give you time to walk around the area, take in the zig-zag bridge, etc, before the garden opens at 8:30 a.m. Try to be one of the first in, and ditch the tour groups as early as possible. If you do this, YuYuan is a lovely garden, with lots of hidden treasure like rock caves, excellent views, and quiet gazebos. The area around the garden is also not to be missed - the souvenirs are pretty lackluster, but there's some great food spots in the area.

title: Another tourist attraction
content: In general, Yu Garden is combined with several area including the garden, temple, and the shopping area around. You need pay for the ticket to see the scenery there where you can see the beauty of the landscape and wonder how those ancient Chinese can come up with the idea to make the garden so nice made. You can spend sometimes here to walk around and take some photos.

title: A pretty space in Shanghai
content: The Yu Garden consists of the four elements of Chinese gardening: water, rocks, trees and plants, and the pavilions. It's a relatively small garden, and was extensively restored in the 1960's, after its destruction during conflict. It is very pretty, but the number of visitors means that a space designed for quiet contemplation has just the opposite effect!

title: Very nice! Not to be missed.
content: This is one of the main attractions in the city. It is better to go early in the morning (as everywhere else in China) so you can fell the place with less tourists. The City God Temple is beside the garden and there are lots of stores and places to eat around there.

title: One of My Favorites of Shanghai
content: I loved this garden. Words simply cannot do it justice. The gardens are spectacular, the architecture beautiful and the history....where to even begin. It is crowded with many people but it makes for a great people watching area after you have enjoyed the gardens. Definitely one of Shanghai's highlights for me. Highly recommended.

title: Nice view of Chinese culture and architecture, great place for shopping!!
content: Please do not expect much of garden in this place but this place gives a feel of real China in city like Shanghai where you would mostly find skyscrapers...It would take a day to explore all shops, there are many of them selling variety of things!!

title: Just magical, everyone should visit at least once in their lives.
content: A really magical place, we enjoyed it, it reminds you of old chinese civilisations, the ambiance is incredible.

title: Must visit in the Early Evening time
content: This is a must visit place in Shanghai as I feel that this is the only place which is well preserved and has a old world charm. Lots of people visit this place and hence this is best visited during the weekdays. Plan to visit this place during early evening (2-3 PM) as this closes by 5 PM. You can take some excellent photos in the evening as all the small lakes inside look beautiful in the Night.

title: Chinatown in China town
content:
Good place to visit, very busy on weekends - during the week is better.
Seemed slightly kitsch - a place for the tourist to pick up some gifts - some good  street food around. I would take someone there on their first visit to Shanghai.

title: peaceful gardens
content: The Yu Garden is an oasis within the city of Shanghai.  Ponds, hidden stairwells, history abounds and welcomes the traveler.  A must see while visiting Shanghai

title: A marvelous garden, serene with unbeliable structures.
content: A walk through this once private garden makes you feel like you want to stay there permanently. The garden is a serene, harmonious and pleasant ambiance full of fine buildings to meditate, spend a peaceful day enjoying the rock garden, the fish ponds, the walk ways and enjoying all aspects of a Chinese garden requirements, wood, water, rocks and flowers (trees). We spent a beautiful afternoons here. Get there early preferably at opening time because crowds increases later.

title: Day in Shanghai
content: Yu Garden is simply beautiful. An ancient Chinese garden that is very well designed. The rocks are amazing to see, they're naturally curved differently. It is very large & so much to see & enjoy. A must see when in Shanghai.

title: Beautiful
content: This is a very beautiful Chinese garden. Very well designed. Ideal place to relax and spend an early evening evening.

title: A Labarinth of a Garden
content: Managed to pick a time when not to many people about and got some great photos. Garden is like a labyrinth on multiple levels, so have a great time getting lost.

title: Beautiful little jewel in old downtown
content:
Beautiful and serene spot to enjoy a slice of history in this busy
City. It is a maze of rock, water,and greenery that is pleasant and peaceful. There is also enough diversity for the young folks.

title: Yu Garden !
content: This is one of the best places to visit in Shanghai, China. An amazing and unforgettable experience with a beautiful view !

title: Be aware of Street Vendors
content: One street vendor gave me a "fake" 100 yuan notebank. The original is quite similar (but smaller) to a real 100 Taiwanese Dolar. TRICK:  All chinese banknotes show Mao's image...!!!  Do not accept any other bill...!!!!

title: Interesting
content: I was expecting a park but instead found myself in an elaborate garden. Easy to get lost in here. Very picturesque. Definitely worthwhile to visit.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Interesting for a quiet day
content: This venue gets very busy so pick your time/day. An interesting opportunity to see how the other half lived and will offer a worthwhile destination if you are looking for something for a couple of hours.

title: Pearl hidden away in city
content:
A pearl within the hustle and bustle of the city. 
Beautiful gardens and traditional buildings.  Some are a little tatty but really interesting

title: A PEACEFUL SPOT AWAY FROM THE RUSH AND BUSTLE OF THE TOURISTS IN OLD CHINA TOWN
content: These beautiful and peaceful gardens are located in the centre of Shanghai's China Town. They are an excellent example of Classical Chinese garden architecture.

title: Not fun place with Toddler.
content: Took my 19 month and and family there. It was hot summer end of Aug. Too many PEOPLE there... No air condition in any stores. All those small business in the area fun to look at it. I was not impress at all... Try to have lunch there... but, it was not worth the heat, and just too many people. We only stayed there for less an hour, left... side note: try to change diaper for my 19 months old, in China, modern city like Shanghai, still not "update" at all. There is no changing table in any of public bathroom AT ALL.... :-(

title: Week day so much better
content: Visited solo ( yes American woman who can take Chinese metro on her own and get lost in Shanghai ended up here ....)

title: Hidden Gem
content: Yuyuan is a beautiful Oasis in the heart of Shanghai, it has a great history and is worth the small entrance fee to take a walk through. There is great shopping surrounding the garden, especially down Fang Bong Lu just to the south of the gardens. From Henan Lu all the way down to the river along Fang Bong are great little shops.

title: Enjoy & Haggle
content: The shops and bazzars offer all sorts of tourist and localy produced mercendise but be prepared to haggle ticket prices mean little to what you will pay. The gardens are well recreated and the area is vibrant and safe.

title: Sensational Chinese Gardens Steeped in History
content: Wow, first started in 1559, the most beautiful Chinese gardens with photo opportunities everywhere . Outstanding visit despite the massive crowds typical of this enormous city.

title: Lovely scenic garden
content: This is a beautiful garden and on much bigger grounds than we expected. We spent about 2-3 hours here, just wandering and taking in the sights. Lots of photo opportunities, with ponds, pagodas, gardens with willow trees and more. Because there is so much space, it doesn't seem as busy as it really is. Try to find a spot to just sit and take it all in for a little while.

title: Overrated
content: I had read really great reviews about this place but it was an absolute waste.its just lik any other garden nothing special.skip the garden and near by there is a great place to shop with chinese style buildings. do bargin if you go shopping.

title: Gem inside the crazy market
content: If you wanna get off the crowd in the market and have some peace and quiet (assuming the chinese mob did not invade this place), you can come here and admire the old garden of a very rich person from before.

title: Beautiful and Restful
content: We were very fortunate that our guide got us to the Garden when it was not too busy. This is one of the better gardens to visit. Really good to see with a guide to give hestory but would be well worth the visit on own.

title: Simple garden & crowded market
content: Such as a coins Yu Garden and the market has two opposite sides, one side represent place for to take a breath and one side full of people, very crowded. Yu garden represent the old culture of Chinese and the market, you can find a lot of stuffs out there, and forget to bargain the stuff!!!

title: Beautiful!
content: This garden was beautiful! So many different paths and scenic spots. It would have been easy to spent the entire day here and still not see everything. Very peaceful and relaxing.

title: Little bit of paradise
content: These gardens are well worth a visit, meticulously maintained and very conveniently located. In addition to beautiful Chinese flora, the gardens provide a fascinating glimpse into ancient Chinese history. Photo opportunities abound.

title: Beautiful
content: These gardens are so beautiful, a must visit if you are in Shanghai. They have an interesting history and a particular design, but can be enjoyed just for the views and walks.

title: Take the time and enjoy the Garden
content:
This was interesting and informative and a pleasant way to spend an hour.

Do the fish feeding as they make a great sight/photo opportunity.

title: Amazing
content: Really amazing place, hidden behind the high wall - a border between modern (crowded and fast moving forward) and old (calm and peaceful) Shanghaj. Beautiful, relaxing, picturesque,fairy-tale place. "Must see" in SHG.

title: Oriental garden
content: A beautifully sculptured garden within the city..a nice walk for fifteen minutes..the area is surrounded by hundreds of stalls and shops selling art effects,gift and souvenirs

title: Definitely worth a visit...
content: Visited this place with our family who was in town visiting China for the first time.  We were all very impressed with it. I would recommend to anyone that wants to see some Chinese heritage.

title: Extremely impressed - now I know the reason for the name of my local takeaway
content: Do it, didn't know about it before my trip, great way to spend an hour or two. Beware of getting lost outside of it though. Lots of tea and pearl merchants willing to deal with you if you want o haggle HARD

title: Cannot not love this place
content: This garden was one of many typical Chinese gardens I visited during my China tour but that did not make it less beautiful. I loved the serenity of this place as it was tucked away behind a very busy shopping area in Shanghai. There were many locals there too just enjoying the peace, reading or spending time with friends and family. I visited with a guide who explained some of the history and I really enjoyed that.

title: Don't Miss the Shanghai Steamed Dumplings
content: A great shopping area with a Temple and a famous Garden. Don't miss out on a lunch or dinner feasting on Shanghai style dumplings in various flavors in several restaurants in the Yu Garden area. A busy lively place on the weekend and late afternoons. Best visited on a weekday late morning for fewer crowds. Visiting the shopping area and walkways is free. There is a charge to enter the Gardens and the Temple.

title: Nice
content: Great and well mantained garden of Mandarin. Nice to see and to get relaxed from warm and humid Shanghai climate.

title: Beautifully tranquil place
content:
Haven of peace and tranquillity.

However as with many public places in China, the toilets are appalling.

title: Do come
content: This is a really nice place if it was not for the sheer number of people coming and going into the gardens

title: Very busy, but beautiful
content: This spot was lovely to visit, and was a very popular spot when we were there, during the Chinese national holiday. Our guide, Sophie, was excellent in helping us navigate this site, and provide a lot of interesting information about the history and architectural features of the buildings and gardens.

title: Must do
content: Beautiful place to walk around, have tea, shop at the traditional market and enjoy the scenery. Great place to buy souvenirs too.

title: Beautiful, Peaceful Garden
content: This was the most relaxing part of our trip to Shanghai. It's a very quiet, beautiful garden right in the middle of the city. You can learn a lot about the history of the city in here. It's about $20 USD to get it and definitely worth it.

title: Step back in time
content: A wonderful garden with peace and tranquility set in contrast in amongst busy and bustling Shanghai definitely worth a visit if your missing some green space and calm.

user_loc: 西班牙大加那利岛拉斯帕尔马斯
title: In the middle of the busy city you can enjoy beautiful
content: In the middle of the busy city you can enjoy beautiful walks there. Close to the hotel I stayed, restaurants, shops and the better : convenient subway station to move in Shanghái.

title: Eh, there are better things to do in Shanghai
content: This place is a bit of a tourist trap. Usually crowded with tour bus groups and you will be hassled by locals trying to scam you into tea or taking their photo. Ignore anyone who approaches you.

title: Beware of the crowds
content: This is an area of old classic buildings and also a garden. The place is often extremely crowded which makes it impossible to enjoy. After a while you just want to run away as fast as possible. Avoid weekends and public holidays. If you want to visit try to come as early as possible on a normal working weekday. Otherwise its just a waste of time.

title: Beautiful Garden
content: Beautiful garden. The only problem is that it was full of people so you will get pushed the entire time.

title: Fun and interesting...not for the tired.
content: This area is fun.  It's extremely crowded, but it's all in a good time.  Plenty of places to barter for souvenirs, have some Starbucks or dumplings, and just people watch.  Go when you have energy to handle the crowds and the "buzz".

title: A garden -mmmm!
content: Being British I was probably expecting more from my visit to the garden. To get in and out you have to go through a busy market, where we were told to be careful of our belongings! Approached by several people trying to sell watches - just ignored them! Across a zigzag bridge - quite interesting when explained to you by guide - but absolutely packed with people. When you get in the garden there are a few buildings of interest, a pond or two, some carvings of dragons and a few big rocks - but nothing that really impressed me sorry! The Koi fish and turtles were the best thing about the garden. Then it suddenly ends and another run the gauntlet past the market stalls to get out!

title: House of Rich People at Old Time
content: Yu Garden Formerly is a House of someone in the old time. This is Example of Rich Person House. This House have a big size and also have a Garden inside. Mostly Rich People House at the old time they have big garden with so many Big Stones. The stones symbolize the owner is rich because the owner can provide man power to bring the stone to their house. Nice Example of Rich People house that we can still see nowdays.

title: Unpleasant due to crowds
content: One of the most hectic moments of our trip to China. So crowded that you could barely move. People constantly bumping into you.

title: September 2014
content: In this garden I really enjoyed with the great view and even the fishes .. I will add pictures in the near future...

title: Too crowded!!
content: Unfortunately way to crowded, you get stung by selfie sticks every few meters. Thus we were unable to enjoy the garden properly.

title: A chance to escape the concrete jungle
content: This garden is set in the busiest of bazaars but once you are inside you feel like you've stepped into an oasis. It is busy and a little bit touristy but there are some little quiet areas where you can sit down and relax. It is fun to get lost among all the weaving paths and stone caves as well as enjoy the architecture. My favourite part was seeing the fish and turtles swimming in the pond (can you tell I like animals?).

title: Definitely worth a visit.
content: More a living museum than a garden, we very much enjoyed our visit to the Yu Garden.  Ignoring the ubiquitous trinket sellers, the buildings, structures and stone-works that make up the Gardens are fabulous.   It is a walk through a piece of Chinese history.

title: Best garden we saw in China
content: We visited several gardens during our recent trip to China and Yu Garden was definitely the best in spite of the crowds. If you have the opportunity to visit on a weekday the crowds will be smaller (but still busy, after all you are in one of the most populated cities in the world!). It is divided into six different area connected by a labyrinth of walkways which can make it difficult to see everything, but take your time as it is well worth it. You'll feel like you have stepped back in time compared to most of the rest of ultramodern Shanghai. The Huxinting Tea House, built in 1784 offers a pleasant place to stop and relax with a cup of Chinese tea. And the huge rockery dating from the Ming period is considered to be one of the best in China. Bring your camera as there are lots of beautiful photos to be taken!

title: Nice stroll if you have nothing else
content: I think Yu garden is a nice park however I would go there if I have nothing else to do. It's a nice walk if the weather is nice. Watch out for mosquitos though if it is hot, we went when the weather was hot and there were lots of mosquitos good thing I was wearing long sleeves. I did find it fun looking at the different people doing various exercises (walking backwards and etc).

title: Peaceful Garden
content: Thus gorgeous and ancient garden complex surrounded by arrays of shops selling souvenirs. One of the most beautiful garden in Shanghai. Its a lovely green oasis in the heart of the city. There are ponds, rock garden, ancient Chinese pavillions. A lovely way to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Like most tourist attraction in China, this one does gets very crowded, but dont let that deter you. The garden in very large that its doesnt feel very crowded at all.

title: Quiet Time in an Historical Garden
content: Our group was able to visit this site on our last day in Shanghai. It was very education as to the Yuyuan Garden and it residential site.

title: Relax in the Garden
content: This was a lovely diversion from the hustle bustle of the adjacent shopping district. Step through the gates and into a peaceful haven where you will be greeted by trees, flowers and rocks, water, bridges, pagodas....... The size is quite impressive and some of the scenes are stunning. Cameras at the ready.

title: Peaceful respite
content: A beautiful oasis in such a busy city. Beautiful gardens, lakes and areas to sit and reflect. Have a great deal of respect for the builders of these beautiful areas.

title: Good for timepass
content: Surrounded by shopping arcades and streets full of shops selling duplicated electronic items and replica clothing, you can spend atleast half your day in this area.

title: shopping in china
content: best shopping either in shanghai or Beijing is around yu garden. To enter the garden needs to pay 30 yuan.

title: Oriental gardens at their best.
content: These gardens are both tranquil and stunning to see. Managed for more than 400 years, the 6 different areas are full of old trees, beautiful flowers and oriental buildings. It's the perfect was to spend an afternoon if you are in Shanghai.

title: Exquisite
content: Very beautiful. Despite the endless crowds i could still find a quite, peaceful spot in this exquisite garden maze. Every new area you explore is unique but just as stunning as the one before it.

title: Hidden gem in central Shanghai
content: What an amazing Oasis in the center of the city! You cannot miss it ! It was one of the highlight of my stay in Shanghai

title: A Shopper's Paradise
content: Absolute Must Visit !!! "Nice Architecture and history" but that's not what I am going to write about. The place is filled with small & medium shops offering souvenirs, gift items and what not ! The prices quoted is a little high but you will have ample margin to bargain and get a very good deal. We shopped like crazy there and were able to pick bag full of gifts and souvenirs. Shopkeepers are extremely friendly and you will have great time there.

title: TRANQUIL HAVEN IN SHANGHAI
content: Peace and tranquillity despite the hoards of tourists, this garden was a pleasure to visit and the nearby markets good value.

title: Summer pallace at shanghai
content: Nice location, you can learn about chinese history here. Better went there not at public holiday, you enjoy here more comfort. For family traveller is better, you can teach lot thing here to your child.

title: Visit to china town
content: This is a very interesting place and lots of shops with chinese soveniers but one large building on the outside off china town is all  wholesale, the prices are halve or les and you can bargen.

title: Nice buildings and interesting history
content: The buildings were nice, but it wasn't as much of a garden as I thought it would be.  It was very large though and it does take a while to go through.   Lots of history and great architecture.

title: Nothing much, could be missed
content: Not sure if its the crazy pushy crowd, but the whole place is just filled with commercial shops selling the same tired trinkets, etc.

title: weekend day off
content: three of us went to Yu Garden one afternoon walked around did some shopping and had lunch.  This was the second time I was there - it is very nice, but we were there on a weekend and it as really crowded

title: Bazaar is amazing
content:
Yu garden is beautiful but the bazaar outside is awesome.
You get all the trinkets and souvenirs that you can ever imagine there at very low prices.
Best place to shop for chinese stuff!

title: Beautiful Private Garden in the midst of Touristy OLD TOWN
content: The YU Garden belonged to the Yu family. It is their compound-like home set among a traditional beautiful Chinese garden. It is now surrounded by a very touristy shopping area that attracts locals as well as tourists for great shopping and entertainment.

title: A must-see, though quickly becoming overrun by tourists.
content: I visited the Yu Garden over the May Day (Labour Day) weekend which is apparently the busiest weekend for travel in China. Perhaps because of this, the gardens were flooded with tourists which made for a less than peaceful visit. I would hate to think that the garden is always that crowded.

title: I would go back again if I had the chance
content: It is so extensive, it just seems to keep on going forever. Yet I know that it is in fact in a much smaller area than it seems to be. So much effort to construct something that looks natural - tons and tons of rocks. So many plants. Canals and bridges. Tea houses. Ornamentation on the roofs. Every twist and turn offers a new view and a new sightline. Stunning.

title: Good break from the skyscrapers
content: On a business trip to Shanghai I had for once a couple hours to spare and figured I should get out of the hotel.

title: very special place
content:
This is gorgeous 
but the day we went is was extremely crowded and very hot so be prepared
lots of great photo opportunities

title: Pretty nice but bad organized
content: The place itself is pretty nice, old style Chinese garden, close to the city center. But  connection and organization is again a Chinese disaster.

title: Haven in the city
content: You gardens are a favourite place for me in shanghai, the area all around the gardens is fabulously touristy, the buildings are all traditionally Chinese and have been converted into shops selling everything you can think of, but once you have paid the small cost to enter the gardens it really is a haven of tranquility, lots of streams filled with koi carp, pagodas and endless photo opportunities of the beautiful flowers and trees.

title: Not that inspiring
content: Went to the gardens during a business visit to Shanghai. It is set in the midst of the a very busy shopping area, with vendors of all sorts of goods. The entry on a weekday in July at around 11 AM was very crowded, and one had little chance to take in the sites amidst the crowds. The garden itself was not that impressive. While the natural stone pieces were impressive, the greenery was not, and there was little sense of peace or calm anywhere within the setting. I tend to seek out similar sites when I travel, and was quite disappointed by this one, probably better things to do with a couple of hours.

title: Beautiful oasis in the heart of Shanghai.
content: These are the nicest gardens we visited in China. I recommend going as early as possible, as they get busy during the day. An early visit will ensure many opportunities to take good photos and spend a quiet moment or two in the gardens.

title: Garden Overrated, Food (Xiao Long Bao) not worth it.
content: If you heard the local shops near the garden had excellent Xiao Long Baos, then you will want to think again. The food there is crap, the places are dirty and crowded, and it is overpriced. You're better off going to a Din Tai Fung in Shanghai. There is actually one in that area as well. I went to one at the SuperBrand Mall, and I thought it was quite good by comparison.

title: Beautiful
content: Fantastic space in the middle of a busy bustling area of town. You walk down narrow streets where it's full of vendors bartering all sorts of trinkets and then you approach a large beautiful park setting. The ponds are full of Koi and the architecture of the buildings is magnificent with dragons and lions either as statues or carved into the buildings.

title: Cool Place to Visit
content: Great place to go and walk through, buys things and observe the structures. Pick a good time to go or it'll be really crowded. Best times should be around the mornings and early afternoon, don't go too late or during rush hour

user_loc: 加利福尼亚卡尔斯巴德
title: beautiful refuge from city life
content: Beautiful garden in the heart of the city.  The garden and architecture are well worth the entrance price and provide a  nice contrast to the bustle of the Bazaar area.

title: A miracle of nature
content: Great walk to feel yourself calm and peaceful. It is at center of the city but it is so quiet and pleasant environment that you can sit on a bench, admire the nature and forget all the problems. It is absolutely what you need for stress release!!

title: Cute rest on a sightseeing day
content: Was a good rest in the middle of a sightseeing day. Found it interesting to watch the local people around us - the park itself is quite cute (but don't expect anything spectacular)

title: Quick Morning visit
content: Opens at 8.30am and 30 Yuan to get in during the off season. The garden is a nice breath of fresh air and decent view of the garden. So worth it. However getting to the gardens can be a mission as it is inside the markets and easiest entry is at Gate 3 next to KFC. The markets are great as well but people are all up in your face. So go early to avoid the crowds.

title: Beautiful Oasis in a busy City
content: Geat place with beautiful feel to it. Very typically Chinese and set in the middle of a busy local street that bustles with food stalls where the locals and tourists can sit and eat delicious local food. Must say the toilets were not too great, but that is the only drawback

title: Interesting garden with lots to look at
content: Visited the yuyuan area including the old village and the garden within. While the village area is very touristy the reprieve of the garden is worth the visit as it is a quiet oasis in a very busy area. There were lots of courtyards and interesting architecture including temple/stage area. The entrance is via the zig zag bridge and isn't very expensive 40 yuan each. Worth fighting the crowds to get there!!

title: Beautiful Chinese Garden
content: If you are fascinating to see the Chinese garden design here is a good place for you the see the Chinese old style building along the fenshui design.  The plantation the interior and the stone and pounds are well decorated like a small palace.

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州戈尔兹伯勒
title: Don't miss this while in Shanghai
content: This is an ancient Chinese formal garden, complete with lovely buildings, lanterns, water features, ornate walls, and formal plantings.  A must-see in this varied and charming city.

title: Check it out
content: It's a good example of the Chinese garden. If you are only in Shanghai and do not have chance to see other gardens, try Yu Garden. Entrance costs 30rmb which is not expensive for the time and views you get.

title: Tranquility after the madness
content: Yu Graden is about £3 to enter & is really old & tranquil with passageways & ponds etc - really peaceful & amazing to know how many years it's been there BUT outside the shops & street markets are the polar opposite with crowds, noise and chaos which in its own way is also great to experience

title: Hidden beauty
content: This place is magical. The gardens are set in old Shanghai but very close to the bottom of the Bund so walkable. If you do walk you see the local area surrounding the gardens, not the glitzy, western Shanghai but the real one, which is in itself is fascinating. The city bus tours also stop at one of the many entrances to to gardens. The Yu Yaun Gardens themselves are set within a maze of lanes with the usual tacky gifts on offer and some quite nice gift shops and eateries/coffee shops and tea shops.

title: Below my expectation
content: This place is so crowded, and relatively small. If you have a lot of money, than you can spend some time, but I personally do not want to recommend.

title: Cant miss, must see, must do !!!
content: Old China flavor, everything from fried bats to fried rice !! hahaha

title: Very touristic place
content: Everything is Chinese traditional architectural styles. Filled with tourists from all over the world.

title: Worth seeing
content: Be prepared to be in a very crowded place. The look and feel is quite authentic, but the shops are quite expensive. If you want a good deal, go to the shops on the outskirts. The actual Yu Garden is quite serene and beautiful. The entrance is not quite so intuitive, so look for it specifically.

title: Best Place to Feel Old Shanghai
content: It's the place for you who want to feel the old shanghai exterior with a lot of food variety and also to shop. The provide variety of souvenirs and Chinese antiques. The garden is large and spacious yet full of crowd. You can feel the hype.

title: Nice garden and close to bazaar
content: The garden is nice enough.  Fairly small with nice upkeep.  Best part is that it is quite close to the Old Town bazaar.

title: highly recommended
content: wonderful to get the feeling of the old history of china with paceful visit (inside, since outside is really full of people)

title: Too crowded
content: As with many "must sees" in China, the Yu Garden is just too crowded. If you would have time to enjoy it, it is a very nice designed park. When I was visiting, I could unfortunately not enjoy, since it was hard to see the garden, due to too many people.

title: Miserbly Hot Day
content: I guess this was a nice enough garden, but I feel like it pales to the gardens of the rich of England, Italy, and France. It was a miserably hot day, crowds were shoulder to shoulder, but Even with the water nearby, no cooling relief was to be found. Like many tourist attractions in China, they are clean but need maintenance.

title: Must visit
content: We found it little difficult to reach there on foot; but while walking around we explored the old shanghai, true experience of ancient Chinese lifestyle. Very well made with many shopping and eating options. There are many many stalls of fine Chinese silks, chopsticks, souvenirs etc. which ensures you taking back memories from shanghai . Very well made garden and amazing to spend a nice day serene and scenic.

title: One of the best parts of Shanghai
content: We had a personal tour with Claire who shared so many wonderful tidbits about the gardens and Chinese culture in general, like the story behind having male and female lions at the entrance, etc. Fascinating! Feeding the Koi fish was fun, too. The washrooms were pretty clean here, FYI, in case you're out and about and having a tough time finding a place:)

title: Beautiful but busy
content: This is a stunning garden with water, rocks and plants combining to give a beautiful landscape.  Unfortunately it was also packed with people and so I could not appreciate the peaceful design

title: Interesting, but often crowded and very touristy
content: There are some good snacks to eat there if you know where to look and great old architecture. Fun place to walk around and soak up the atmosphere. The trinkets and souvenirs greet you at every street, so expect Tourism catering.

title: Beautiful gardens. Go early.
content: Beautiful gardens. It is a must in a Shanghai visit, together with the Pudong, Tian Zi Fang and the Museum of Comunist Posters and Propaganda. You should go there early in the morning (before 10am) and not on a weekend if possible because it gets really crowded.

title: Crowded and overpriced
content: We did not have tea at the tea house because each person was required to order his/her own pot. There were two men sharing a pot at a nearby table. When we asked why we couldn't share like them, we were told that the two men worked at the tea house. There were no other customers being served... Now we know why.

title: wonderful garden
content: it's a wonderful garden in the center of Shanghai. it's a nice site with old buildings, full of shops and market. you can feel at all in china in this place. the garden has a fee to enter, but the cost is affordable 30 RMB for adults and 15 RMB students, retired and child. walking in the garden you can breath the oriental atmosphere, you can also relaxing near the river with fish or under a tree.

title: Go at 8:30am!
content: Go here right when they open at 8:30, you will essentially have the place to yourself. It is very peaceful, shaded, with many opportunities to take great photos of the gardens, architecture, ponds, rock formations, etc.

title: Overcrowded Tourist Trap
content: This place is a rebuilt fake Chinese style outdoor shopping mall, basically. But it has some really interesting and inexpensive shops.

title: Beautiful garden
content: Very pretty.  We went early on a weekday and crowds weren't bad at all.  Very twisty and winding paths, you will likely get lost and retrace your steps, but its not huge.  They have a couple of stores (cold water/drinks) and tea shop.

title: Peaceful corner in the middle of chaos
content: After visiting the whole city during the Chiese new year, i simply needed peace and phisical space in order to put some silence in my head. I had a test by visiting this Chineese garden. Really nice!

title: A compact but very charming little garden park
content: This is a compact but very charming little garden park with beautiful water features and has apparently been in existence in different layouts since 1577. The pavilions, halls, rockeries, ponds and cloisters all have unique characteristics. Unsurprisingly, it is very popular and being only 20,000 square metres in size, it can get busy! It is easily reached by Yuyuan subway station on line 10. Entrance fee is 40RMB.

title: 3rd time
