A lot of the text about the different buildings was in Chinese only so it was quite difficult to understand. Entrance is cheap though and it's close to the subway. Tip for finding the garden is just to follow the crowd walking from the metro.

title: Nice place to get lost..
content: ...if you can find it amongst the weekend crowd. The masses from the Yu Bazaar bleed over and make this a tough destination on the weekend. Once inside though it is more tranquil. All the structures and ponds are very nice. Be sure to see the dragon wall.. and sit beside a pond and watch the fish go by. It has a metro stop nearby and costs roughly $14 USD for two adults

title: Garden is nice but bazaar around it is horrible
content: Gardens are pretty, worth visiting but do not require a lot of time to visit.

title: If you like shopping
content: Our kids survived this one... crowded and lot of small shops. Great to see, but be ready. The crooked bridge across the pond is interesting, but once you see it, check. Isn't something to spend time at. If you buy something, be ready to negotiate. The shop owners enjoy a good haggle as long as you are respectful.

title: Nice garden in the middle of busy city
content: It's built in Ming dynasty by Pan family. It contains multiple rooms / halls, areas, and will take you several hours at least to look around. I was lucky during second visit in Sep 2016 as they had dance / martial art show from Beijing. It's located near Shanghai Metro Line 10 Yuyuan Garden station. Outside the garden, there is area called Yuyuan Bazaar, with many shops / foods, a popular tourist area.

title: Well Worth a Visit
content: This garden has all the features of a classical Suzhou-style garden: pavilions, ponds, rocks, walkways, bridges… If you want to see the garden when it is less crowded you shoud be there before 9 am, or during lunch hour, or late in the afternoon, all times when tours are doing something else. It is easy to get near the garden by getting off at the Yuyuan Garden station of metro line 10 and walking straight east (toward the river), but once you reach the tourist bazaar, the signage peters out. Look for signs to the Jiuqu Bridge and you will find the garden ticket office just after you cross the bridge from the bazaar.

title: Nice but....
content: I like this area with the beautyful gardens & houses in the park. But it is very small and you can only walk on "snug" ways a tour. Doing this, with felt 100.000 other tourists: No fun at all.

title: So popular
content: I go there each time when go back my hometown, you can do a lot shopping and eat a lot kind of food, I love it.

title: Not that great
content: Some what ok place. I feel would have gone to a better place instead of this garden. Fully crowded place with not much interesting for foreigners.

title: Beautiful
content: Very besutiful place. Easy to get A bit lost in the area. Was A bit hard to find the entrance and where to buy tickets. If you have time and are in the neighbourhood It's worth 1-2h of your time.

title: Come here for the Xiao Long Bao(Steamed Pork Dumplings)
content: So.. It was said that Xiao Long Bao originated from here. This restaurant called Nanxiang which is found here. Tried it and it was fine. Been there, done that, bought a t-shirt, took a photograph.

title: Contrast
content: Love the contrast of the Old spirit and a background with the modern side of china, the architecture and paintings are beautiful, love the roof too as they simulate in some cases the dragons back

title: Hidden access through zoo
content:
You need to get into a typical messy commercial and food stands area to get into the park. The tickets place is at the northern area of the pond. 
The park is really calm and charming.

title: Garden is lovely - but be aware!
content: It is a bit of a mission to get there... you need to pass several stalls selling all kinds of trinkets, sunglasses, bags, scarves, food and more! Some of the stall owners are very keen, so just keep everything close to you and just be on your toes.

title: Walk The Yu Gardens
content: A must while in Shanghai, beautiful calming garden walking with lovely water features and buildings with the best dragons, gates and rock features. We enjoyed the history of the buildings and great shopping and tea houses just outside the gate!

title: Interesting Evening
content: We spent a little time in the garden during our evening in the old town. It was fun to walk across the zig-zag bridge but it was very crowded at times and although I felt OK I know others could find it quite uncomfortable.

title: Nice
content: We went to Yu Garden (Yuyuan) in the evening from our hotel near the Bund. Yu Garden is an extensive Chinese garden. The Garden was first built in middle 1500 during the Ming Dynasty.

title: Yuyuan Garden
content:
We enjoyed very much both the Yu Garden itself and the surrounding bazaar with 6 floors of incredible thins. 

We Loved It!!!

title: Free so we went in, not worth a special trip
content: This place was a near shopping area, it wasn't great but it was free so we went in. We saw some fish and not much garden. Was expecting more flowers, landscaping but there were more buildings with not much in them.

title: Yu garden. The shopping paradise.
content: If you want to buy something at low price, this is the place. You can have best silk, toys, clothes, gifts and alot of other things from here.

title: The busiest place in China
content: Lovely gardens, way too many people here - there are literally people jams in here. Do not go if you have claustrophobia! Eat before hand as the queues for the famous dumplings are really long. Chinese dont mind waiting - westerners will not wait an hour for food.

title: highlite of visit
content: absolutely fabulous had a guided tour it was wonderful could of spent longer there anyone visiting Shanghi should go there it is a must

title: Great place to vist for history and beauty
content: Go there on weekdays because weekends are crowed.  Good place to visit for history and beautiful ancient architecture.  Yo can go there for lunch because there are a lot of small shops that sell food.

title: Stunning!
content:
If you're a student, make sure to bring your ID to get a discount. 

You should not leave Shanghai without visiting this amazing garden. It is so breathtaking, nature and architecture are incorporated so well.

title: A peaceful place in the heart of a busy city.
content: The Gardens are located a few minutes walk from the Subway station. it's entrance is quite hidden as it is surrounded by Malls and shops. Once you enter (be aware there is a fee to enter) you feel like you are transported to a different city. The gardens are huge and full of places to explore and meander and take in the beauty. Ponds filled with fish abound and everything is very serene.

title: Lovely discover
content: Really beautiful and peaceful place in the middle of busy Shanghai. Perfect for thinking and relaxing.

title: Nice garden, surrounded by a very commercialized atmosphere
content:
The Garden itself would be nice, but it surrounded by all the fast food, souvenir shop and tourist atteaction you can think about.
Overcrowded, over everything

title: Amazing garden and architecture
content: Wow!!! Little piece of paradise amongst the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. Highly reccomended place when visiting Shanghai.

title: Nice ancient garden
content: The garden was worth a visit but we had gone during Chinese New Year so it was way way way too crowded but once you get in it is a really nice peaceful place

title: Tourity and worthy
content: crowded, but cmon, you are in asia, everywhere you go you will find people. Try the local dumplings, they are amazing.

title: Beautiful traditional Chinese garden
content: This is a very touristic attraction, but many people just stay outside and do not enter inside the gardens because you have to pay.

title: Peaceful place in the heart of the city
content: The Yu Garden is a great place to visit when in Shanghai. It is a gorgeous garden that has been constructed and renovated in the city from the years past. It houses a large amount of manicured stone, gardens, ponds and a large piece of jade. It is perfect for an hour walk through. It can get pretty busy in there with tourists, so I would try to get in there early in the day before more of the people come in. It can get a bit confusing inside so you should follow the flow of the garden to make sure you see all of the elements.

title: Yu yuan
content: A visit to Shanghai ancient city.  Worth a visit.  But seems like too many modern food stall and many selling the same item with different price.

title: Far too crowded
content: This place might be interesting, but is far too crowded and it's all about selling something. Perhaps the tea house is nice, but the tea is better in other places

title: Visited twice in 2 days
content: The Yu garden personally is nice & must visit. Outside Yu garden is another huge garden dat sells alot of things, foods etc. Yu garden sells d cheapest souvenirs n things in Shanghai as I encountered.

title: Peaceful authentic garden
content: Make sure to include this place in your list. After the lound streets of chinese souvenirs stores you will find peace and harmony here! Take the time to enjoy the calm. Of course it will be less crouded during the week than the week end.

title: Loved it
content: I spent a few hours here wondering around the gardens and temple here watching all the local people making things with paper, not sure at all what they were doing but they set these on fire afterwards.

title: Doesn't hurt
content: If you have a little time to spare, doesn't hurt to give it a little visit.

title: Cultural experience in midst of a bustling city!
content: Gorgeous architecture and lovely experience. Gold mine for a passionate photographer.  Tip: Don't go on weekends/holidays - it gets too crowded and you can't really enjoy the views because you get herded like cattle by other tourists.

title: Tranquil History
content: This place even though it was crowded (by our standards at least) was so beautiful. The stories that came from this place were so interesting. This place was  a haven for us at the end of a very busy holiday.

title: A great place to visit near Shanghai
content: A nice place to visit while you are visiting Shanghai. Its very near aand easy to get there. If you have time to go you should do it.

title: Never come during weekend
content: 1 of the must see place in Shanghai. However, the amount of people visiting during weekend had definitely spoilt the whole scene. Overall, a good historical place but nothing much interesting.

title: Amazing Lantern Festival
content: The Lantern Festival is always impressive over Chinese New Year and well worth getting through the crowds that swamp this place at that time of the Year

title: Just beautiful
content: This place is next door to Town of God Temple. It is stunning at night time when the lights on the building come on.

title: Interesting bit of history
content: As we had covered alot of ground on the first day of our tour did not have time to fit in the Yu Garden so our tour guide said he would take us there on our last day before we went out to the airport. It so happened that day was also the lunar New Year's Day for the Chinese and we had to go through a large market area to get there. Well it was totally chaotic. There must have been at least a million people or more in this area ( Shanghai's population is around 27 million people). We were pushed and shoved and at times was a bit scary that we might lose some of our tour group especially the leader. Eventually we got to the Garden and it was quite a lovely area. Very ancient and well preserved. A great photo opportunity well worth the visit even if we thought we would never get there in one piece with all the jostling crowds.

title: Pretty
content: Stylish Chinese pavilions in lovely gardens. Ponds full of large goldfish and carp. Very much worth the visit.

title: #1 tourist atttraction
content: very crowded but beautiful gardens and lanterns to see around. try to go really early to avoid all the crowds

title: Classic Serenity in a Modern Metropolis
content: The Yu Garden is an excellent place to stop by and check out for some peace and quiet in the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. The grounds are well kept. Entrance is cheap. Lots of old architecture to check out with numerous ponds, birds, and fish to see. Worth a look once.

title: Beautiful and lively
content: A really nice place to get a large dose of some nice Chinese buildings, Chinese stores of different types and colorful decorations.

title: If you can see beyond crowds it is a lovely garden and should be visited!
content: We went on a wet and very grey day in October. To get a sense of what an ancient Chinese garden is all about it is amazing. It is not however an opportunity to experience the peace of a garden; it is big on every Shanghai tourist itinerary and suffers accordingly from just too many visitors.

user_loc: 澳大利亚西澳大利亚州
title: Worth a visit
content: Was very crowded when we visited but was nice to walk around the streets to get a feel for what Shanghai would have looked like in a bygone era, unlike alot of Shanghai which is very modern. Would also suggest walking around the streets surrounding Yu Garden as well.

title: Nice place but avoid Chinese New Year to visit it
content: Yu Garden is always a place to visit in Shanghai. I have been there before, but with the crowd at Chinese New Year you should avoid it.

title: Crowded!
content: It must've been nice some years ago, but now is crowded and old, so it's not peaceful at all neither can you get good shots because everybody is just on top of each other.

title: Super crowded. Suitable for non Chinese
content: This place is like a huge China Town with a lot of shops selling selling Chinese souvenirs. If you have not been to any Chinese cities, this place is a must-see. But if you have been around the world like me, skip it and go to Xintiandi instead for a quaint place and to take a sip of coffee.

title: Wow beautiful
content: Great history and beautiful garden in the middle of Shanghai.  Beautiful walking paths past koi ponds and meandering trails through the gardens.

title: Well hidden attraction
content: What a lovely place to visit day or night, I have never seen so many carp in one place before , and the history of the Yu Garden , This garden is surrounded by a shopping mall which is built around the garden , as though it is a protection of the Modern world , I really loved the peacefulness of this place.

title: One piece of the heaven
content: If you wanna be a time traveler to the long long past and see the way of living the Chinese royal family and also hear lots of amazing story you should definitely go to this majestic garden.

title: Beautiful place
content: We went their during winter on a Sunday, the good news is as it not free the garden itself is not too clouded otherwise the surrounding are quite busy

title: Fantastic garden and lunch
content: I had lunch with my family at the restaurant located in the gardens. The food was excellent. We tried many other restaurants in Shanghai, but were not particularly impressed. However, we really liked this place. After lunch we walked around the garden and really enjoyed the experience.

title: Historical place
content:
Historical Place in Shanghai.
The dims um in front of its main entrance was delicious.
But Yu Garden was so crowded and smell was not that good.

title: a decent copy
content: Compared with Beijing and Nanjing historical attractions, Yu Garden is not an original but a reproduction. Still is the one of the few example of historical sites in Shanghai.

title: Must see tourist attraction.
content: Yuyuan garden is generally busy for a reason, its central, it's cheap and has a lot going on.

title: Fantastic!
content: A beautiful garden full of colour and history! A lovely quiet place hidden within the shopping district. Highly recommended!

title: A Must See
content: A beautiful authentic ancient garden in the middle of Shanghai. It is a series of different garden rooms with ancient Chinese buildings and beautiful trees and plants. The day we visited it had been raining and this only added to the charm of the garden. Really worth a visit!

title: Fabulous
content: The Yu Garden should be on your must do list of places in Shanghai. Entry cost 40 yuan per person although children under 1.3 metres are free, once inside you get a real feel of old China and wandering through the gardens with its lakes and buildings is a magical experience particularly as it is away from the hawkers that abound the area outside.

title: A relaxing place
content: Was in Shanghai for business, but had Saturday to relax and enjoy some free time. I read about this garden in lonely planet and thought I would check it out. An beautiful relaxing place to forget about a stressful week. Only 30 RMB, well worth it.

title: Just a market noting else
content: I don't know why this place have so many good reviews

title: Stunning Gardens
content: The day we visited here was rainy and this just seemed to make the gardens even more special as the plants and tress were all glossy and shined brightly. I think I took 100 photos as around every corner there was something new and interesting to look at. Yes it is a bit busy and taking a photo that had no one in it was hard, but that is China. I suggest a good telephoto lens such as and 18 to 105 as this way you can zoom into what you like and still get the wide angled shots to take in the full majestic nature of these gardens. The coy fish in the multitude of ponds in this garden were something I could watch for hours, they just seemed to be everywhere. Plan to stay for at least one hour in these gardens.

title: Beautiful garden
content: My colleague was nice enough to take me to you Gardens to see all of the wonderful architecture and Landscaping. The waterscapes were beautiful as was the stonework and the structures in the garden.

title: Very beautiful
content: This is a beautiful and fun place to visit. My friends enjoyed going around and getting photos. A SH must!

title: Yu Garden and surroundings
content: Excellent part of tour.  Many displays nearby as city readied for lunar new Year, year of the Rooster.

title: Nice afternoon
content: They were preparing for the New Year so lots of decorations. It was pretty. We enjoyed an official Chinese tea. Lots of shopping

title: Very nice garden and Koi
content: I was in Shanghai on business with my wife in April and there were a few public holidays for Tomb Sweeping day so some colleagues took us to see Yu Garden. We arrived early and there was hardly anyone there but after 10am it was so crowded that it became irritating. The garden was great and I really enjoyed watching the Koi with the manicured trees in the background. I recommend arriving at Yu Garden as soon as they open and don't go on a holiday or you will experience a really large amount of people. There are some tourist trap shops around the garden, you can find all of that stuff in other locations of Shanghai for less RMB. Shop owners seem to get upset if you look at their things and then don't buy anything, it was a bit strange for me. Even our Chinese colleagues advised us not to buy anything there. If you want to take a picture of the bridge, do it as soon as you arrive because later there will be a ton of people on it.

title: Lovely garden
content: Great history and lovely strolls. Interesting architecture, trees, flowers and rock formations. If you have xtra time, well worth spending time in a quiet place. Mixture of old and new seeing 450 year old pavilions and skyscrapers in the background.

title: Peaceful....
content: I am really glad to have visited this attraction. Nice to see the different architecture and garden designs. Really peaceful place in busy Puxi.

title: Interesting clash of China aspects
content: This is my favorite place in Shanghai. It is always a joy to go from the old gardens - beautiful - to the inner ring of trinket shops and dumpling restaurants, then out of that super touristy place, you find yourself in old Shanghai with street food and amazing bazars. In those ugly buildings, you find everything: beads, cheap toys, decoration for Xmas, Halloween, cny, and also mountains of stockings and rubber bands, scotch tape etc.

title: A Big Garden
content: A very interesting place ever visited. It's so crowded with people and commercial stuff, a good or bad mixture? No idea! Anyway, should visit the place again to see the changes being told, claimed to have big changes from the past.

title: Avoid at new year unless you like crowds
content:
The whole area was subject to incredible police control due to New Year.
Very easy to get funnelled into a stream of shuffling sightseers going to something that you did not plan on.
Will try to return some other time of year.

title: Yuyuan garden
content: Yu yuan or Yu garden is a beautiful place to visit but do not visit while Chinese New year or Chinese national day holidays it will be full of people the rest of the time is a great place to visit and also is located in the old city of shanghai , Shanghai is a great place to visit with lot of things to do or visit.

title: Beautiful and typical
content: A great walk in this place very unique and so different the rest of the city. Love to go there just to hang out and take pictures.

title: Pretty but crowded
content: Very busy with lots of tourist parties, very easy to slip and fall into the many water features. Easy to get lost.

title: Very Crowded
content: Visited during a weekday and it was still crowded. Many souvenirs shop for you to hunt for gifts. The prices here are not very cheap. If have time check out the eateries there.

title: avoid this place during holidays
content: We visited Yu Yuan during the first day of the Chinese New Year. BIG MISTAKE! This place resembled Times Square in New York City on new year's eve, It was jammed with people. In fact, on one block, there were People's Liberation Army soldiers standing shoulder to shoulder all the way down the street just to make sure that the crowds did not get out of hand. Yu Yuan may be a nice place to visit other times of the year but stay away during Chinese holidays!

title: The garden of Yu
content: I liked the Yu garden even though it was packed you could find a quiet place for your photos. It was as beautiful as I remember it from many years ago. It's nice to find peace in a busy city like Shanghai. The price is ok too at 30 yuan . The only disappointing thing about it was the crowds . It was too crowded the way people were funneled and pushed through the barriers going round in circles to reach the entrance seemed a waste of time, I'm sure there must be an easier way . All I was thinking was it's a fire trap and what if there was a stampede there be many casualties . It was still worth going. Thumbs up.

title: Nice.
content: We visited this for the first time 15 years ago, and it was a lovely peaceful area in the middle of a busy city. Now, it's just as busy and noisy as outside. Considering it is winter, it was very overcrowded. It's still a lovely garden, but I dread to think what it would be like in summer.

title: Very beautiful garden
content: Although going in December, the garden was still very incredible and.  I am certain that it is extremely beautiful in Spring and Fall.

title: classical chinese garden
content: lots of stores, one can shop and eat all day long here and interesting chinese architecture.  Hop-On-Hop-Off bus take us here,  Interesting night lights, we were here 3 years ago.

title: Best natural and original place of shanghai
content: This garden is a good representation of the local culture. The area is important well maintained and quiet. You can visit and learn part of the Chinese culture between these walls. All the Chinese history is guided by the dragon on the wall.

title: Lovely haven in the middle of the city
content: This I is a lovely garden to visit, let the kids burn off some energy and people watch. Shopping near by of all sorts- stalls with local wares and Gucci right down the street. This part of shanghai is a mishmash of great eye candy that can't be missed!

title: Awsome
content: It is the place where you can experienece real chinese traditional especially Yu Garden and the streets. Been there during chinese new year celebration and it was nicely decorated.

title: Beautiful and Interesting
content: These gardens are gorgeous. There are ponds with fish, beautiful houses with interesting oriental architecture. I personally took some great photos, and was blown away by the fact that there is barely anyone there!

title: A piece of authentic china
content: My last day before I flew back after some business meetings was free so I did the tourist thing.

title: History in the heart of Shanghai
content: Visit to the garden is a visit though the ancient China and all this, right in the center of the town. A visit is a must.

title: An interesting attraction in the heart of Shanghai.
content: Beautiful gardens, an interesting temple and many other aspects of Chinese culture all in one place in the heart of Shanghai. For those only visiting Shanghai, Yu Garden is a must see. If you are travelling to other areas though you can probably find more interesting gardens, temples, etc. Can get very crowded, so if you are able to try and go during the week. There are also some interesting stores and a great dumpling place in the same complex, it usually has a line, but it is worth the wait!

title: Visited this Garden on the way to the Hotel yesterday
content: Very interesting, a very old garden laid out many years ago in the Ming Dynasty & now very much protected by the State.

title: Very nice garden
content: The entrance fee is ok. Around 30RMB. The garden is very pretty. On the outside there are various restaurants, touristy shops etc.

title: Diverse temple complex
content: I loved it here, you start with all the tat shops selling their goods. Do not forget to bargain and even the smarter stores here would do a deal. I was here for Chinese New Year so all the buildings were adorned with chickens as it is soon to be the year of the rooster. Great fun for all ages to look at. The streets are straight out of Indiana jones movie and fun exploring. All sign posts in English. The temple itself compared to others is not the highlight but still worth a quick look around.

title: Nice Chinese garden in heart of city
content: Nice tough crowded typical Chinese garden in the heart of Shanghai. Some typical Chinese foods here and many souvenir shops

title: Interesting Place!
content: My wife and I visited to Yu Garden last week and it was very interesting.  To entry fee is very reasonable (30 RMB per person) and the gardens were very scenic.  Outside of the gardens there are hundreds of small shops to buy souvenirs.

title: Not necessary a must see
content: The place is super crowded almost all the time. Due to this is impossible to understand what to do or see if you have limited time. We spend there more than an hour but was very uncomfortable. If you want to eat was crowded, if you want to shop was crowded. People quite impolitely and you might be hit by the people around you.

title: Beware of the crowds on weekends and chinese holidays
content: I have somewhat a mixed feeling for Yu garden, if its not crowded its nice to stroll around here. A small garden for an extra fee as well in case you don't have time to go sightseeing to the big ones.

title: Amazing historic location
content: It was amazing walking around and just looking at this amazing historic home.  The architectural wonders were incredible knowing how old this home was.  Definitely worth the visit even though it was very crowded.

title: Hidden sanctuary
content: When thinking of Shanghai my first thoughts are of hustle and bustle, lots of traffic and even more people.

title: Well laid out gardens but packed with tourists (Sunday).
content: Apart from the crowds of tourists causing delays (mostly taking selfies!) and making lots of noise, this attraction was worth it. One can imagine the serene walks around the grounds in the early days, with the bridges, buildings, gardens, etc. Thought there wouldn't be too many people in early December - I was wrong.

title: You can get everything here
content:
Many tourist come to Yuyuan Garden..
There are stores sell souvenirs..
Also there are many food stall here..
Near by yuyuan garden there market that sell toys, drone, also souvenirs with cheaper price than from yuyuan garden..
So, happy shopping..

title: Right in the City!!
content: The contrast of the high rises and then suddenly this incredibly beautiful park amazed me. The garden has so much history and I really felt taken back in time... At one spot, they sell baby turtles that visitors can buy & set free (however, they will capture them again & re-sell)... You may get some waves of what smells like "sour milk" but is actually a very popular type of tofu ;)

title: Very lovely place
content: Very Chinese feel to it! Like stepping into ancient China. Definitely a must see. A little bit crowded so be careful to choose your timing. Maybe go a bit early as the narrow streets can get quite busy.

title: Amazing area!
content: This is a special little gem in the middle of the city.  We went just before Chinese New Year and the entire plaza was beautifully decorated!  Shops before the garden are cute stop in a few and buy some trinkets!

title: Very peaceful escape
content: Fantastic display of traditional gardens and architecture. Very busy when we went but flowed nicely despite the crowds. Well worth seeing. Buy some food to feed the fish.

title: Yu Yuan is great - but crowded outside
content: Yu Yuan Gardens is a beautiful surviving example of creating a landscape in a relatively confined space - something taken to perfection in neighbouring Suzhou.

title: A nice place but too crowded
content: I went there with my friend it was really good and i am amazed how they prepare the beautiful lantern its really beautiful. Especially the big roaster lantern. I wonder what will happen tomorrow because it was not lantern festival yet but it was really crowded. You cannot even take a single photo because people are everywhere. Line was quite long going to the garden.

title: Great piece of Old Shanghai
content: Went with my daughter and thought the garden and surrounding streets were great.

title: Real nice garden
content: Just stumbled into this place after going around the markets near by (which I thoroughly recommend) and I was pleasantly surprised. I've been to alot of gardens in Suzhou and this was one pretty nice, it's like a maze of interesting architecture.

title: Lovely tranquil park in the bustle of a big city
content: Take your camera as there are some lovely photos to take while you're here. Its a nice walk and plenty to see so allow at least 2-3 hours.

title: Great snacks
content: Some great snacks and souvenirs available. The old architecture is great and makes some lovely photos. Plenty of markets nearby.

title: Idyllic oasis in this modern city
content: Even with lots of local and overseas tourists milling about and through these ancient gardens it is idyllic. Lots of view points and much to admire in the buildings, the water features, the golden carp in the ponds and the trees and plants. Relaxing and peaceful despite the fellow visitors.

user_loc: 佛罗里达科勒尔盖布尔斯
title: Peaceful, beautiful and spiritual!
content: Great therapy for your brain and for your eyes!

title: Amazing place where I learned they actually "farm" rocks!
content: this place was most tranquil and relaxing. Right in the middle of the older part of Shanghai, but in full view of the tall buildings all around. Definitely worth a visit if you are near there.

title: Cultural, scenic and unique shopping
content: Lovely architecture with Chinese traditional elements and yet with backdrop of Shanghai' modern tall buildings. This place offers various category and type of goods from toys, souvenirs,clothes, traditional Chinese arts and silk to various selections of lovely flower and fruit teas. Abundance food and drinks selection to choose from as u stroll around the perimeter which consist of many entrances that convenes at the centre park/square. I like this particular spot for it's traditional building with a tree to complete the beautiful place. You can Metro and stop at station named Yuyuan, very convenient.

title: Lovely gardens
content:
Lovely gardens well worth a visit, gets a bit crowded at times though especially at weekends
Very picturesque and atmospheric.

title: Walking back in time
content: A must do!! Wander around these historical gardens and transport back in time. Be weary of the art dealers in the gardens (they're pushy).

title: Stunning relaxing retreat
content: we visited early morning and had the gardens completely to ourselves to explore. It's easy to get lost, in fact I encourage you to do so. Yu Gardens was a highlight or our trip and I could have spent hours exploring the various gardens and buildings.

title: Huge area
content: It is better to visit on your own leisure time so you can freely stroll along the area. It is huge place and many interesting corner as well as historical story behind it.

title: Beautiful, interesting and quite large
content: I recently visited Yu Gardens while in Shanghai on a business trip. I found it to be quite interesting from an architectural and design standpoint. There are plenty of neat rocks imported from other areas of China. Unfortunately due to it being Winter, nothing was in bloom so I'm sure it is much more spectacular in Spring and Summer.

title: Beautiful ancient park
content: Well located, you can get there by subway. Next to the Old Shanghai street, commercial areas, crowded.

title: Shanghai Old City a must
content: it is a bit too tourist attraction, it is always busy, very commercialized, but even though this is a must for you to experience once you are in shanghai so do not miss it

title: One of Shanghai must see attractions.
content: Went there with friends and had a great time. This is China so expect a lot of people and a lot of tourists. If you decide to buy something you have to haggle and figure out what it's worth to you. Something is worth x amount to you and that's what you paid so be it. Don't worry about what somebody else paid. Also you have to bargain hard. You can often get something for one third of what people ask. There are also some fixed price places there where the price is a little higher but no haggling.

title: It was good to see - but nothing spectacular
content: Glad we visited the Garden but weren't overwhelmed by it. Perhaps may have been better if we hired headphones with English translation or were part of a guided tour. We visited as part of going to Old Town for the day. It was winter and it was around 5 degrees Celsius.

title: Mesmerizing
content: It is a good place to room around with very beautiful architecture. Very well built and soothing ambiance.

title: A must visit in Shanghai
content: Excellent visit to the garden. We were lucky to have a wonderful day with blue sky which made our visit very enjoyable. The place wasn't super crowded so we managed to take good pics and video. Outside the garden, there is plenty to see while walking thru the streets nearby.

title: Interesting Place to visit
content: Yu Garden was very crowded, full of visitors, lots of shops, but worth to visit, I like the feeling to be part of the city.

title: Peaceful Oasis
content: Pleasant park to enjoy nature away from the hustle & bustle of the city. It is a well maintained park where you can have an enjoyable place to stroll through or just sit with a coffee.

title: Some quiet in a loud city
content: We visited Yu Gardens during the time of China's New Year. Had a good time, it was a good relaxation from the sounds and pace of the city, gardens have an ancient feel to them. It was a bit crowded, but nothing too crazy. Wouldn't advise planing on going to museums or such on New Year's eve, since everything closes early.

title: Chinese garden
content: The yu garden is really beautiful and nicely calm compared to the rest of the city. I can really recommend this sight as you get to see what china looked like before.

title: Very pretty gardens
content: Yu Gardens is worth a visit.  Interesting roof sculptures everywhere. Colorful fish in the ponds and scenic buildings.

title: A pleasant experience.
content:
Short tour guide visit made this more interesting by understanding Chinese culture and traditions. 

Too much to see for the amount of time we committed, would like to return during warmer weather to see more.

title: Shanghai revisited
content: Very beautiful, superbly maintained, a haven of tranquillity in a busy, bustling city a must see attraction for the Shanghai visitor

title: Chinese culture
content: Good for experience about Chinese culture. You must to try steel food around here I meet steel not restaurant it feel good.

title: Just another commercial cemtre...
content: This place looks like it is purposed built for the tourists to Shanghai...most outlets are selling more or less the same/similar goods and the quality is in doubt. except for foods, the place is still worth visit simply because it is one of the tourists places in Shanghai...Personally I would prefer Tian Zi Fang with more and wider varieties and better quality...

title: Interesting
content: I love to go to yu yuan garden . Easy to go by metro as the station itself is yu yuan ! The architectural building are very beautiful ...It is a crowded place with many shops and restaurants . Before arriving at the yu garden you have small 10 yuan shops which is very interesting.each and everytime I visit Shanghai I make a must to go to the yu yuan garden

title: A Ming dynasty retreat from the bustle of Shanghai
content: I visited the gardens as a stop on a walking tour with Jenny Tours. It was like stepping out of the hustle and bustle of the 21st century and into the serenity of the Ming Dynasty. There is magic in the design, the intricate woodwork, calm in the water. continuity in the 400 year old gingko tree.

title: Nice gardens, good local culture
content: Must see while in Shanghai! Pretty area inside the gardens, lots to do, see and barter shop for outside there.  You don't have to stay long but beware of crazy busy crowds on weekends.

title: A must visit
content: Very popular park. Many locals go there. Lots to see. Shops and temple. Many colourful attractions. Be prepared for lots of pushing and shoving on the bridge

title: Culture
content: If you want to see old Shanghai,  than you should visit here,  very cool place especially during festive period

title: Crowded
content: The garden is huge and before entering to the actual garden, you will see alot of beautiful stalls, sellings souviner or food around you and you might get lost if you arent sure of your route. Went to the garden around 2.30pm and spent 2 hours inside there. The place is always crowded despite of coming late evening. If only there were english readable guides given, it will be good. Mixed feeling if im going to come back again but still, its a must visit site if you are in Shanghai.

title: Dive in old China
content: The garden and the buildings are beautiful with and ancient china sense. But it was in the middle of a crowded market area.

title: Nice walk
content: The place gives the feeling of the atmosphere in ancient chinese gardens. It worths a relaxing walk for a couple of hours

title: Lovely but very crowded
content: The buildings and gardens are beautiful but in the middle of a crowded shopping area. Great for picture taking. Shopping is reasonable and you should bargain for what you want.

title: Heaven
content:
After a few business trips in Shanghai I finally got to a place that combines what (in my imagination) encompasses Chinese culture.
Beautiful manicured gardens, old but well kept meditation and resting places, tea house ...
A great break from the hustling and buzzing outside

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Spend about 2 hours at the Gardens and enjoy the Chinese architecture of buildings as well as plantings.  It is peaceful and relaxing as well as informative.

title: overcrowded with tourists
content: Be careful of pickpockets. This is what the local tells us when we asked for direction at the metro. Firstly had brunch at nanxiang steamed dumplings restaurant. Overpriced if dined in. But restaurant has nice atmosphere. Go for a walk at the gardens after dining. End off by shopping at the bazaars nearby.

title: Great sight-seeing spot
content:
Went to Yu Garden during my stay in Shanghai.
Loved the historical building and authentic shanghai food.
Many stores and great shopping ideas.

Dr E chow

title: Beautiful gardens
content: The Yu Garden was absolutely stunning, with beautiful historic buildings and rock tunnels connecting each area together. I would recommend this to anyone staying in Shanghai for a warm afternoon.

title: Too overcrowded, stay away during weekends.
content: I really have mixed reviews, the actual garden itself is okay with the interesting rocks and garden is chill. Outside is the worst place in Shanghai. Avoid at all costs.

title: garden is excellent
content: The Yu yuan is excellent place to visit.  The many shops that suround the garden are tourist traps.  If you are interested in quailty, you can find much better in other places in Shanghai

title: We live in Shanghai and bring overseas friends here all the time.
content: We live in Shanghai and we take visiting friends to this location every time. We were there for 2016 New Year's and it was packed.

title: Worth A Trip!
content: It was worth the trip to visit the Yu Garden however it is very touristy. A couple of hours would be more than enough to visit the Yu Garden!

title: Lovely garden in old part of Shanghai
content: This garden is lovely.  Have been here in every season except summer.   In spring it is especially amazing.

title: Beautiful but busy
content: We visited on a holiday and the numbers of people were phenomenal. Try visiting mid week so there is more time to appreciate the peace and beauty of the garden. I would have like more time to look at the trees.

title: An oasis of tranquility & delight - in the right season!!
content: Well worth going to take a leisurely walk to the various parts to enjoy each individual spot in it's own setting. However, depending on the season, the crowds can get so overwhelming that just trying to take a picture could be such a long wait that you just walk away without taking what would be a perfect shot - if there weren't all the heads popping into your viewfinder!!

title: Even with the crowds, a great place to visit!
content: Went here on a sunny, but not too hot day - like a little oasis of calm in the middle of Shanghai. Beautiful. Vendors around it are aimed at tourists, but some pretty cool things to be bought after serious bargaining!

title: Tranquil hidden garden
content: A peaceful little gem of a garden hidden away in down town Shanghai! Despite being surrounded by some of the biggest sky scrapers known to man, you'll soon forget where you are. Enjoy walking the hidden corridors in the stunning Chinese Garden. You won't be disappointed. A good tourist market is located near by as well!

title: It's quiet spot in the middle of the chaos
content: The garden is built like a maze taking you through all the traditional artificial gardens that were all the rage for centuries. Eventhough it gets a bit crowded, it's a relief to get away from the madness in the old town area surrounding it.

title: Wuyuan Garden a must see in Shanghai
content: Although it is a very touristic area, Yuyuan Garden has to be on your list. The garden is a typical example of Chinese garden design. Surprising views every 50 meters.

title: Beautiful garden revealing Chinese history and traditions
content: Must visit place for any kind of traveler. Pay attention to opening hours: it is open during daylight hours only.

title: Beautiful gardens
content: Visited during October holidays in China so it was absolutely packed with people - but still fantastic scenery. Absolute must see in Shanghai!

title: Very Crowded and Nice View
content: Old Building of China, very crowded with Tourist, be careful your bag. the view was outstanding. its like in the movie.

title: Good to see and shop
content: Good place to see and learn some history about China.

title: Not so special
content: Green area in the centre of the old town, small passageways, temples and many Chinese feeding the fish in the ponds.

title: A beautiful garden...with lots of people
content: The Yu Garden is a walled area in the heart of Shanghai. It is beautifully designed with paths and small rooms scattered throughout the area. I can envision how relaxing it must have been when it was first built. Now, the only down side is that there are always many, many people there which detracts somewhat from the tranquility. However, even with all the people, it is still very much worth the visit and I I highly recommend spending a couple hours wandering the paths of the garden

title: A must visit
content: I found that Yu Garden is very beautiful especially when it rains and also at night time. Very romantic and peaceful inside the garden. The surrounding area is nice to walk around and to try a lot of authentic Shanghai foods, and to shop for souvenirs. We love this place, went back and forth like 3 times.

title: Beware of the scalpers
content: A souvenir t shirt for $20 is a rip off. So you should learn how to haggle for people who go to this place. But it's china. And the language barrier will be a challenge. But it's a nice place to visit as you stroll down the old city.

title: Beautiful place to Visit
content: Best way to enjoy this place is to have a Guide or Visit along with some Chinese friend. Its actually a big garden divided into different areas but once you are inside it feels like a maze. This place definitely gives a feel of ancient China. Overall its a beautiful place to visit & do some local shopping.

title: Beautiful traditional Chinese garden
content: This is a must-see in Shanghai. It was a former residence and has many beautiful features, including ponds, beautiful rocks, and pleasing architecture.

title: Lovely gardens
content: Was a very busy day on the local streets so was nice once we entered here how quiet it was.

title: Go Early or Late to Avoid Crowds
content: This is what tourists come to China to see. Your Classical Chinese gardens with lotus blossoms and koi ponds. A tranquil respite from the bustling city...when not crowded. That said, I suggest visiting first thing in the morning or late in the afternoon before closing. I went as the crowds begun to thin and it made all the difference. Give yourself an hour to explore this gem.

title: Ignore the shops, see the gardens
content: Yu Gardens date from the Ming Dynasty and are well worth a visit unless you have already overdosed on Chines Gardens. They can get busy, so go early if you can. Adjacent to the gardens is a tourist targeting area of modern over-priced shops in old-style buildings - fun to wander through, but not the genuine article.

title: Stunning garden
content: A must see. Beautiful to say the least. Every part of the garden has a purpose and meaning. Really exquisite

title: Tourist
content:
Interesting place to visit. Beautiful but lots of People.  
Fake swans but real sköldpaddor 
Gå gärna runt i kvarteren omkring.. mkt shopping av souvenirer

title: Old Shanghai and shopping
content: This is a must in Shanghai. Many fine buildings and lots of articles for sale. Is actually in walking distance if you already visit the Bund or Nanjing Road.

title: Beautiful area and gives you a taste of old Shanghai
content: Lovely gardens and gave you a flavour of what Shanghai used to look like in years past. The area outside the gardens are also great and if you want to pick up a local souvenir then this is the place to do it. Bear in mind however you need to haggle and basically whatever price they give you go at least 50% lower! Back to the gardens it is a maze so go around twice as you will find you will miss some of it if you don't and there are lots of wonderful buildings to see!!

title: One of the 'must-go' places
content: Went there for the 4th time and found new surprises each time.

title: Enchanting
content: I had no expectations. I found out about the creator of these Gardens and how he bankrupted himself to build them. A beautiful setting not to be missed!

title: Superb
content: This can be one of the top 5 of shanghai

title: The highlight of my trip
content: Spent the whole day in Yu Garden area. The snacks are so delicious and many stores are good to stroll in.  The Yu Garden is very peaceful if there are not tourists.  It is worth the money to visit

title: Traditional Chinese Garden
content: We were told that a traditional Chinese garden must contain three things, Architecture, water and rock. They are traditionally home complexes that happen to be set in a serene setting. This garden certainly delivers. Although it was raining when we visited, it still did not disappoint. from the coi fish pond to the beautiful weeping willows, there are plenty of photo opportunities to be had. Although it's small, it's something to behold. And with the modern architecture in the skyline beyond, the juxtaposition is unique to Shanghai.

title: Beautiful garden in Shanghai
content:
Yes... Its a beatiful garden. You may also find tourist market in the way to the garden.

The information still using chinese, maybe in near future english would be help for budget foreign tourist.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: It is aight
content: The place is quite nice for experiencing a preserved ancient style. A place away from the city life. The food is nice and should be the main activity there. The shops sell some interesting collectables, however tip for foreigners, please restrain from purchasing as the souvenirs are over priced and should instead be bought else where. Still good place to go.

title: Busy but worth it
content: This is an absolute must see attraction. It is super busy with tourists both chinese and foreign. But it's so worth it. The architecture is amazing. Great to look at and take photos off. At night the buildings shine up like stars.

title: Nice temple gardens, but very touristy
content: First of all: make sure you don't visit this tourist attractions on the weekend, as it will be very crowded. The Yu Gardens itself are quite narrow, but very pretty and a must see sight if you are in Shanghai for a couple of days and want to see something traditional Chinese. Next to it is a lovely tea house - quite pricey - but you can enjoy the views over the yu gardens from there with excellent tea. It's surrounded by tourist shops, but most of them are quite tacky. It's also situated in the old part of Shanghai, which looks less glamorous and has lots of people wanting to sell things to you.

title: Nice place lots of history and shopping
content: Nice history in the gardens to get a feel for the old gardens and living standards etc. it's defiantly worth a visit. The local shops are all located near buy. There are loads of gifts and things to buy from here. You must haggle with the prices!! Start at least half price to what they say.

title: shopping
content: I love the shopping outside of yuyuan but the gardens itself did not seem that impressive to me but I don't care for rock gardens.  Glad I went. No regrets

title: Charming garden
content: We spent about an hour walking through the garden one afternoon. The bazaars around are also quite cool to explore

title: Ancient Chinese Garden
content: This walled garden was built in the 13th century and has been added to since, it is a good example of the Chinese style of peaceful and medative gardens.

title: Beautiful and serene in the middle of Shanghai
content: I definitely recommend making this a part of your trip to Shanghai. It's conveniently located near the market and you can have lunch there and then wander through the garden. You might want to try to go in the early morning on a weekday so it's less busy. I was there both on a weekday and a weekend and recommend weekday. There were a ton of coy swimming around! Loved the landscaping.

title: PACKED with Tourists
content: Festive environment, lots of tourist type of shopping options, Starbucks with free wifi, and overrun with tourists.

title: A must see in shanghai
content: A very pretty garden and it is interesting to visit if you are in Shanghai.

title: Chinese traditional garden
content: The most crowded garden in Shanghai. Thete are many good restaurants inside the garden that offers traditional Shanghai food. My favourite is the Pao there which is unique.

title: Nice tourist place and lots of street food
content: Easy to access from metro. You can visit both daytime and nighttime. You can buy souvenirs, eats, sightseeings, and enjoy its surroundings.

title: It's ok
content: It's in the heart of a touristy area so gets very busy. The gardens are pretty at the right time of the year however on a rainy day it's not much fun.

title: Even in the winter, you can enjoy walking here.
content: Yu Garden was built in the XVI century, one of the highest dignitaries of the emperor, in honor of his father. Great place. Excellent dragons on the walls. Stored in good condition. Even in the winter, you can enjoy walking here.

title: The only downside is the crowd
content: Lovely place with ancient infrastructures and waterways. I could roam around this area for hours and hours. Especially on cold days it's just refreshing. Crowds aren't really kind towards you though. Swarms of tourists come and go and you'll most likely smash into some group taking a selfie as well. Overall though, one of the sights you can't miss when you go to Shanghai

title: Nice garden, but doesn't compare to Suzhou's. Crowded.
content: Nice garden, but crowded even in the off season (mid december), which really evaporated the charm. I had been to all of Suzhou's (a day trip from shanghai) gardens before Shanghai, so compared to the amazing gardens there, Yuyuan was a disappointment

title: Shopping
content: Authentic local markets that have everything you could want including great food.... tryin Nianxing Hot Buns....

title: Beautiful but crowded
content: This is a beautiful oasis of culture in modern Shanghai. Normally very crowded, especially on weekends, and be aware of all the tea-ceremony scams...

title: Beautiful!
content: When visiting Shanghai it is definitely worth visiting Yu Garden. While on the day we went there were huge crowds to get past while getting in, once in there it was very pleasant and enjoyable looking at everything inside this great place.

title: Major fail
content: This was not what we had in mind when visiting. It's described as a nice place to see old architecture and shop in cute stores, but it's all a commercial paradise. No enchantment, no real life, only people pushing around you, overpriced shops, and standard overpriced food shops. If you like the tourism where you somewhat have a little culture through the architecture and prefab food: this is the place to go. If you're looking for classical remains of China: avoid this place!

title: 2 hour wander
content: Pay the fee, go for a two hour walk, and then exit. Some excellent examples of Ming/Qing history/buildings. A small china/pottery exhibition was showing as well. Good location to train and right in the middle of old town.

title: A piece of cultural bit in the middle of Shanghai
content: Very touristy but still worth a shot if it's your first time in Shanghai. The entire area is very large with lots of stores. So, do plan your time well.

title: Very Pretty
content: We were on a tour with a guide so not sure how it would be if you were on your own, we really enjoyed this but it was very busy even in November

title: An oasis of peace
content: This is a surprising area in the centre of the city where the noise and bustle are left outside. Well worth a visit.

title: Stunning
content: This was a beautiful place. I had no idea it was this nice. I read the reviews but to me it was still a garden. It still is nothing like the gardens in Canada, but it is very nice for China and still amazed at the rock formations and water landscapes. Wow!

title: Ancient buildings at the heart of city
content: Upon reaching the entrance (there are many entrances into this garden, we used entrance #7), you'll be transported back in time. The place is like a small maze with many ancient structures. There is a however a map at the entrance which you can refer and capture with your phone for reference.

title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful and very interesting garden. It looks so small from the outside but it is like a labyrinth inside- it is huge. You can just sit in one of the benches and rake everything in.

title: Yu Garden Worth A Visit
content: Take the time to enjoy this very special place. Can be crowded.  Wonderful tea store called Emperor Tea just on main road across from main entrance. Lots of great souvenirs to choose from in the shopping arcade.

title: Beautiful, packed in the middle of the day.
content: This is a wonderful estate with fantastic photo opportunities if you can avoid the midday crowds. Even with the crowds, we were in awe of the design and architecture.

title: Postcard moments at every turn
content: Great photo moments with architecture that doesn't disappoint. Only minus would be the "exhibitions" within the garden which are tourist traps!

title: Worth checking out but avoid the food court!
content:
Go there for the cheap shopping! There is a Mieivc shop (similar to mini soc shops) nearby that sells the cheapest stuff! Got a 11,000ma travel charger for S$8!!!
The food court (3 levels) SUCKS! Expensive and not nice at all! Avoid!

title: In the middle of the Old City
content: This is a truly wonderful area which is tranquil with with all the features of a oriental garden. There are water features and stone features with much greenery and is easy to forget you are surrounded by the hustle and bustle of busy Shanghai. There are large fish in the ponds which people can purchase food to feed their veracious appetites. If you are in Shanghai and want to see the old china this is a must.

title: nice place to visit
content: there are a lot of shops around the garden. Garden is interesting and worth to visit I liked the old street near to garden that shows a typical Chinese street in 19th or the first decades of 20 th century

title: worth a visit for Shanghai/China "first timers"
content: you can easily spend an hour or two in this refurbished old style maze. Try local delicacies and don't forget to cross the dragon bridge.

title: Enchanting! Scenic! Romantic!
content: A beautiful place...... Needs time to appreciate the ancient rocks, trees and old buildings in the private gardens.

title: Commercialized garden
content: Highly commercialized but still a must visit for tourists. Good food and souvenir shops but make sure to haggle for the lowest price possible. Lots of restaurants. Nice little pond inside. Good place to take photos. Try going there during nighttime to be able to get photos when everything is well lit.

title: Charming garden
content: Try to arrive at morning time, when there are not so many visitors. There are not only plants, but also stone structures and buildings. The garden is small, but diverse.

title: Great Day out
content: Was recommend to me a great area to visit ( Just wished I could enjoy drinking tea ) some lovely tea rooms ended up in Starbucks !!! Flat white for me and the guy spoke English lovely area to walk around beautiful architecture so much history good for shopping and dinning a must for any tourist to visit. No need to have a guide or book through a travel co. Just take a local taxi to this area you have to pay £1.30 to go into the local Buddhist temple and around £1.50 walk through the gardens and ruins ( not well signposted ) a good tip always carry a tourist map with the main interesting sites written in Chinese as well as English traffic police taxi drivers or shop owners are normally good with giving directions !!

user_loc: 加利福尼亚圣克拉丽塔
title: Beautiful Yu Garden!
content: This is totally worthwhile to visit! It is a maze of gardens that is peaceful and serene. You can get wonderful photos here.

title: Local art talent
content: Yu Yuan Gardens has everything you would want in a tourist experience. Many small snack street vendors some with long famous history, old traditional second floor teahouses to escape the crowds (tea can be very very expensive, select wisely). Depending on your taste you can get exquisite 23 carot gold jewelry, fine art, antiques, local carvings, discount toys, clothes, old time staged photo's and also trinkets for souvenirs. Be wary as you should always know what you are buying. There are genuine and fake goods there, select from reputable shops for big ticket items and bargain your prices.

title: Must see Shanghai garden and market, but get there in the morning.
content: Yu Garden is more than just a historic garden within Shanghai. The majority of the grounds are a large tourist market where you will find quality art, pearl, tea and many other artisans on site along with a mashed up of interesting souvenirs and cheap keepsakes. It typically gets very crowded in the afternoon so if you want to avoid dense crowds, then I would advise being there around 10AM in the morning.

title: Lovely gardens
content: Be certain to see this lovely garden. Take time to wander thru and enjoy the beauty of it all. Be certain to learn the history of things as you walk.

title: Bigger than expected
content: The Yu Graden is beautiful and much bigger than we expected. But be aware that later in the day it is over crowded so make sure you go early in the morning

title: Awesome place
content: I was impressed by the beautiful color of this place, fancy roof and wall. Furthermore, rock of fanstastic shape and pond are balanced with house. It is a awesome place. MUST VISIT

title: Good place for food & sightseeing
content: It's beautiful at night with all the light. I went there a bit late about 8:30pm and most of the shop is about to close at 9pm. The good things is that the 南翔饅頭店 had no queue so I can quickly get the famous soup bun.

title: A place for food and shopping
content: Yu Garden has walking streets selling food and some local products. Many tourists like to go there and walk around, and try some nice local food. Nearest station is the Yu Garden Station. We went to Nan Xiang restaurant 南翔饅頭店 to eat the Shanghai dumplings 上海小籠包 and 蟹黃灌湯包. We also ate at the 城隍廟 food court where they sell lots of local delights.

title: A nice blend of old and modern
content: Our hotel was right by Yu Garden and I heard it was good for shopping. It was a rainy Shanghai day so we strolled around with umbrellas for an afternoon.

title: The garden and the entire area are a tourist "must do"
content: Yes - it's very touristic, "pretty much the definition of the beaten path" - but for a good reason.

title: Beautiful Park
content: The are many 3 and 4 steps to walk here so if steps are a challenge   for you this could be hard. There are many ponds and places to sit there are trees and birds. This was once a single family's house garden.

title: Hidden park on a crowded city
content: Can access using shanghai metro from station Yuyuan Garden just 10 minute walk and You will find a tiny way with store selling souvenir, clothes and food, need 1-2 hour to explore this place, beautiful old china building inside with a small pond.

title: Oasis of Calm next to bustling market
content: Very calming to walk through the garden seeing the various places of prayer, despite there being a lot of tourists it is fairly quiet as most people visit in a silent reverential manner.

title: A quiet oasis amidst the city hussle
content: Yes, Yue gardens can also be very busy... but you will always find places inside where the masses of people just outside the door can be forgotten. Classical Chinese architecture meets beautiful garden design and although it is relatively small compared to its much bigger brothers in Suzhou, its easy accessibility in Shanghai downtown makes up for this. Good spot for a first contact with Chinese garden design.

title: Nice place for food and souvenirs
content: Take Line 10 to Yuyuan Garden and take exit 1. Walk towards Renaissance Shanghai Hotel and turn left at Fuyou Road. Walk about 5 mins till you reach JiuXiaoChang Road. There are many exits that you may take to get into the attraction.

title: Peace and tranquility on the heart of downtown Shanghai
content: The garden and architecture were a wonderful blend. Take your camera. Watch out for Dragons!  Try to visit in the off season or not on the weekends. It is a favorite with the locals

title: Very Beautiful
content: This is a very special place but spoiled a little by the hordes of people and we went in November which is a quieter period! The little streets surrounding Yu Garden are great - perfect place to pick up all your holiday presents. I would recommend a visit despite the crowds

title: Nice Garden
content: nice typical Chinese garden to visit, is not gonna change your life, but if you have time go and visit, is a nice escape from the city, after the first hr all look the same, nice place to take a couple of pictures.

title: Yu Garden
content: The yu garden is part of a large area of shopping mall & open area with shops & restratants. Depending on time iof the year, it can get very pack with tourist. But it very nice place to visit for the old past of Shanfhai which is build by Ming Dynasty offical in 1559 & take over 19 years to built.

title: The old side of Shanghai
content: Was not sure whether to visit this place after having spent the past 2 weeks traveling through China and old villages... and yet this is one more surprise in Shanghai. Definitely worth a trip and, on your way out do not forget to visit the old Tea House

title: Serenity in middle of busy city
content: One of my favorite places to take visitors in Shanghai. The peace and harmony is shocking when you enter the park. Small enough to keep full focus. Very typical garden, that is very well maintained. Make sure you see the lady orchester playing with instruments made out of porcelain.

title: Not to be missed - bring your camera!
content: A maze of beautiful scenery, everywhere you turn is a new sight and wonder. These were some of the best photos I took on our most recent trip and a very relaxing few hours. We went on a Friday morning, and I think the cooler weather kept some people away as I understand it can become very busy and packed with tourists. It was a lot of fun getting lost in what looks like a pretty small space on the map. Climbing thought rocks, across bridges and admiring some of the biggest koi I've ever seen would be enjoyable for all ages

title: Lovely garden
content: A lovely garden full of interesting buildings and little areas full of nicely decorated rocks and sitting areas. It's very interesting and pretty but try to be there early as it gets beyond crowded and uncomfortable after 11

title: Yuyuan Garden has an old town, a temple, and an ancient mansion garden
content: YuYuan Garden may be touristy but it is a great spot to visit. It has an "old town" with old streets inside giving a vibrant feeling of old streets of Shanghai. Free entrance. Inside is also a very large beautiful authentic ancient mansion garden well worth seeing, and there is also a nice little temple where you can burn some incense sticks and relax. The garden and temple have small entrance fees. Well worth visiting.

title: more buildings than gardens
content: The name made me expect more of the green stuff than the historical buildings. I found the area outside the actual gardens more interesting to explore but it was very crowded being a weekend. If the zig zag walkway across the water is crowded give it a miss - you might feel you'll never get off it.

title: beautiful city garden, Chinese style
content: This is a sweet traditional Chinese garden, in the heart of the bustling City. a beautiful retreat amidst the jungle of sky scrapers.

title: It's OK . . .
content: It is crowded. It's fun to walk across the 'crooked bridge' but you can't be timid. It has some cultural architecture, but it's more of a tourist sales zone than anything else. You may want to see that for the fun of it, but you won't need to stay long. One short visit will be enough.

title: Interesting traditional garden
content: Quite impressive and interesting garden. Plenty of interesting stuff to see. But it's not the most beautiful or harmonious garden I've seen, it feels a bit claustrophobic at times. Also be prepared for hordes of tourists...

title: Shops everywhere!
content: I was thought it will be a very convenient garden, with a lot of trees, benches or little lake to spend your time and refresh mind.

title: The Garden
content: Took a tour of the garden with Valerie; an extremely knowledgeable and fluent English speaking guide. The Garden is beautifully and somewhat a large area to explore. A great place to see and experience a bit of Asian history.

title: Good for a quick walk around
content: It's usually packed with so many people you can barely walk, but it's still a decent place to bring overseas guests to buy some cheap souvenirs.

title: So lovely
content: This was truly beautiful. I highly recommend visiting the garden, the park, and Old Shanghai street all at once. Great experience.

title: Old Shanghai
content: A nice garden in the bustling city but far too commercialised and crowded, even on a weekday. Stroll through wooden bridges and pagodas and enjoy the Chinese architecture. Lots of stalls selling Chinese snacks and cookies.

title: Surprisingly serene in the middle of the city
content: This garden provided a nice break from the crowds of the city. It is popular and right next to a busy old town shopping area but we were able to go at our own pace and find quiet away from the crowds. The rock formations make it stand out from other temple/gardens. It's much bigger than it first appears and there are a few winding paths to hidden areas.

title: A must see to visit
content: We just stop by here for a photo as part of our tour package. I like the old Chinese house and a pond. So many tourists coming here and a lot of souvenir to buy. A must see a visit.

title: It's a rock garden
content: I'm not sure why the Chinese have such a fascination with rock gardens so much, but if you want to suck up some chinese culture and see something maybe a little different for a westerner, then you may like to pay the fairly high price to go and walk through this rock garden. I personally would rather walk through the large parks that are free and have a lot more to see in my opinion.

title: Beautiful-even in the dead of winter
content: From how beautiful this garden was in January, I can't even imagine how it must look in summertime! Several parts were under construction when we went-making it unsightly and noisy, but it was still enjoyable. The garden is crammed into five acres of the city, but it really is an oasis among the city life. The place is very maze-like with lots of passageways so it's really fun to walk through! You never know what's going to be around the next turn.

title: Beautiful garden, but if you're here during the weekends then you'll be seeing more people than shrubs
content: Beautiful garden, but unfortunately located smack in the middle of a prime location, so you expect huge crowds. You know how it feels when you're trying to get a nice shot of the scenery only for people to walk right into your picture every single second. But apart from that, this place is a beauty.

title: Classical Chinese garden
content: This is a fine example of a Classical Chinese garden, but don't expect to have it to yourself. There were hordes of visitors when we were there, and peaceful it was not. However if you don't get a chance to see any other similar gardens in China it is worth seeing.

title: Beautiful
content: We went to the Yu Garden Tea House before going into the gardens - highly recommended! A bit pricey for the tea, but the view is worth it and it comes with little snacks !

title: Peace and Beauty within the City
content: This was an easy subway ride from our hotel. Even though it was a hot day, the gardens are cool and tranquil. Across the street is a Buddhist temple that was interesting too.

title: Wonderfully peaceful
content: After walking through the market the peace and calm of the garden is great.  Beautifully laid out and maintained, it is an oasis of calm.

title: Get lost in beauty
content: I mean get lost...I did as no real signs or easy visuals....but a magnificent and extensive set of gardens and structures well worth the time and small fee to visit.

title: Beautiful gardens right smack in middle of tacky shopping area
content: We got lost trying to find the gardens and reason being we were not expecting to have to go thru the very modern, pseudo ancient set up hiding shopping/eating shops. The outside was too crowded and was dreading going in but thankfully it was less crowded(we went in after 2pm) and enjoyed walking around the gardens. Would go earlier next time to spend more time and go slow as kids were quite tired after we got lost and walked the whole area.

title: a nice to do
content:
to be honest the Chinese garden in Sydney is better but this is the original.
a little dark on a November day but at least not crowded
the guide providedsome interesting details on the different aspects which could have been missed otherwise

title: A must see
content: Located in the heart of the Old City this wonderful space is a delight. It was marvellous strolling around its many attractions. Even though it was filled with visitors the calm and tranquility of a traditional oriental garden permeated through.

title: Beautiful Garden and Traditional Architecture
content: The first place I decided to visit in Shanghai was the Yu Garden and it set the bar pretty high. Like everywhere in China, you must pay an entrance fee (40 Yuan) but the upkeep was very well and worth the price of admission. I'd recommend going on a clear day and taking an hour or two to fully enjoy the sights.

title: Great place
content: You can see the garden and old architectural buildings. Worth going around to do some street shopping.

title: A quiet spot in busy Shanghai
content: A peaceful get away from the crowded and noisy center of Shanghai. A great place to get lost for an hour or so.

title: Pleasant surroundings
content: This is a great example of Chinese garden, it is situated in the middle of the market. The paths, trees and ponds  give this garden a lovely feeling of relaxation

title: Must do...but crowed
content:
It's one of the biggest "must do" of Shanghai. Be aware that at anytime it will be extremely busy, full of people. I went there in November, low season, but still!
Take a tea!

title: mix garden
content: this is a garden with so many other things , shops , souvenirs ,....you can fine most of the chinese traditional items as special gift from china.

title: SH Traditional place with famous Steamed dumpling
content: Y Garden is a place in which you can see the traditional China architecture and souvenirs. Still remember our friend , Elsa had bought some local traditional standing lamp with affordable price. The best is you can also eat the famous SH Steamed dumpling here ( XiaoLungBao) in Nan-Hsian XiaoLungBao here.

title: Enjoyed the outdoor garden experience.  Very relaxing, a refreshing side trip.
content: Wonderful to experience this garden.  A beautiful serene location in Shanghai.  We felt transported back to an earlier time in China.

title: Group tour
content: Classical Chinese garden architecture of an administrator from the Ming period AD 1559 - over 2 hectares incl the Big Rockery and Naturally-hollowed Jade boulder.

title: HAVE TIME VISIT
content: small place with lot of local crowd, nothing much,but the shopping area nearby is worth the visit.for shopping around the area you can visit.

title: Quiet and peaceful place
content: Great place to chill and meditate after croudy and busy Yuyuan surroundings. Garden is quite small but I think it`s better to spend half an hour on it and to appreciate quiet and peaceful atmosphere of a place. One tip: I was lucky to visit it on a rainy day so there were not too many people inside. If you want to visit during touristic season do it as closer to the opening hours as possible to avoid crowds around you.

title: Scene for traditional architecture, shopping, and dumplings!
content: Yu Garden is a traditional Chinese garden with buildings and structures dating back almost 1000 years. While the garden is beautiful to walk through, I also think a visit is worth it to spend some time in "old town". Adjacent to the gardens are a good number of shops, pearl and silk wholesalers, vendors selling the famous and delicious soup dumplings. Making a plan to go here you can get lost for a few hours and cover a little history, pick up a nice gift, partake in a traditional tea ceremony and have a great meal.

title: Peaceful place
content: Lovely place we enjoyed a wonderful afternoon here and were blessed with some good sunshine. Very peaceful place. Lots of history supposedly it was meant to be the Imperial Palace of Beijing.

title: Calm escape
content: Loved this calm escape in the middle of the city! When I finally found the entrance to the gardens in the middle of the busy market area it was such a relief. Very calm, relaxing and beautiful. It was like being transported 100 years back in time. Definitely worth the 40 RMB entrance fee.

title: Living museum
content: Visiting the garden takes about an hour or less. The entrance fee costs 40rmb for adults, senior citizens and students cost 20rmb. It transports you back in time where you'll see remains of some old sculptures and the wooden architecture that are well preserved and solid standing after weathering XXX years. Somehow this garden shows how "well off" the officials were in the earlier days.

title: Yu Garden
content: Old Chinese architecture and fantastic gardens, in the middle of New China.  Though very crowded, a garden worth visiting Shanghai for a taste of Old China

title: Nice quiet old garden
content: Very nice old garden in the middle of busy Shanghai. Once you enter, you enter a different world. Not the overcrowded streets and shops. But a quiet garden. I went on a thursday and the garden was not crowded.

title: Nice Garden in the City
content: My friends and I went to the Yuyuan Garden twice, first on the day we arrived, because it was only walking distance from our hotel and second visit was on our last day in Shanghai before catching our flight back home.

title: Not so much a garden
content: Could be really good if it was cared for just a little, very little in the way of planting or even soil where there could be, so very disappointing and very busy

title: A great introduction the Chinese gardens
