content: Not what you would expect to find in the middle of bustling Shanghai, a peaceful oasis offering a great introduction to the Chinese art of the garden. Take your time and enjoy new vistas at every turn.

title: Little Oasis
content: We were taken on a private tour.  Although not very large it was a little of oasis in the midst of a very busy area.  Our guide spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable and explained various bits and pieces.

title: Not a must-see
content: Maybe it would look better on a sunny day, but I was not overwhelmed by the garden with its dirty water & walls. The fact that this is considered a "must-see" attraction in Shanghai by certain guide books tells you how little there is for tourists to do in this city.

title: Nice garden, but too many visitors
content: The garden is nice but never go there on Sunday, it is too crowded, especially all the restaurants and shops in this area

title: Traditional area of interest
content: A good place to walk about in the garden , with historical knowledge. Well maintained garden and is surrounded by shopping outlets and eating places, with the famous Xiao Loong Pau.

title: Hidden windy pathways- fun for kids!
content: Right in the centre of the touristy shopping area of Shanghai is Yu Garden. An amazingly huge complex of buildings, gardens, and rambling pathways up, down, around beautiful structures make this a must-see destination. Young children will find this serene haven fun to explore and adults will find a bit of breathtaking old China.

title: People's square in English!
content: I went on a public holiday, ladies dancing in the street, having fun, wasn't what I had expected to see!but the music was bleating, people banking and having fun! There's a loo if needed but take your own paper, they charge for it, hence the wRning!

title: Not to be missed
content: If you are ever in Shanghai them paying a visit to this place is a must! There are number of shops with that very oriental touch within them, specially walking through its alleys will give you that different feeling of a traditional bazar. But before saying yes to any price cut in half the ticket price and then divide it by 4 and then offer your figure to get that real bargaining price it is worth for!!! Otherwise you might end up with that regretful feeling as to why?

title: interesting
content: as usual its a tourist attraction area thus prices are more expensive however if you are in shanghai it is a good place to visit. there is a city of god temple there where you can pray or visit, entrance fees is around 10RMB (if i remember correctly)

title: Yu Garden
content: Entrance is a little pricey for China, but there a hundreds of shops in the area to check out.  I'd strongly suggest going to the area, even if you don't pay to get in.

title: Superb home garden
content: Once owned by a wealthy official long time aho and now is one of the favorite tourist spot. The ancient architecture & its design offer a distinctive feeling of how a wealthy man should have spent their wealth accordingly.

title: A lovely garden
content: Defiantly worth a visit while you're in Shanghai, and only costs 30 Yuan (40 in summer). There were many beautiful areas in the garden to look around. The amount of koi in the ponds was unreal, and when you fed them the gathering was worth a picture. The gardens are a fine example of a Chinese garden and was a refreshing change from the city.

title: Beautiful and Zen Place
content: If you like to walk around and take photos of nature and old architecture, this would be the place. We went there to spend sometime with the children and they both love it. There is a small entry fee but I think it was ok due to well maintenance of the garden.

title: An Oasis in Metropolis
content: Yes, Shanghai is the modern business center and capital of China.

title: Way too crowded...
content: It is too crowded and I could barely walk in the sea of people here.  They should limit the number of guest in here, especially in the lake and bridge in the garden.

title: Old Chinese style garden
content: Entry fee reasonable . Didn't see much of it because of an unsettled baby but what I saw was enough for a four stars. Beware you can only get into the garden through specific entrance. I.e via the bridge.

title: Ancient garden hidden in shopping malls!
content: This is one of the tourist sight recommendations and there we went. I was disappointed. We followed the road side, the typical temple roof architectures and we entered a street full of typical Chinese buildings. We walked around the streets and it seemed to be a shopping district with lots of shops and a shopping mall. Although interesting, it wasn't our objective. Eventually, we found the entrance of the garden. Yay!

title: Great Place to visit.
content: Yu Garden is a top Place to visit. This Place gives an Impression about old China with ist old Buildings.which are well looked after.The old Hauses are buityfull also the Garden. We had also a Meal on the top Floor, perfect. It is easy to find in Shanghai and befor you reach it you rearly have to pas Old Town Shanghai

user_loc: 斯洛伐克布拉迪斯拉发
title: Very croudy
content: The place is much more a market in old fashioned set-up than a cultural place, however it has its charm, so from my point of view is it one of most recommended places.

title: Don't buy any souvenirs
content: Yu Yuan Garden is a must see tourist attraction. Keep clear of the overpriced rubbish they sell as souvenirs and watch out for pick pockets. You must try the Xiao Lung Bao which is a Shanghai famous dumpling. You know they are good due to the queues waiting to try. The restaurants were overpriced and not very good. If you have chance don't visit during meal times.

title: Very touristy and crowded
content: Visited in Oct and it was very crowded. OK if you would like to see a traditional Chinese garden. The garden itself is surrounded by lots of small shops selling tourist souvenirs. Not one of the top attractions in Shanghai

title: Grey if you don't have time for other gardens
content: China is full of many gardens in cities. This one is very beautiful and the architecture is really nice. I do take people if they do t have time to see other gardens. Also it's like one big fake market around it. Please take care of your belongings here!!

title: BEAUTIFUL GARDEN, BUT CAN BE VERY CROWDED
content: Old private garden in central Shanghai (only a few blocks from the Bund). Go during a weekday, as it closes in the early evening and weekends it is VERY crowded, with VERY long lines, just to get in. More rockery than plant garden, but lots of places to just enjoy the tranquility away from the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. Several original buildings inside with displays and shops. Located in the old town area - many restaurants and shops just outside the Garden area.

title: A must do in Shanghai, for a taste of old town buildings and culture.
content: First and foremost, the place has each and every touristic trap you can think of, including booths of fast food (not so good, not too traditional), souvenirs shops and stands, some attractions and many many people.

title: One of the attractions
content: It is a must visit .. not the garden itself but what is around the garden , the shops restaurants , tea shops and the area around is interesting to see . I have been told that usually it is very crowded and yes it was crowded but acceptable maybe because i visited in the morning in the middle of the week .

title: shopping around it
content: Very nice place to visit specially at night with the beautiful exterior lighting temples, the shopping there is good but tricky beware....you have to master bargain.....

title: Legend
content: It is so nice to go around the garden where you can relax at any time because is not full of people or visitors, Good for going with a couple. Romantic place.

title: Old town and tourist attractions
content: Great view, great place for sightseeing and take a photo, so many stands for shop and eat. 400m walk from yuyuan garden metro

title: Good Counterpoint to Modern City
content:
This is the old part of the City and in its centre is this garden. Traditional Chinese style with small 'rooms', pathways, bridges, rocks, lakes and gazebo buildings. The Dragon wall is very good. 
It is busy, but still well worth seeing.

title: Beautiful gardens in the heart of Shanghai
content: The gardens provide a beautiful glimpse into Chinese culture. It was a peaceful retreat from the incredibly commercial shopping bazaar just outside. The facade of the bazaar is impressive, although a reconstruction of the original building. The zig zag bridge was crowded and the area made us feel uneasy. Recommend a visit to the gardens but not the surrounding areas.

title: OK, but crowded.
content: Extremely crowded and lots of people everywhere. Be prepared for an enormous crowd outside of the garden as well. The highlight was seeing all of the turtles swimming in the pond. Entry fee is 40 RBM. Would recommend going there early in the morning to avoid the crowds. They're open until 4:45 PM.

title: Glad we made the visit
content: After a long day in Shanghai we almost skipped this attraction. That would have been a mistake- we really enjoyed the garden. It was very serene inside with a lot of neat history.

title: Busy
content: The day we visited the gardens it had been raining and feel we didn't see it at it's best. The gardens were very busy

title: Oasis In Shopping District
content: These gardens are a pleasant retreat from the hustle amd bustle of the city.

title: Very serene and huge park with a lot a history
content: The entry to the garden is tucked inside the busy Yu Garden Street. The entire street is busy and a great place for shopping. The garden itself is huge , green and a peaceful place. Preferably visit during morning hours to avoid rush.

title: Old garden, nothing really fascinating.
content: Not sure whether it's because I have been to better garden in Beijing that left me not finding this garden to be great. Overall, did not find anything fascinating about the garden. Maybe because it's a November and the weather seems to be gloomy as well.

title: Great dim sum the chinese way
content: Go to Yu gardens and bazar. After seeing the artisans at work, enter any of the dim sum restaurants. They all serve similar dishes. You can choose the Chinese section or the foreigner one. Go to the chinese, it will be a very different experience! Hope you can figure out what to order and the system.Excellent dim sum and spring rolls.

title: Yu Garden
content: beautiful Oasis admist the City hustle. But i would recommended English translation audio guides for tourists for them to be able to understand and appreciate this peaceful place.

title: Most typical
content: This is what you expect from a Chinese gargen: a labirinth of water channels, gazebos, delicate vegetation, charming bridges, Don't miss it!

title: Great attraction with local shopping
content: Had visited Yu Yuan Garden in 1999 but didn't recall there are so many local shopping and food outlets! Very busy even for local visitors. Great place to find some souvenirs or try local delicacies!

title: Awesome place
content: Awesome place - must to see! We were very excited their. A lot of interesting things to see and dive in Chinese history.

title: Second time here.
content: We took our friends here,who were also blown away by this lovely oasis in the middle of a busy city.

title: Ancient Imperial style garden-must see!
content: This garden has opening and closing timings-so be there well before 4.30 (when ticket sales end). Exit is by 5.15 pm-so keep in mind that you may want to be there ahead to enjoy sitting around and exploring the garden. Lots to see- and a highly recommended must do.

title: Beautiful and peaceful place to visit
content: I loved this garden, in the middle of a very busy and noisy city this was indeed a piece of heaven. We strolled round and enjoyed the tranquility of these beautiful gardens. Another must see thing to do in Shanghai

title: Beautiful garden
content: Indeed this is a beautiful garden in the middle of the chaos of Shanghai. Just try to avoid weekends because of the high number of tourists. Better to go early in the morning.

title: Not too interesting
content: Just a labyrinth of paths and bridges with same architecture. Not much to see, really. You can spend 40cny in better ways in Shanghai, in my opinion

title: Lovely place to spend the morning
content: Wander around Yu Garden and enjoy the scenery of old Shanghai with the skyscrapers of the modern day in the distance. These bustling streets with their early architecture are what you came to see and the peaceful garden at the center is a lovely place to wander.

title: The Garden of Peace
content: We spent half a day looking around the Yu Yuan Gardens, a good place to hop off the Metro with its own stop. Entry is cheap at c10 yuan and it's like stepping into a small haven in a frenetic city.

title: Fantastic sights
content:
It will move you back to an older and lovely China,site of ancient monarchs.
Lovely place, visit will take approx. 1 1/2 hour.

title: Pleasant but not peaceful
content: A taste of old Shanghai with some beautiful parts but subject to very large crowds and some of the buildings are a bit "samey" with the result that the experience is not as tranquil or breathtaking as you might hope. We worth a visit and affordable entry price but you shouldn't need more than an hour. The surrounding area is in a similar style but very touristy.

title: Wonderful Garden to explore
content: A wonderful and beautiful garden well worth visiting. It is full of wonderful architecture, beautiful gardens .

title: Very crowded!
content: Maybe I didn't see much of this place and didn't discover its beauty. Very crowded and I went because of the famous Xiao long Bao restaurant. But it is not worth it in my opinion.

title: Stunning garden
content: Although it's crowded, the garden is so beautiful that you can forget about the other people.  The landscaping and the structures complement each other.  You must experience this gem of Chinese culture.

title: Chineses gardening
content: The garden is very well kept and there are some ponds and some large rocks which are rather impressive. There are also a lot of houses or halls which are mailny used to sell souvenirs to tourists which can be annoying if you just want to have a look.

title: Green in middle of the city
content:
Can visit some green places in middle of a lot of buildings and the cars stress, it is so nice.
The garden break with the monotonous ambient in a city.

title: A rare old heritage
content: As I went to alone this place I didn't know the history of this place but as I see this place I can imagine it's a old heritage in Shanghai with nice pound and garden but bit crowded.

title: China in Shanghai
content: Unfortunately visiting Shanghai you can not see the China that you are probably imaging. Yu Garden was the only place i think in Shanghai that let me understand that i am in China. A wonderful place, nature and a tottally must see in Shanghai. Prefer visiting it early in the morning avoiding people.

title: Maze like enchanted garden
content: Been to Yu Garden twice (2010 and 2016) and it never fails to impress with its beauty and lushness. Would be good to spend at least 1-2 hours to walk through the huge compound and take in its beauty.

title: Beautiful place
content: Spent hours looking around. Don't think we saw everything. Great architecture, nicely preserved part of the old town. Good place to pick up souvenirs and gifts but make sure you bargain. Always crowded with tourist.

title: Yu Garden - Just beautiful
content: Some tourists miss the main event here and don't buy a ticket to go into the Gardens themselves.

title: Crowded, crowded, crowded, but very nice to stroll around
content: Of course, there are better options to visit a typical Chinese garden (Confucius temple, which is quite close to the Yu Garden), but this is worth it, at least to observe all the people there and try some good food. Also the narrow streets around are very exciting!

title: Wander the garden
content: Yuyuan Garden is a nice spot with rocks and lakes, which is full of historic stores behind. I visited here at early morning and it was a preserved peaceful garden of old Chinese fashion. The ornate pebble paths were fantastic and symmetric. Wandered through the garden and you could find surprised scenes. The old temples were delicate with specific figures and sculptures on its top, which reflected the local culture in old years. The paths, the rocks, the little stream, and the plants were all in well arrangement of geomantic.

title: Nice Chinese architecture and market
content: It's a nice place. Despite being crowded it's amazing buildings and architecture is quite impressive. A lot of different kinds of shops ranging from food to souvenirs to cloths and toys. My colleagues made me try a Chinese sweet (which i didn't like much ;) Also the Bund is walking distance from here. So if you are in Shanghai and have time, go for it.

title: Tourist trap extraordinaire
content: You would be remiss in visiting Shanghai and not seeing this,  but the restaurants and shops all around are overpriced ripoffs.  Still,  the buildings themselves are picturesque,  if you can view them without the hordes.  Go early in the morning morning.

title: beautiful gardens
content: This is a breath of fresh air in busy Shanghai. You step into old Shanghai of the past, a beautiful oasis. Outside the garden is the busy Yuyuan Tourist Mart, just the opposite, but fun to visit.

title: Nice architecture
content:
This is one of must see place if you go Shanghai. Beutiful houses and nice pools.
Totally different Shanghai.

title: Great place
content: It was the second time I visited Shanghai and I visited this place again, which I really enjoyed. It represents Chinese culture and it's a must-see location.

title: Nice piece of heritage in the Middle of the City
content: If you are a heritage fan, then you will find this very interesting. The same for photography lovers. Many nice set up of Old dwelling place with many sections to visit...

title: A very nice serene historical site
content: I thought the Yu Garden was pretty cool. If you have been to other historical sites around China it is not really that different but I liked how many nice nooks and crannies this place had. It was similar to the gardens in the Forbidden City in Beijing but I liked this place a little more for some reason. This is adjacent to a tourist mall which is ok. The tourist mall has a great cafeteria where you can grab lots of different readymade foods.

title: Tea garden
content: We visited here and was truly pleasantly suprised. The big rocks and the ornate pebble massage path was fantastic on your feet. What a great idea. I loved the way the little stream wandered around the garden. Very peaceful and the tea ceremony was exactly what I expected. A lovely day all round. A must if in the old part. Then wander through and do some souvenir shopping.

title: interesting but not tops.
content: Interesting and unique but would we would not put this on top of things to see, especially if you have limited time.

title: Beautiful gardens and unique design
content: We really enjoyed the Yu Garden. One of the most intriguing features of the garden is the dragon draped all along the privacy wall! The layout of the Garden is very nice, where each turn reveals another spectacular view or unanticipated surprise. The Garden is crowded but peaceful, nonetheless.

title: Interesting
content: A must-see as it gives you a glimpse of Chinese culture, food, and shopping.  The temple was closed, but everything else made up for it.  I recommend it as it reflects the local culture.

title: Great location
content: This was a very peaceful garden in the middle of old town Shanghai. A nice quite venue to relax and take in sites of an old fashion Chinese garden. Many connecting small buildings with impressive garden views.

title: Worth the time.
content: Quite the temple, cultural, shopping, garden, old city place to visit...See it all at Yuyuan. Lots of street food, vendors selling everything, sit & people watch. A chance to get a feel for old china, (even the locals like visiting) see the sites, temples & oriental gardens all in an afternoon. See the pictures here on trip Advisor, there wouldn't be so many pics if it wasn't worthwhile..

title: very very nice
content: you have not been to Shanghai if you have not visited YU GARDEN!

title: So so!
content: This is the third time I have been here. I actually think it is way way overrated. However, the traveller I was with had not been before. The tourist alleys with touts for watches and shops selling plastic dreadful S are off-putting and tacky. I realise this is close to Old Shanghai but it is the worst sort of tourist trap in my view. The entrance to the garden is a cross the zig zag bridge. 40Y for adults and 20Y for seniors. We happily handed over the money to get away from the crowds outside. Once inside you walk from 'room' to room of this traditional Chinese limestone garden. The ponds are full of enormous carp and turtles. As a western visitor we see the potential for destroying our waterways by putting goldfish in our rivers! There are old trees and graceful building and lots of photo opportunities. You leave by a different exit and have to make your way out through the crowds again. This is a visit you do on your first time in Shanghai. If you plan on going to Suzhou, leave it out and do something else.

title: Interesting cultural site
content: Pleasant environment for a walk and review some history.  Enjoyed tea at the traditional tea house located in the center.

title: Beautiful even in the rain
content: We visited our last day in Shanghai, unfortunately it was pouring out!   That did not diminish the beautify of this garden.   It is well preserved, but it is croweded....

title: A great taste of Old Shanghai
content: Centrally located. Great buildings and sculptures. Ponds and fish. We really enjoyed our visit and recommend highly as worthwhile when visiting Shanghai

title: Really chinese place
content: I went there in my first day in Shanghai, and I really felt like I was in China. Shanghai is globalized and sometimes you forget you are in a such different country, but not in Yu Garden. There is not much to see inside the garden but the neighborhood is pretty interesting.

title: Very big "house"
content: Good place to visit, walk and enjoy the mansion slowly. Very big compound, interesting to see families having outing there.

user_loc: 英国布兰德福德福鲁姆
title: Peaceful garden away from the crowds
content: Our tour guide suggested we arrive early at this garden because its very popular with tourists and as this was 4 October the whole of China seemed to be on holiday. There were lots of coi carp in an attractive large pond and niches/nooks and crannies with limestone features so each way you turned there was something different to see. It was very quiet, the benefit of arriving early, later on we passed the entrance and there were long queues waiting to visit

title: Yu Garden
content: This is a beautiful oasis of gardens and rocks. It was lightly raining when we were there but there were enough sheltered places to pop into when the rain got heavier for a few minutes. It is a busy place with tourists but the beauty around you is lovely. Seniors get in for half price if you can show proof of age.

title: Cute garden, in a busy city
content: This place is a quaint oasis in an otherwise busy city. I'd recommend a visit for sure. It was quite busy the day I went, but still enjoyable.

title: China town
content: Rebuilt China section of Shanghai with modern one all around you. Bargain with all the vendors. $7 for the propaganda poster.

title: Yu Garden, Shanghai
content: Very interesting. Very busy but that adds to the atmosphere. The shopping area around Yu Garden is great for cheap shopping and souvenirs.

title: Amazing place
content: Definately worth a visit as completely different from the rest of Shanghai. Very popular with tourists but the go and be amazed by the buildings and wood carvings in the ceilings/roof and furniture. The shops inside sell some fantastic gifts including Jade carvings and paintings. I bought three of the banners painted on silk for twenty pounds each,bargain considering the prices in the markets of HongKong. The surrounding area is a fascinating place of restaurants,shops,stalls and people trying to sell you fake watches and handbags. A place of tranquility within the bustling city despite it being very popular. Only cost £6-£7.

title: Almost Enjoyed It
content:
Admittedly it was a Chinese public holiday but the crowds here negated any feeling of enjoyment.
Well worth seeing but go when it opens first thing in the morning - and not on a public holiday!

title: Don't go if it's a holiday . . .
content: These gardens are beautiful --- you're actually walking on a few lengthy piers with views of gardens in the distant. However we were there during Golden Week (ie. everyone is on holiday with the day off visiting touristy sites like this).

title: Yu Garden
content: Pretty garden, but very crowded... it was a Sunday though so may be better on a weekday.  Worth seeing if only to escape from the even more crowded local shopping lanes!

title: Yu garden very interesting
content: Yu garden gives an insight into how a retired senior member of the Emperors court lived in those times. It's fascinating to envisage how the different buildings would have provided the family with a tranquil peaceful world at that time.

title: A bit crowded on the weekends but apart from that very nice
content: This is one of the most famous tourist attactions in Shanghai and regularly very crowded because of that. Try going there on a weekday and avoid the chinese national holidays.

title: Beautiful but crowded
content:
Went on a late afternoon during the week but still very pack!

Absolutely beautiful - best to go with a guide who is extremely knowledgeable about ancient Chinese architecture because there are so many subtle meanings.

title: Typical
content: This place is very beautiful, all around you have many small shops and chinese restaurants. It is the local china town. Temples are well conserved, it is paradoxal to see temple between all the buildings.

title: Nice but too crowded
content: Very pretty gardens and building but it just got too busy to be able to enjoy it. The entrance to it is via a tourist market which reminded me of running the gauntlet - hideous!

title: Autumn getaway
content: The visit to the gardens was arranged by my travel agent. It was a very nice place to visit, the gardens were amazing,  I would highly recommend a visit.

title: A must see
content: An absolutely beautiful garden that's so worth visiting!

title: Very nice gardens!
content: Located in a busy section of Shanghai, this is an oasis of peace! Tranquility all around. The design is exquisite and the dragon walls amazing. Lots of rock and water too! Very worthwhile.

title: Awesome architecture
content: It was so crowded right outside the Yu Garden. But when you paid RMB40 for the entrance fee, you will find the quiet and calm atmosphere inside the Yu Garden. So, don't be scared by the crowd outside. Pay RMB40 and you will find it worthy especially if you like Chinese Architecture. There are many sculptures at the roof of houses, remember to look at it. Actually, they are describing different Chinese myths.

title: Beautiful Piece of History
content:
Beautiful historic buildings converted into an outdoor mall!

Love the bridges and water elements!

Can be crowded with both locals and tourists, especially on the weekend.

People watching is captivating here...

Very worth visiting!

title: Wonderful ,Lovely Place yo visit !!!
content: You can go by metro it is very cheap and easy!!!!!!

title: Good for first time tourists
content: Firstly, the crowds are overwhelming. Be prepared to Brave the crowds even on a weekday. Do pay for entry to check out the real Chinese garden behind the shops and restaurants. I enjoyed the garden without the crowds. Round it off with a typical dumplings lunch, do queue early for lunch to avoid the crowds.

title: Touristy
content:
A place I always go when in Shanghai though it's very touristy. 
Just like to walk around with no plans to buy anything. 

Lots and lots of tour groups.... Meaning very crowded

title: Stunning if you are able bodied
content: In the title I noted that this is a stunning attraction and it is. Beautiful buildings, water, trees etc but if you are in a wheelchair there is no consideration for access. This was widespread throughout Shanghai but does not make it acceptable. This economic powerhouse should be able to produce a number of ramps without detracting from the architecture. For those with minor mobility problems nowhere is too difficult but with a wheelchair not possible

title: Relaxing atmosphere
content: When I visited Yu Garden I felt the wholeness of the park very relaxing. It´s hard to realise that´s possible to have a garden like this in the centre of Shangai without ruining the atmosphere.

title: Interesting
content: Nice place to spend a couple of hour wandering around the beautiful gardens, the bazaar are and the famous temple

title: Exellent
content: This is somewhat hard to find in the mass of shops but once you find it, it was worth the wait! It is a nice peaceful oasis in the shopping district and has a lot of history.  Top visit for this area!

title: Beautiful gardens steeped in history
content: This is a must if you visit Shanghai. Beautiful old buildings set in gardens surrounded by water. Learn about the history of the garden.

title: Pleasant Garden in a Boring City
content: There's not much to do in Shanghai so this garden is a must. Not very large, and likely crowded, it's a pleasant stop but perhaps not in the league of 'great gardens of the world'

title: Nice
content: Lots of cheap things to buy and eat here. The park is very crowded with tourist. A must place to visit.

title: Beautiful area
content: Great way to escape the 21st century and see a little of traditional Chinese architecture & culture.

title: Lovely gardens, interesting surrounding area
content: Much has already been said about the gardens. But once you are there, spend some time wandering the surrounding shops and alleyways. Interspersed among the many vendors selling the usual assorted cheap plastic and electronic items synonymous with China are some interesting stalls selling craft products. We found a shop selling woven ropes made of jute, and another tailor of traditional working man's clothes - we got a cotton jacket and pants combo for RMB85, with a pair of work gloves thrown in for free!

title: Not to be missed!
content: Spectacular garden. Go early so you can get great pics without people in them. Don't forget to look down at the symbols in the walkways, discover the hidden meanings in the window shapes and find the dragon with his spine on top of the surrounding walls. Not to be missed, especially if you cannot go to see the gardens in Suzhou.

title: Pretty gardens
content: This is a really pretty, quaint little area with lots of ponds, local animals and traditional features surrounding it. I would recommend an afternoon stroll, but wouldn't advise that it is suitable for an all-day visit. There are also opportunities to buy some small souvenirs here such as postcards.

title: Watch the goldfish.
content: Walk info the Garden and enjoy the houses, the pind with all the fat and Big goldfish. Beautiful plantes and surroundings.

title: A Must-See
content: One of the highlights of our visit to Shanghai. A beautiful garden in the old city; really a great contrast to all the modern marvels.

title: The best of many Chinese Gardens we have visited
content: As I had been here before, I had to keep telling my wife, while visiting other Chinese Gardens as part of our 3-week tour, that the "best is yet to come".  She is now a believer!

title: A serene retreat from the shopping mall surrounding the garden
content:
In China you not only "exit through the gift shop"  but also enter through it. Same with the train stations and airports. 
The gauntlet here is worth it. The buildings and landscaping are fascinating.

title: A glimpse of old China in an ultra modern city.
content: A surprise in this modern high rise city. Beautiful and traditional gardens with some quaint shopping areas outside. Well worth a visit.

title: This and the accompanying bazaar are a highlight
content: If time permits then there is the old tea house - if not there are a number of old and new buildings within the precinct to enjoy.  Nearby - immediately next door is the bazaar.

title: Nice relaxing place
content: Cheap and easy. I walked from Nanjing Road to here without issue. Allow and hour - more if you spend time in the markets/shops surrounding it

title: Very cute
content:
Nice place 

Took us a bit to find it and how to get in.

Very peaceful and quiet.

It is a bit of a maze, maps in each location would have been great

title: Beautiful!
content:
First time visiting Shanghai and was taken here by a local, as an American it as mind blowing to see something so old and full of history.

Loved it!

title: Beautiful garden
content: The Yu garden was originally a private home later donated to become a beautiful garden open to the public. It's a large complex with several buildings to explore. Very tranquil you can take your time and truly relax. The garden is situated near the old Shanghai market so you can make a full day of your visit with shopping and dinner.

title: A classical quiet old garden in the hectic Shanghai
content: The Yu Garden is one of the very few old places of Shanghai. It is a classical garden with old Cinese buildings and few ponds full of red carps. It combines decorative halls, and pavilions, zigzag bridges,archways, and impressive rockeries. Around the garden it is located a little old borough with nice shops. An interesting break from the modern huge buildings of Shanghai.

title: Beautiful Place - Oasis in the city
content: Had a great time here wandering and discovering the garden. Beautiful pictures and very peaceful. Be sure to bring a camera!

title: One of China's great Gardens
content: A must see attraction while visiting Old Town. Absolutely a garden that  you will enjoy and be an experience you will remember. Great place for taking  nice photos you will want to share at home.

title: Cool place to wander through and people watch.
content: This lovely garden is situated just across the road from a magnificient temple.

user_loc: 路易斯安那州新奥尔良
title: Yuyaun Garden
content: This is a very lively place. The merchants are a bit aggressive but its ok because you can find a vast array of shopping items and some really bargain great prices. This is also a great place to get a really great history lesson about Chinese Culture.

title: Somewhere to have a rest
content: I was expecting these gardens to be so much better than they were.  Apart from having a rest in peace for a little while after battling through all the crowds outside it was pretty mediocre.

title: beautiful
content: This garden is very busy so get there early. I got there right after opening time and there was no line at all. but when I came out the line was soooo long I could not see the end of it.

title: Lovely but busy day
content: I think this place is always busy, the town and market around the gardens is always packed, we went on a wednesday afternoon expecting it to be quiet of course not!! The market is similar to markets around shanghai with the usually gifts etc, their is a snack centre which is amazing !! The actual garden is 40 yuan (really rude staff behind the counter she was on her phone haha) it felt like traditional china in there! So nice, saw turtle and plenty of cod koi in the lakes and rivers surrounding! Seriously a beautiful garden!!

title: Very pretty!
content: So glad we went here.. its hard to believe these gardens are in the middle of a very very very busy area. You almost feel you are outside of the city. Its hard to go to this area and its not busy! But worth it! Great gardens and buildings, feels like your walking back in time.

title: Not worth it!
content: This garden is not a garden. Very small place with tight passages and nothing pretty to see. There are hundreds of Temples and places in China to visit. The area is great and plenty of shopping but do not go to this so called Garden..

title: Part history, part annoying tourist trap
content: Once inside and walking the rock gardens, pond etc. this tourist location is palatable. Not the nicest or most authentic but will serve. The trouble getting in is the massive presence of western shops, hagglers and the like. If you are looking for an authentic experience, this is not the location.

title: Beautiful park
content: Great attraction, though not too amazing in rainy weather. It's beautiful, but seem a bit too redecorated to be original Chinese?

title: Beautiful gardens
content: Beautiful gardens in Shanghai. Great place to walk around and there are a number of markets and stalls selling souvenirs etc. There is a famous dumpling restaurant near the bridges as well.

title: Overcrowded tourist trap
content: Don't bother to go here unless you have a spare hour in the agenda. Very touristic, many small kitsch shops around. The old temple used to be peaceful and pretty but is standing small now in the overcrowded crazyness called mass tourism.

title: Little highlight in the city center
content: This is a traditional Chinese garden. Nicely preserved. Worth a visit and a nice change to the busy city.

title: Old town of Shanghai
content: I am coming to China long long years but still want to come here to see and see local selling. At the center there is hand arts must see all streets and buy some memories...

title: Beautiful traditional Chinese Housr and gardens
content: These gardens surround an old Shanghai 'Manor House'. They are intricate and varied with paths that thread in and out revealing new vistas and hidden gems. There are many water features and preserved rooms in the house that give a sense of ancient Shanghai. Definitely worth a visit.

title: The peaceful garden of Yuyuan
content: Yu Garden is a peaceful and serene spot located within the thriving metropolis of Shanghai. Expect crowds but take the time to soak in the overall beauty of the place. A thriving bazaar is located right before the entrance and offers many Chinese products at reasonable prices - but only if you negotiate. Many places accept credit cards.

title: Beautiful and serene but busy..
content: We had a wonderful visit in Yo gardens. The house is beautiful and the garden is amazing. There are lots of beautiful scenery to take pictures of, and if you slow down a little you can feel the tranquility of the garden. The only downside was the large amount of people lining up to walk thru. Next to the gardens is the Yu marked . A great place for buying souvenirs .

title: Maybe try a weekday?
content: A beautiful place amongst hectic downtown Shanghai. I'm not sure if it is less busy on week days but The Sunday I visited, it was swarming- it was a fun atmosphere, but not for people who like a relaxing vibe :-)

title: Great attraction for a hot day
content: Beautiful garden ensemble with alcoves, canals with golden fish, waterfalls, dragons, trees and round passes

title: Wonderful Architecture
content: Unbelievable that this beautiful place exists behind the tall walls. The architecture is beautiful and picturesque.

title: Overrated, crowded and tacky!
content: Perhaps a Chinese holiday period is not the best time to visit here, but to be honest there are far more impressive gardens to be seen in Hangzhou and Suzhou, both around one hour by train from Shanghai.

title: Must go for a "shanghai" experience
content: Your shanghai visit is not complete without Yuyuan. An appreciation for chinese architecture and shanghai food.

title: Yu Garden, a garden of peace
content: Just walk round and enjoy the scenery. Plenty plants around you. Just sit down for a few minutes when you feel you have  walk too much and enjoy the air and surrounding.

title: Good for shopping:)
content:
Please negotiate everything. They will try to sell even 3 times more. I got exchange 20
Rubles instead of Y :) . Garden is ok, nice architecture and scenery. Lots of shops nearby.

title: Stunning
content:
This place is just stunning!

I could have easily spent all day here and get lost amongst the gardens.

The markets before and after are also a playful delight. We enjoyed some pan fried dumplings and moon cake whilst wandering around.

I'd happily go back.

title: Must visit
content: There are not much of old china in shanghai and Yu Garden is one of that places.

title: Visiting my niece in Shanghai
content: My niece has been in Shanghai four years now finally got to come visited her

title: Yu Garden is a Most Beautiful,Popular Historical place to visit for everyone in Shanghai
content: Yu Garden was a private garden of the Pan family in the Ming Dynasty. It was the largest and most prestigious of its era in It also developed an Shanghai’s “Old City” (Cheng Huang Miao, a Temple name after the City God). It is a Tourists’ Haven. Hundreds Stores and Shops around with all kinds of affordable Souvenirs, Merchandise available. If you have not yet, you would not know what you have missing, nor what is the Best Shanghai Culture and World Tourists all levelers Shopping Attraction look like.

title: A Step Back In Time - With Shopping!
content: Yu Garden was one of my favorite stops during my stay in Shanghai. I loved how the old and new clashed amid the hustle and bustle of locals and international visitors making deals in the crowded alleys. Besides the charming architecture (even the Starbucks was themed) the gardens and temples were absolutely beautiful (and remarkably quiet given the chaos only steps away). The shopping can be extremely overwhelming for some, but it doesn't take long to get into the bargaining that is required (and expected) at the hundreds of shops. You will find merchandise that ranges from cheap to luxurious - but all of it fun! Treat yourself to some tea at the famous Huxingting Tea House, which has great views of the main garden pond and surroundings.

title: Made a difference to have our guide
content: I would have missed a ton of meaning. Not a large park. More a serene retreat around an aristocratic home with water feature. Ignore bazaar nearby with trinkets.

title: Nice oasis in middle of old town Shanghai
content: Lovely morning visit to gardens and surrounding shops.  Bargain with the shop owners for the best deal

title: Nice oasis in a busy city
content: The garden is beautiful sitting in the middle of busy streets and a busy "old town." You would not believe that it could be so big and free of most car noise. When you get tired of being hassled to buy pearls in the market, you can get away in the garden.

title: Nice to visi
content: Very nice gardens with the Chinese house worth a visit the dragon wall was interesting. Loved all the water fathers surrounding the house.

title: Peace in the middle of a bustling area.
content: Peace in the middle of a bustling area. There is calm and tranquility, in the middle of a very busy bazaar like atmosphere. it really capture the balance of a busy life and keeping in touch with nature. Do not forget to sample the soup dumplings in the neighboring restaurants.

title: Peaceful place to enjoy
content:
These historic gardens are a wonderful place to see history and enjoy a very peaceful and relaxing walk.  
Well worth your time

title: Nothing but tourist rubbish
content:
Nothing of quality, strictly for tourists
Hordes of mass cheap tourists being led by flag carrying tour leaders

title: packed during the holidays
content:
It is a nice garden with lots of pavilions around and landscape. but I feel that the signs are not too clear and can get lost in it quite easily.

it was the holiday season when I visited and it was packed to the max

title: Regular
content: In my opinion it is very overated. The garden is pretty but not much to see but rock and water and a few plants. I would spend much more time on the streets outside the garden which have lots of typical Chinese food and shops in old fashioned alleys.

title: Dinner in Shanghai Old Town
content: Great place to relax in the evenings with lots of restaurants located nearby in authentic Chinese style.

title: Wonderful Garden
content: This is tucked into a shopping tourist area and appears small from outside, but once inside it just seems to continue and continue. There are many pools and trees and little pavilions all over the place. The requisite limestone outcrops are in abundance and are surrounded by various vegetation. This garden was delight and as such is highly visited. Expect big crowds.

title: Beautiful place
content: This place is very pretty. It's a private garden and it's very well taken care of. It's very large and although there were a lot of people, we were able to take pictures and enjoy it. Right before entering, there is a very nice market with typical articles and food.

title: Part of a Shanghai Tour
content: Would have been had to find on our own. It's kind of hidden in the middle of a market place. Very pretty, traditional buildings. Lots to take pictures of. Well worth a visit.

title: Very beautiful full of tourists
content: The garden was very beautiful, I visited there at night and it was more beautiful.

title: Tourist Trap
content: Everything about the Yu Gardens (Yuyuan) is a tourist trap -- if you're looking for cheaply-made souvenirs you can get all over China in a over-crowded environment, this is the place. The gardens themselves are nice, but if you're already planning to go to Suzhou or another river town, don't waste your time with this small, crowded garden.

title: Nice little community garden
content: Not a destination in my opinion but I used the park many times when visiting the area as a relaxing alternative to walking along the street. Very lively with lots of people exercising.

title: Peaceful spot in bustling Shanghai
content: I experienced Yu Garden with my tour guide (check out Miki Tours!) and it was my first introduction to Shanghai. The grounds are beautiful - and really expansive. We went first thing in the morning - I heard it gets more crowded in the afternoon. I would recommend experiencing it with a tour guide as I didn't notice a lot of info that would help one doing a self-guided tour. Around the garden are many many tourist shops and food stalls. My tour guide had warned me there would be people trying to approach my to buy watches, etc. so I would be on the lookout for that - but overall found it to be fine. Definitely worth a stop in Shanghai!

user_loc: 英国特伦特河畔斯托克
title: Don't miss
content: Definitely one of the highlights of our few short days in Shanghai. 40rmb ticket price each for adults. Very mystical and beautiful place with lots of little lakes and secret areas full of koi. Do go early to avoid the crowds as with everywhere in china and appreciate the peace and tranquillity in the middle of the bustling city.

title: Historic China with minimum commercialisation
content: This area of Shanghai is well preserved and presented. I was guided by knowledgable locals, which probably enhanced the experience but all important features are signposted in English and some have descriptions as well. Guides are available. The day I visited was a weekday and Yu Gardens was still quite crowded. There are eating facilities available throughout the site and opportunities for shopping. Certainly worth the price of admission.

title: Change of pace in bustling Shanghai
content: Shaghai is amazing in terms of huge buildinds and hustle and bustle. The Yu garden (while still busy) is a serene change of pace to this with some of the older buildings in this shiny new city. Our kids really enjoyed to Koi ponds and there is (a very touristy) market right next door. Not forst in the list of things to do in Shanghai but worth a visit

title: Great little tourist village
content: Definitely could lose a few hours here between the gardens and the park. There are lots of restaurants and shops to wander and the gardens are beautiful aswell. Easy to commute here there is a metro station about 400m from the site and the entrance into the gardens is around 40 CNY from memory. Otherwise the rest is free, including the koi ponds, and impressive buildings. If you have time whist in Shanghai its certainly worth a visit.

title: Beautiful
content: All I can say is it again worth a visit you get to see the backdrop of the old Shanghai against the new. The gardens are very beautiful although small like most gardens are here due to ground space being so precious. Lots of local people like to visit here too for that very reason. Here in China eve thing has a meaning.

title: Very nice
content: Very nice and typical chinese garden. It worthed the time we spent to visit it. Near it is a large market.

user_loc: 威斯康星奇珀瓦福尔斯
title: Oasis in the city
content: Beautiful gardens and buildings in the middle of the city. Went there early in the morning on a Sunday, opened at 8:30, and very few people there. Amazing trees, rocks, fountains, doorways. You can get lost and back track and then find new areas. Signs not well marked and did not see a guide map until we arrived at the exit. To get to the main entrance, have to go through the shopping area. Walked through the shopping area, but did not stick around. Lots of people coming up trying to sell watches and purses.

title: Peaceful
content: Spent a couple of hours here. A really relaxing and peaceful break from the business of Shanghai. Lots of goldfish!

title: Oasis in the middle of the old town
content: A peaceful oasis in the middle of the old town bazar area giving a glimpse of old privileged living. Don't miss having tea at the tea house on the small Island in front of the entrance.

title: Nice Garden
content: It's nice, but very crowded, there are several gardens in Shanghai, visiting one is enough, they are all similar

title: Shopping
content: When bartering with a vendor never pay more than 25-30% of the original price and don't be afraid of walking away. Carry your money in your front pockets and bring cash only.

title: Surprised how lovely this was
content:
I was tired after two weeks touring China,  but these gardens really surprised and impressed me with how pretty they were and very different to others we'd seen.
Lots of nice dragon features, beautiful ponds and a lovely feel to the place.  Worth a visit.

title: Yu garden a splendid experience
content: A nice an relaxing atmosphere- you garden is well kept and also you can meet sanding Chinese people in the morning.

title: Beautiful
content: Had a great time wandering around. It was very crowded with people stopping to take selfies randomly...but still a must do.  The architecture is beautiful and the shops have something for everyone's taste.

title: Compact garden with a lot of content
content:
Very nice old garden carefully planned to make the site seem very much larger than it really is.  This is accomplished by a meandering path which doubles around itself to present different views.
A peaceful hour in the middle of busy Shanghai.

title: Nice garden, but I've seen better in China
content: The garden was nice, but getting there was a bit hectic. It is located right next to the old shanghai street where there is souvenirs everywhere and get quite crowded. The tea house near the gardens were a rip off, so avoid if you can!!

title: Slightly underwhelming.
content:
It is interesting enough albeit you prbably need to be Chinese to appreciate it fully.
Not as large as I expected and very crowded even though it wasn't peak season. Good place to waste an hour but that's about all.

title: Yu Garden
content: The tour for Yu Garden took around 1 hour and the stories behind the structure and architecture of the Garden are amazing.

title: Like the old Chinese movies
content: It's a quiet and beautiful garden, mostly enjoyable for historical fans and a romantic place at sunset but it's closed at the time!

title: Beautiful old style garden
content: A classic chinese garden in the middle of this hyper-modern city.  Very good for photographers and a haven of peace.

user_loc: 埃塞俄比亚亚的斯亚贝巴
title: Temple visit
content: After staying 2 weeks in Shanghai and looking at all those sky scrapers, I wanted to visit the old China, the temple and their buildings, traditional ones. Then a friend recommended Yuyuan garden. It's a nice place to see something different from the new city of Shanghai. All the buildings around that area is old Chinese structures. I found it very interesting and it reminds me of the Chinese movies from my childhood.

title: Nice garden in the heart of Shanghai
content: The garden is very beautiful,  done in the typical Chinese style. It is easy to reach with the subway and tends to be very crowded indeed. Worth a visit.

title: Lovely gardens
content: We had a nice visit to Yuyuan Garden. The koi pond is huge and there is a nine section zigzag bridge that is so cool . 9 sections for the emperor and zig zag so that the evils spirits couldn't cross it as they can only travel in straight lines. The buildings are wood and pretty. Amongst the serenity of the garden is the craziness of the shops and vendors trying to sell you everything from candy to fake rolex. It can be overwhelming. There are lovely tea shops and places to buy silk. There is a beautiful Taoist temple close by that was just amazing! Worth the small admission.

title: Crowded in the summer, but pretty
content: A beautiful place, but really crowded and stifling in high summer. It's easy to get lost in here. Not sure that this is a "must-see" place, given that it was so busy. It loses a bit of it's intended peacefulness with such masses of people.

title: Significant historical garden but not well maintained.
content: This is one of the main tourist attractions in downtown Shanghai. Unfortunately, although you can see the details of this wonderful old garden, it has not been well maintained. It is dirty, with peeling paint and could use a lot of attention. It is also the centre of an amazing tourist shopping area. There are even shops scattered through the garden. If you like shopping, you might enjoy visiting here. We were looking for a historical garden and were somewhat disappointed.

title: So much to see
content: A great choice of things to see and do and it is a bustling thriving area. There seems to be something for everyone, with local sights/landmarks, shopping and plenty of places to eat.

title: Great but Busy!
content: It is a beautiful area and definitely a must see in Shanghai. But it is always busy, filled to the brink with people!

title: Quiet garden with deep roots
content: A nice relaxing walk through historic buildings and well-maintained gardens. Several key photo spots. Go early to avoid crowds. There was a free performance of traditional Chinese music in the square several times a day.

title: Get pleasantly and (fairly) peacefully lost
content: We only had one full day in Shanghai but decided to take this in and were glad we did.We didn't find it difficult to find and can't understand why people would pay an expensive tour to go there, its only a few yuan to get in, discounts for over 60s too.

title: Exhausting, ugly, unkempt
content: More a maze than a garden; weeds, crowds and huge lumps of ugly rocks everywhere. No guide map, uninteresting shells of small buildings. Most enjoyable moment was finding a place to sit ( not easy) and looking at a map to identify where else to go.

title: Awesome
content: Lovely 'time out' from the hustke and bustle of the surrounding streets, although we unfortunately visited during the China National    holiday period so the crowds were huge, but still worth visiting

title: so many pavilions after a bit they all look the same
content: lots of rocks and pools and pavilions all blend together well. fish in most of the pools. some pavilions have shops in them and the prices are high. your guide gets a commission on everything you buy, they are government shops. most things can be bought cheaper elsewhere.

title: Yu Garden, Yuyan market and City god temple at one place
content: Yu Garden, Yuyan market and City god temple at one place. You should really visit here for ancient yu garden and city god temple. there is good market to buy chinese stuff.

title: Beautiful
content: This garden is out of this world.  We visited this as part of a guided tour.  It is a very peaceful place with rock formations and koi in the various ponds.

title: A must in Shanghai
content: This small town on the water is a must see in Shanghai area its beautiful and amazing, the trip is worth and get Patrick at Chona Vacation Tour trip for the ride, hihly recomended.

title: Authentic and entertaining!
content: I enjoyed all aspects of the Yu Garden area. The Hop On bus stopped just outside the gate and it was easy to access the whole area. Shopping was a dream, although it was sometimes hard to walk away from a persistent sales person. Lovely experience, all in all.

title: Relaxing Except for The Crowds
content: This is a lovely place to visit but unfortunately everyone else thinks the same so be prepared to do a but of pushing and shoving because if you dont... they will!!!... A real sense of history with pagoda style buildings , bridges and carp ponds... Outside the garden is every selection of foods from every country... Ohh and the street sellers!!

title: SCENIC SPOT
content: Get to see the  nine zigzag bridge and a pond with golden fish. Place is quite crowded at all times, specially in the evening.

title: Awesome garden
content: Lovley place, not what i expected but a lot better and is very suprising buildings and amazing rocky, toilets there are clean.

title: An oasis from the Shanghai fast lane
content: I have visited these gardens multiple times over the years and I still enjoy their beauty peace and tranquility - despite being in the heart of Shanghai . The day we were there there was a traditional Chinese band performing from the Beijing temple of heaven which was an added treat. The bazar outside is a bit crazy but gardens are worth the few minutes of hassle you may experience outside.

title: Peaceful place
content: Very enchanting place to spend few hours walking around this beautiful garden with traditional Chinese pagodas right in the heart of the city. It is definitely worth a visit. As I visited on a sunny and hot day in August, everything was so green and so magical, indeed crowded, but still is so beautiful.

title: Spectacular and restful in a busy city
content: The Gardens are a wonderful example of the Chinese style of garden. The hidden and different sites behind each corner is wonderful.

title: Gorgeous gardens in middle of Shanghai bustle and close to the yuyuan bazaar.
content: The highlight is the Dragon wall, vase shaped doorways and the scholars rock gardens. The koi fish are huge there and the gardens are so beautiful.

title: Big name, not so big value
content:
Just another Chinese Garden. Good, but nothing great.
Entry thro dirty market areas. Some Dragons are good, but overall nothing impressive.

title: Ashok, Mumbai, India
content: Except huge number of people n visitors, there is only crowd there n. Like any other old city area. . . Because of paucity of good interesting points in Shanghai, so it is time pass

title: Average garden similar to others in China
content: Not really much to set this garden apart from any other you can find in China, if you have nothing better to do I guess it's worth it.

title: Good for history and also for shopping
content: I visited Yuan Gardens 20 years ago, and of course, much has changed.  It's a lot more commercial these days.  Still, it's a great place to visit and a must-see if you go to Shanghai.

title: Great spot to relax
content: The Yu Garden is in the middle of a shopping and eating area. It has all of the old style feeling of China with a variety of buildings surrounding the garden. Koi fish fill the ponds. Beautiful stone work and plant life fill the area. Nice walking paths to take a leisurely stroll. There are some building that house some furniture and other exhibits to see. There is also a spot just outside where you can go upstairs to a tea house. If you need a break from your shopping in the three levels of shops surrounding the garden I would recommend grabbing a bite and just stand by the ponds for a nice break.

title: Garden visit
content: We were taken here as part of a Wendy Wu tour of Shanghai. It was ok. Not the best garden and certainly not peaceful.

title: Natural Experience at the Yuyuan Garden
content: The Yuyuan gardens are beautiful with temples, lots of fountains, rocks and nature. It is a very refreshing experience after a hot and humid day walking around Shanghai. You can take good pictures of the threes, birds and fountains, bridges, and nature in these gardens. I think the gardens are a relaxing oasis in the busy and crowded environment around Shanghai.

title: Beautiful garden with a history
content: Very well maintained garden with nice Chinese regal buildings and a nice landscape - definitely worth a visit when you are in Shanghai . Adjacent Tea Rooms are pretty nice and allows one plenty of opportunities for tea tasting

title: Exciting vibrant Tourist must see place with great Eats
content: Easily accessible by trains and stop at Yu Yuan Garden (Line 10) and just short walk from station - fantastic old temple and pavillons with lake and plenty of restaurant outlets - visited the Nanxiangde Bun outlet but found the standard has deteriorated though as the steamed bun with drinking straw and the xiao long pao skin is tough and hardly any filling. Would recommend checking out other outlets serving steamed bun and plenty of other food choices- just not worth queing up anymore; this vist, I waited 45 mins and was dissapaointed with quality and taste.

title: More of a bunch of old buildings than a garden
content: i enjoyed the buidling and the architecture, but there isn't a lawn or what I would consider a garden. Some lovely trees, but I don't recollect seeing a flower.

title: Garden tour
content: Both beautiful and hospital, this stop is worth a look see. Some of the area is new, but the actual garden is old and delightful. This area provided a view of history, flora, gardening style, and so forth. Having a guide to explain what you're are looking at was very helpful.

title: Yu Garden - Beautiful and a must see in Shanghai
content: Travel and not visiting Yu Garden would be blasphemous specially if you want to see and understand the Chinese culture. Large & Massive Garden which will need time to wander and see every nook and corner but time well-spent.

title: A bit like a maze but with surprises around every corner
content: Yu Garden is a traditional Chinese garden that has a maze of winding pathways leading to numerous small buildings, bridges over ponds, and beautiful doorways with glimpses through to views beyond. There is plenty here to grab the attention of keen photographers. A great place to spend at least a couple of hours. a 10 minute walk from Yuyuan subway station at most.

title: A nice place out of the hustle and bustle
content: It is a beautiful walk! Very peaceful and great for history lovers and people who enjoy a bit of photography. Some beautiful things to see and learn in the gardens. In a great location if your off to Yu Yuan market place as it gives you a nice rest from the busy shopping area.

title: Yu Gardens - busy but worth a deeper look
content: We visited the Yu Garden with a local guide. It was National Day week holidays, so predictably the outer portion/entrance to the garden was jam packed. However this are is filled with shops and food store (apparently stocking not very authentic dumplings so we were told!)

title: Water City
content: Great historical benefit....especially the Confucius a temple with the Tea service.....  great scenery and beautiful gardens and waterways....

title: Interesting but lots of tourists.
content: The garden is pretty but the number of visitors took away from the beauty.  Like all such attractions, a fee is required.  Garden is surrounded by dozens of trinket shops.

title: Go early
content: Peaceful and well worth a vist but go early. We werevery early, had no queues or people around. Good photos without the other people in them.

title: Tranquility in the midst of the city centre
content: This garden is in the old area of Shanghai and you walk through the Yuyuan marketplace with lots of shops to get to it. It costs RMB40 to get in. Go with a guide, otherwise, a lot of the significance of the garden is missed. It is a man-made garden, and the pavillion at the top (which we are not allowed to go up to as there is worry that the rocks would not be able to take the weight of people as they are held together without concrete) was at one stage the highest point in Shanghai. The main attractions are the rocks - all with different shapes, various halls/buildings scattered around linked by pathways and surrounded by water. Worth a visit

title: Not really special
content: Totally skippable if you are short on time. The ticket to this place cost us 40 yuan each to enter. It's a garden with some chinese artifacts, figures and small lakes in between. Its a mini version of the summer palace in Beijing.

title: Beautiful and worth seeing
content: So beautiful and the history is amazing. We did this on Best of Shanghai tour and were there early so missed the crowds. Fantastic!

title: Nice garden
content: A great place to relax, especially while visiting a city like Shanghai! Take a few hours  and stroll around the chinese authentic neighborhood around the garden, and don't forget to get into the garden, for real relaxation...

title: Nice area
content: Though you need to pay to get inside the garden, there is very little information for the tourists (not even a map). Is a nice area inside the yuyuan tourist streets and market.

title: Totally worthwhile!
content: This is not to miss! I am grateful a classmate told me about this, as I might skip gardens sometimes. The rock formations alone are creative and stunning, as well as the gardens and trees. And the little shops throughout were a welcomed shopping experience. The ceremonial rooms were also beautiful. Get there early to avoid the crowds I witnessed as I finished my visit. After seeing many European-style gardens, I am so glad I took the time for something so different & so beautiful.

title: Nice to visit but you can miss it
content: Few places are to visit in Shanghai, so I think come the importance of the garden. Small garden and crowded and difficult to find your way. The interesting thing that it is located in the old city of Shanghai, so we walked through the old city with narrow streets and lot of souvenirs shops and visiting a tea house.

title: Can't enjoy with the throngs of people
content: Yes, you should probably visit because it is one of the few places in Shanghai that seems authentically old Asia. Sadly, you and thousands of tourists are all vying for a place to zen out. Be prepared to really use your imagination to bring yourself back in time because the tourists will be jostling you and sitting every where. Cash only so tuck away your credit card. Cross your fingers for a photo with nobody else in it.

title: Average garden
content:
Garden quite interesting,but not outstanding.
If in area visit.Traders outside are a bit in your face but funny with it.

title: Amazing
content: Beautiful garden and small little street close to the Bund. A perfect place to get a glimpse over old and new Shanghai

title: Fascinating old garden with variety of sights
content: This is one of the most popular attractions in Shanghai. The gardens are not so much gardens, but a series of sections with antique buildings, sculptures, rock gardens, and coy ponds. Enter through a thriving winding shopping market next to the temple. Easy to get lost inside - we lost two members of our group, but rendezvoused successfully later.

title: Nice but look ay instructions when arriving
content: The garden starts in the old district of yu garden, hence the name of the place.

title: The Garden of the General
content: This Garden was build by a general for his parents. Its a remarkable site - all customer built, so its not a natural garden. The architecture is impressive. But to understand it properly, take a tour guide. Otherwise its just another chinese house.

title: You garden
content: Beautiful garden in Shanghai with the traditional buildings, obliqutory ponds containing fish and tortoises for wealth and longevity

title: Get there early!
content: Beautiful and peaceful garden but not much fun when it is crowded. Get there within 30 minutes of opening time or you will be elbow to elbow with the group tours.

title: Interesting and pretty
content: I'll start by saying we went here on a walking tour so we got the most out of the garden. Make sure you buy some fish food before you go in, to feed all the gold fish/carp. It's a hidden gem amongst the touristy buildings. It has a number of gardens and houses linked by gates in the walls. In one garden you can go over a low bridge and get so close to the fish while feeding, our youngest was touching them.

title: Very beautiful gardens
content: the most beautiful spot in Shanghai, an intricate walk in traditional chinese gardens with walls bordered by stone dragons, zig zag  bridges to chase away the bad spirits,and tranquil ponds . Amazing.

title: Beautiful
content:
Stunning ancient landscaped gardens. Could easily spend 1-3 hours here. 

It's a little oasis in Shanghai surrounded by the busy Yu shops/markets. Small entrance fee to enter. 

Look out for the huge koi fish! They are great to watch - especially if being fed!

title: Crowded and pricey
content: Full of visitors. The food court is thronged with visitors , people spend more time eating than actually seeing the beautiful architecture.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Even though it rained during our tour we were able to enjoy these old gardens and building that we built many years ago. We also attended a monk prayer and holy song recital within the gardens.

title: Beautiful garden
content: A beautiful garden. Good to take a slow stroll and enjoy the scenery. Definitely less crowded than the public areas.

title: A glimpse of old china
content: Amidst the fast paced and globalised Shanghai, Yu Garden will give you a glimpse into Chinese culture. The market outside is great to pick souveniers

title: Old chinese views in downtown
content: Finally after living in southern China in a city where you hardly can not see these typical ornamental old Chinese houses I found those in downtown Shanghai. A lot of people so no peace and quiet place but one can imagine this would be really nice place to walk and relax when not so crowded. Worth of visiting. So different from the modern Shanghai. It was really tough to walk there with baby prams. Needed to lift all the time few stairs. So it was also good exercise for muscles. More of the Exit signs would be needed. I felt once when getting tired being like in a labyrint ;)

title: Overrated
content: Nice Chinese garden. Pretty big. That's it ... not more... not less... I was there once. No need to come back. For me there is no difference to other gardens (except the higher admission fee)

title: Pleasant in city garden.
content: A nice respite from the hectic city.  Well maintained as are almost all public spaces in Shanghai. A restaurant in the center is a good stop for a drink in a tranquil location. Name escapes me.

title: Much to do if it is your first time
content: This place is a must see if it is your first time. The last few places of what old Shanghai is about. It has undergone many phases of renovation and the current shopping area presents a wide range of retail shops from silk dresses, teapots, pearl necklaces to cultural products. Many snack stalls as well and it will be a good idea to eat and snack as you walk.

title: Good break from the noise and congestion of the city
content: The Yu Garden feels completely separated from the rest of the city. Once inside, it is very peaceful and quiet, despite there being a decent number of people visiting. Many cool sites to see, although not a lot of English information available. Inside there are also some shops inside the buildings that sell original art and jade jewelry, ranging anywhere from the $20 to thousands. Great spot to plan into your stay in shanghai to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

title: spectacular
content: This extensive garden fulfills its purpose of the traditional Chinese concept of creating an idealized setting of beauty and place for meditation. It is so much more than flowers. It consists of a series of interconnecting garden "rooms", paths, ponds, rockeries, buildings and bridges. Flowers of different shape, color and texture, trees, bushes, elements of nature, even windows to glimpse the sky. Texture, color and pattern all mattered to the designers, and different types of trees and plants had special significance, so all was carefully planned. I just loved the designs even of doorways, made to look like a dragon with scales, windows inserted under its back. We arrived as soon as it opened in the morning, which is ideal to avoid the crowds and appreciate the softer morning light. At that early hour, we didn't face big crowds and could actually appreciate the tranquility. The gardens were connected to early religion in China, and visiting the gardens is another glimpse into the history and culture of this fascinating country. Or just plain ol' enjoy the pretty flowers, buildings and trees, haha!!

title: Very Beautiful but diffcult to find the entrance
content: Yu Garden is very beautiful scenic spot for sightseeing, and it near the Chenghuangmiao, there always have a lot of people, and a little crowed, but it's fine.

title: A must-see historic Shanghai destination
content: Fewer, if any, locations in Shanghai display the disparity between the old-and-new incarnations of China's fastest growing city. The Yu Garden charges a small fee but worth it to stroll around centuries-old gardens and shrines. As an added bonus, the Garden is conveniently located within the popular Yuyuan Bazaar. Wander throughout the numerous shopping alleys housed within ancient dwellings, and oh by the way, some of the best Shanghai-staple food offerings (the steamed dumpling) offered ubiquitously throughout.

title: A nice retreat from the heat!
content: Beware of stall owners that offer to show you where certain attractions are located. We had local/loco guy offer to show us where the gardens were. After two hours of roaming the gardens, the guy was waiting for us at the exit with expectations of being tipped. When I refused to pay him, he yelled and stalked us until we were able to finally ditch him. Beautiful Gardens with lots of shady places to sit and take in the views.

title: Amazing garden but hard to find
content: Plan your visit early in the day or later in the evening as this popular garden fills quickly with lots of people taking away some of the beauty and enjoyment

title: Yu Garden
content: You will never experienced anything anywhere in the world like the Yu Garden, it is a variety of beautiful flowers plants and greenery that is unique to only Shanghi. You may walk through and just absorptive you or you may stop and inhale the different variety a beautiful fragrances. But one of the most famous features for me is to walk through and watch so many people exercising and performing tai chi and enjoying the option of being outside in creating such a healthy lifestyle with out having to have a membership to and a specific gym. From the yuck to the old everyone seems to enjoy the view each other and just absorb the freedom of being is such a beautiful environment. A must experience feature of the country.

title: Pretty gardens & a nice walking tour spot
content: Really enjoyed this meandering complex of pathways, gardens, rocks, greenery.  The nearby market has good shopping and food choices, too.  Worth a couple of hours if you're in Shanghai!

title: nice spot but very crowded on holidays
content: nice place with lots of little shops and restaurants inside,very busy and crowded during holidays.Many streetvendors that try to seel antiques,fake watches ,bags and chinese tea.Don't go to the so called shops or tea house its a rip off with overpriced goods and fake quality.Enjoy the garden and eventually if you like tea visit the teahouse inside the garden.You can be clamped by so called students that speak good english in the metro,carefull they usually work in teams of two,three persons and have the aim to drag you to a place later on.Don't follow them

title: Over Hyped Garden
content: Overly hyped....its just another garden with obviously typical Chinese touch which has to be.....

title: Oasis of rest in the city
content:
Great visit with our Chinese guide to this beautiful garden. It's a good place to take photo's. If you go to Shanghai you must visit these!

(Beware of the mosquito's, their bites were very itchy)

title: Beautiful
content: An oasis of tranquility in Shanghai. It's a bit tricky to find the way in as it's in the middle of a big tourist market, but even with lots of people there it is well worth visiting.

title: Pretty garden
content: There are lots of photo opportunities. Very busy when I visited. Big market just outside. Worth a look.

title: Lots of fun!
content: The gardens are interesting.  The buildings are interesting.  The various restaurants and shops around the gardens are interesting.   Several shops selling steamed buns.  Yum!

title: Yu Garden - a must see, but not all that
content: Personally, I find Yu Garden too hectic and crowded for enjoyment. It's a must see on a first visit to Shanghai, for anyone who wants to experience any traditional culture. The Old Town is dramatically smaller in 2016 than I found it in 2008, with large blocks giving way to giant apartment blocks. But for me the Garden is still the highlight of that part of town. This time I also experienced a 1911 garden in Zhujiajiao, which was which not only less crowded, but laid out in a more serene, less packed manner.

title: Oh this place was so beautiful!
content: Beautiful park in Shangai. Crowded though. Felt like too many people and too noisy. Entrance fee worth to pay!

title: One of the best parks I have visited!
content: I could live here!! This is one of the prettiest parks-- lovely to walk through and feels so serene even though it is in the hustle and bustle of a shopping area!

title: Top in Shanghai
content:
This was my favorite place in Shangai.
But you have to go with a tourist guide. There is so much to learn that if you do it by yourself you will miss it.
And... You support the local economy as well.
Great place.

title: beautiful gardens and building
