It is a bit more run down than the gardens in Suzhou, but still worth the triip. Seemed to have mostly Chines tourists.

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Beautiful highlight
content: Truly a masterpiece of harmony and peace, you can easily get lost in this magnificent garden, featuring a series of artfully designed buildings, impressive boulders, running waters and curves in all places.

user_loc: 弗吉尼亚亚历山德里亚
title: Excellent place to stroll around on a free afternoon
content:
Beautifully preserved garden and historic structures.
If you have a free afternoon this is a great place to get a feel for historic Shanghai.
I would not recommend trying to visit during lantern festival. It becomes too congested.

title: Great for Kids!
content: My kids 10 and 11 loved it. It is a labryrinth of small caves and winding paths. There are many ponds with koi fish they found entertaining. We spent almost two hours there. I enjoyed the architecture and the gardens. I am glad we went in the morning about 0900. By the time we left it was insanely crowded.

title: Very interestingly and stimulatingly laid-out gardens
content: You'll love this multiple complex maze-like garden where small walled-in gardens are organically connected to compose a huge garden assembly. Wish we could stay there a bit longer to appreciate some favorite gardennets It's next to hustling commercial streets with many restaurants.

title: A peaceful garden in a crowded city
content: We enjoyed our little getaway at Yu Gardens as the crowded city of Shanghai surrounded us.  Take some time to relax and enjoy the greenery.

title: Well preserved traditional house
content: This use to be home to one of the high ranking official, representing the housing style in this region back then. Lucky it didn't get burnt down during war times.

title: Nice place in the middle of the city
content: If you are in Shanghai several days you can go but I think that you have more nice choice.

title: Nice and relaxing
content: A nice and tranquil garden, much quieter and peaceful than "fighting your way" through the crowds of people in the Yuyuan Old Street district to find the garden's entrance (it was a Sunday afternoon). There's an entrance fee. Lots to see in the garden and some pretty features, though I would have expected "more green spaces" since it was called a "garden". Worth a visit though.

title: China Stereotype
content: If you visit Shanghai and want to have the "real" China experience, that's the place to go. You can take pictures to show around and everyone will say: "oh so you have been to China". There is also a somehow nice temple area. But that's it.

title: Ancient looks and traditional foodies
content: The place is always busy because it gives a feel on ancient and modern Shanghai. Yu yuan visit in the evening is the most delightful because of the lights which decorate the place. The place glows golden with shops of gold and silver jewelry adding brightness to it. For meat eaters there are many options but veg lovers do get few options in traditional food shops and I recommend to try them. For others there is KFC and Mcdonalds also. You can shop some creative home decoration pieces and paintings here.

title: Nice place - but too much stress
content: It is a nice beautiful garden, nothing very special but with typical architecture. And it could be a relaxing place to go for a walk if it wouldn't be because it is extremely crowded and because of the pressure that they continuously put on tourists to try to sell them something and specially to cheat them, it is literally difficult to walk without being assaulted every minute. There is no worth the stress.

user_loc: 哥伦比亚特区华盛顿特区
title: Nice Oasis, great pictures
content: Very nice Garden area surrounded by a lot of tourist shopping (yay? nay?).  Makes for some fabulous pictures!  I would suggest going during the work week if possible as it was quite crowded on the weekend.

title: Don't go in March
content: I'm sure it is beautiful in spring, but in early March there were almost no flowers and little growing (except bamboo). The park is also smaller than we thought. We walked all around it in about 20 minutes.

title: Really crowded
content: The neighborhood of this place is really tipical. Surely deserves a visit... However it was really really crowded. Try to go early in the morning...

title: My Visit to Yu Garden
content: Yu Garden is one of the nice places can Shanghai Vistor see also the area around it have a lot of Gift Souvenir shops plus nice restaurants

title: Cute bonzai blossom
content: Ok this is China - it is crowded! Nonetheless it is a rather nice garden (30Y to get in). We could not find it because we were looking for a "park" but it is within the very large shopping area with chinese architecture

title: Crowded
content: I found it interesting but was glad I had seen another quiet garden. Jammed to the Christmas Eve at a mall point...I would go early and then have lunch. Good to do with Old Town shopping .

title: Old between the new
content: Very neat place in the centre of Shanghai. The gardens form part of an old part of town dating back to the 15-16th century. It is surrounded by the new highrises, so that gives a cool perspective. The gardens themselves are really neat with different halls as well as ponds with koi fish and neat rock formations. The bazar/market surrounding it allows for a taste of chinese tourism!

title: Disappointed
content: We went there hoping to catch something memorable but all we saw was nothing that's worth it. The square that sells food is pretty impressive with all the choices though. Be prepared for ques.

title: An ancient Garden of the ming emporer- Well preserved !!
content: Yu garden,is a well preserved garden of the Ming dynasty.Its a pleasant walk along the gardens and water bodies.A lot of chinese culture and heritage have been well preserved in the yu garden.

title: Great Garden !
content: We never expected it to be such a beautiful place. This place itself is a world within the world. Such a neatly planned & landscaped with Rocks, Lakes and gardens with lovely trees around. Definitely worth a visit to this old world colonial bungalow / mansion. The one lived here should be a man with love for nature and he should have thoroughly enjoyed his days here. It was a little paradise with in this mad city.

title: Leisure outing
content: The surroundings eateries discern a more enjoyable place than the garden itself. However, is it a nice outing to enjoy an afternoon amongst nice floral, ponds, fishes, dragon walls with dragon heads. It is a classical Ming era garden, took 20 years to build during the Ming dynasty. Thereafter, proceed to savour sumptuous, delicious food around the vicinity. Take metro to Yu Yuan Garden station, purple line 10.

title: Boring and touristy
content: To me, the Yu Garden was nothing I had never seen before. Next time I visit Shanghai I'll be glad to skip this touristy garden and its surrounding old town, filled with MacDonalds, Haagen-Dasz, other multinational companies, and selfiestick salesmen.

title: A tranquil place in the middle of a big city
content: It is a great place to escape the city for a while. It seems like you are not in the city when you enter, but rather in a movie-set. Locals are everywhere and the scenery is relaxing.

title: Yu Garden
content: Do not go there on holidays because it will be very crowded. You can eat nice food there. If you go there during Spring Festival, you can enjoy the Lantern show there. If you go there at night during Spring Festival, it is not free. Otherwise, it is free.

title: What a unexpected adventure
content: We a little hesitant to go in, but discovering entry was only 30rmb thought we would give it a go, having looked around, and thinking that was it, saw a few people emerging from a narrow passage way in the rocks, that lead to another area, so off we whent, this was repeated many times, and took us several hours to explore fully, quite a few shops selling paintings and jade.

title: Rather commercialised with nothing spectacular
content: 30 minutes is sufficient if u are just sight-seeing here. Shops are very commercialised and food sucks despite being over-priced.

title: Difficult to find the entrance
content: Located in old parts of Shanghai which was nice. Entry is from within the market area and wasn't very easy to find. Garden costs 30 RMB to enter. Walked around for about 30 min and saw maybe 1/3 of the garden but it was a lot of the same. Can imagine it will be nicer later in spring when more is blooming.

title: The peacefull garden in the hectic city
content: One of the place that must be seen in shanghai, while you can either shop or just walking to see the different atmosphere of one of the big busiest city in the world.

title: Calm in the Middle of Shanghai
content: A must see if you come to Shanghai. Beautiful architecture in peaceful setting surrounded by the bustle of Shanghai tourist market. When you are through shopping relax in this preserved gem of old China.

title: Beautiful even in winter
content: Although we visited in late February the gardens were worth the trip with our guide to help us we were taken on a tour of the place and enjoyed the look and history of the place.

title: Touristy, Yet Enjoyable
content: I believe we were very lucky. There were very few people there the night we went, and it was quite wonderful. While I didn't see many tourists, I got the impression that this is one of the major tourist attractions in Shanghai. The shops seemed to be nice and diverse, but many seemed focused towards tourists. Nonetheless, this area provided us with a pleasant evening stroll, and I wish we could have spent more time there.

title: Beautiful and traditional garden
content: It's my first time visiting such old traditional Chinese garden, so nice and you can take a beautiful picture easily.

title: A little old town remains
content: Not much left that is old anymore. There is also an old wall museum to visit next to a temple a further walk from the gardens. Well to the gardens and this temple, the ponds and bridges and too many souvenir shops, its all quite charming, especially during recent lantern festival. Must visit.(less so the old wall museum)

title: Lovely Yu Garden
content: Its a place where one can enjoy Peace & Tranquillity along with lovely Chinese Culture. A very historic place and must watch in Shanghai. It has lovely architecture and water ponds with awesome pathways and corridors. One can only appreciate its beauty by visiting this place.

title: Fun place!
content: This is a great place to visit, especially during the Chinese New Year. Lots of people and things going on.

title: Beautiful sanctuary
content: What a beautiful, peaceful garden! A place to relax from the hustle and bustle of the city. Don't miss this garden if visiting Shanghai.

title: Beautiful
content: Beautiful place nestled among busy Shanghai. Nice to see koi fishes even though they were in very green waters. There's a giant dragon wall which is amazing. Then as you exit you can go shopping in the bizarre which has tons of shops and eateries. Definitely could spend the whole day at the Garden and shopping at the bizarre.

title: choose the day to visit carefully
content: Ive been to this garden may be 7 times. If its national holiday or even summer weekend Id suggest to go elsewhere. Cant enjoy it with 500 other ppl inside. But sunny weekday at Yu Garden can bring tons of joy and tons of nice pictures. Dont forget to bring some bread to feed fishies.

title: Overcrowded and ugly lights in the park during New Year
content: I recommend to not go there during the CNY period. It's overcrowded and some infrastructures linked to the CNY are set up, which destroy the charm and beauty of this area.

title: Love it
content: You can try a lot of food and shopping chinese traditional things! More beautiful at night,nanxiang steamed bun is famous too but queue is too long,no time to try it though but love it

title: Beauty of Old Shanghai
content: I loved my visit to these gardens - very tranquil and meditative, and a lovely place to get away from the frenzy of Shangha for a couple of hours. This is a beautiful place to take pictures. The shop inside the garden is where I bought my very favorite souvenir from China - my name inscribed in Chinese characters to use as a signature stamp.

title: Great Historical Location
content: Really interesting gardens and architecture. Around every corner is something unique and interesting. Go on a weekday to avoid overwhelming crowds. Nearby are hundreds of shops and restaurants but inside the gardens its peaceful and beautiful.

title: Just Wow
content: Breath taking garden in a local area of the city, just beautiful I'll say, clean and weather in August was amazingly suite for me, I spend most wonderful time in there, must visit indeed.

title: Crowded
content: I visited on weekend and it was very crowded. Don't forget to try the 'tang bao' or gravy bread and other unique snack which you can only find in Yu Yuan.

title: Great place to take pictures!
content: The overall place is really crowded with people that come visit all the shops around but once in the garden, it is very calm and peaceful. The garden has beautiful arrangements and for photographers is really good!

title: Chinese serenity
content: I was going to give it a miss as I got there at 4 pm and the sign said last ticket 4,45pm....but you still get an hour on top of that so I paid the ¥30 and ventured in....glad I did. It is a beautifully serene place. Lots of places to sit. Be careful of the open bridge as people do push past you. Also the jade which you have to step on at times is especially slippery. ...wouldn't want to risk it in the rain. Take a look at the pics...they tell the story.

title: Beautiful garden in the middle of Shanghai. Very rich Chinese architecture, design and tranquility.
content: This garden was absolutely lovely. It's a wonderful place to go with the whole family, as a couple, or alone. It's fitting for all parties. You get a real feel for another side of China that maybe is not so modern or globalized as some of the major cities like Shanghai or Beijing. This place allows you to see China from another perspective, how it used to be. There are quite a few tourists there and it can be busy on a Saturday. Nevertheless, I highly recommend visiting this gorgeous garden. There's something about being able to take something in like this in the middle of a huge, bustling city (like Shanghai is). There are lots of little corners you can explore and you'll feel rejuvenated to have been able to see something so beautifully preserved and something different, where time stands still.

title: Great Chinese Garden
content: Walking through the Yu Garden was an experience specially for first timer in Shanghai. The garden was filled with varieties of Chinese architecture designs and arts. With a good guide explaining the meaning of the various art pieces could be enlightening. The whole Yu Garden complex was rather small but to see the place can take some time because of its various corners and spaces within the compact structures.

title: A Nice Way to Enjoy the Afternoon
content: Yu Garden is a great place to visit. If you enjoy architecture and culture you should definitely visit. A traditional scholar garden casting shadows, the pavements and buildings coming to life with design. The buildings and all the details are exquisite. Definitely worth the time to stroll through the Garden and enjoy the history.

title: A bit of calm in Shanghai
content: Except all the shops at the entrance of the garden, the garden it self is really a place to go. Nice architecture, relaxing spot to sit down near to a pound, feeding the Koï carp.

title: A sprawl of shops & stores
content: Everything outside and around Yu Garden is almost as interesting as the garden itself if you are a person who likes shopping. It is alleys of small shops and street stalls all around & the garden is a nice quiet respite from the city sprawl around it.

title: Crowds on New Years
content: We visited during the lantern celebration as part of New Year. Oh, man, what a crowd!  The elaborate lantern displays on the bridge drew pressing throngs, but it was all fun.  We ducked into the garden as a respite, and it was an idyllic experience.

title: didnt find anything unique here as a tourist. Maybe good open space if you have children
content: It has an entry ticket. It looked crowded even on a weekday in August. I felt it must be a popular place in Shanghai. I however didnt find anything unique here as a tourist. Just a garden with some rock formations and figurines. Maybe there is an art/ history perspective to it which i didnt appreciate as i went there without a guide.

title: garden lovers' paradise
content: This tourist site is very busy, even in the off-season, but it is worth it.  Very peaceful and very beautiful.

title: Beautiful garden. worth admission.
content: Great place to spend a few hours wandering and exploring. A bit confusing at first as its layout is somewhat of a labyrinth, but once you figure it out its easy. many little buildings and walkways. huge coy pond great for photos.

title: A must see in Shanghai
content: Although I personally feel the gardens in Shuzhou are much prettier and impressive, Yu Yuan in Shanghai is a must see. (especially if you aren't going to Suzhou). I personally would allow a full day here (start early it gets crowded!) Tour the garden first, then have lunch, and do the shops on the are all around the actual garden. There is nothing like it in the world!

title: Pretty garden
content: The grounds were pretty. It was very crowded. I am sure it looks very nice in spring when all the trees and plants are bloomed. There are ponds with fish. Which causes a lot of congestion, as people stop to look and there is only little space to pass them.

title: Very Tranquil
content: These gardens are very big, and very peaceful. There are many different water pools and beautiful buildings and rock formations. I visited the gardens early in the morning when there was very few tourists. I would recommend this, as I heard it can get very crowed later in the day.

title: Beautiful Garden
content: This is a must stop in Shanghai, the Yu Garden is next to the Old City Bazaar and it's incredible. For a small entry fee you get to see an incredible 500 year old garden in the middle of the city. Great location to take pictures and get out of the hassle of the bazaar.

title: a must visit during the cny
content: what a beautiful sight.. the cny was a great time to visit.. have been here few times before.. beautiful place..

title: Yu Gardens
content: Yu Gardens are best seen at night due to the entertainment by the locals. The Gardens are very beautiful and manicured. The people come out at night in little groups and start dancing and singing everywhere. A real sense of close knit communities. Beautiful to watch.

title: Great views
content: Went to visit Yi garden, amazing experience but this particular day was too windy and cold. Also all the shops outside are good for souvenirs but really need to bargain to et a good deal (they are used to bargain)

title: beautiful and quiet
content: 30 Yuan entry and it is easy to get lost (actually, we got lost) inside this deceptively large and beautiful garden. Worth a trip.

title: Just phenomenal
content: The ticket here is just 30 Yuan and its easy to get from the window. What happens inside is just out of this world. The rockery, the garden with rooms in the middle of water, birds chirping around and friendly fishes in the water are all so mesmerizing. Once in a while you may see a modern tall tower building at the backdrop. A nice place to sit and spend and see an old structure in the middle of hustle bustle and still so isolated. Could spend hours.

title: Mid week quiet--perfect time to visit
content: We visited in the middle of the week, early morning and the crowds weren't overwhelming. As always, with China, keep your valuables close to your person.

title: Unique "home" with amazing gardens and buildings.
content: This was definitely a surprise on the tour, to have these beautiful gardens and buildings as part of a single "home" complex, built hundreds of years ago.  Worth seeing.

title: Don't go at Chinese New Year
content: After an hour of pushing and getting pushed by thousands of people, I gave up on trying to reach the garden itself. Most of the entrances were 'exit only' and heavily guarded. Signage was poor and the guards' directions were vague. It's a nice area, but try to find a quiet time to go.

title: Put this on your "Must See" list in Shanghai
content: I live in Shanghai part of the year and I have to recommend Yuyuan to everyone. If you go to Shanghai you really have to see Yuyuan Garden and the old world architecture of the adjacent shopping area. The Gardens are very typical of traditional Chinese Gardens. You can spend hours here and it is a great way to see how the old gardens in China look. No need to leave the city on a day trip to a place with nice gardens. These gardens compare to those of the Humble Administrators garden in Suzhou, but much easier to visit. There is a Metro station very close to Yuyuan. The great thing here is that the garden and Yuyuan shopping are adjacent to each other. Even though I am not a power shopper, I love going to the Yuyuan shopping area. It is the best example of old world architecture in Shanghai. Whenever I bring someone new to Shanghai I always put Yuyaun on the list of places to take them to. Along with the Bund, the French Concession and Jing'an Temple, Yuyuan is a "Must See".

title: Must visit
content: I have visited this place thrice and never get bored. The place is well maintained inside and wore a festive look for the Chinese new year.... Must see it once

title: The most beautiful
content: Yu Garden is very very beatiful garden.when you enter in this garden you sense enter to medieval period and shrink from ballyhoo and have a relaxation and paceful.

title: Pretty nice place
content: This place is really nice and historical place. Closed at 5 pm. It's pretty hard to find the entrance. Most of tourists don't speak English so it took me a while to find out after having to ask a western tourist.

title: Interesting outing
content: As with most tourist attractions in China, try to go during the week when it's quiet. The architecture is beautiful and it's worth paying to see the actual gardens. Loads of Koi fish in the ponds and the walk ways are slippery.

title: CNY
content: Great place to visit ! I went for Chinese New Years and it was jammed packed. So if your not into crowds avoid this place. The Din Tai Fung in the area closed down this year. Instead opted for Yu Shanghai restaurant on the 3rd floor which was a mistake.

title: So crowded
content: During my visit yo shanghai i had been to this place to visit where many chinese visit this place so its so crowded but the place is so nice with lake and hostric antique buildings

title: Very authantic
content: Very interesting place its amust see in Shangai its very crouded palce and a big tourist atraction place. you can find everthing for tourist around the gardens too but dont buy electronics they are all fake. The garden inside is very interesting.

title: Cozy!
content: Cozy garden! Actually it was someone's home in Ming dynasty! It is located in the super central of Shanghai, and it brought me back to old time when I was hanging around in this garden! I believed this is the number one place I liked in SH. Pearl of Shanghai!

title: Garden was enchanting.
content: The garden was enchanting. The shopping area around the garden was chaotic with lots of hustlers trying to sell questionable goods.

title: Chinese New Year celebrations
content: The Yuyuan Garden is an amazing oasis in the middle of a busy shopping area. It is conveniently situated very close to the Yuyuan Garden Metro Station. There is sufficient English signage to get to the Garden quite easily.

title: A piece of history
content: This garden just glows,it was a wonderful trip and i enjoyed all the beautiful and scenic spots to be found.it is usually quite crowded and but still quite enjoyable!

title: So crowded
content:
We tried to visit in Lunar New year time. However the place was so crowded that after 3-4hs slow moment we gave up and turned back. 
Very difficult with kids.

title: great history
content: really enjoyed walking round Yu gardens and learning the history of it all. Rocks in there brought for the emporer amazing. To be recommended.

title: Beautiful
content: This garden was a wonderful stop.  It doesn't need to take a lot of time, but one certainly could spend a few hours here.  The architecture was enjoyable and the garden itself is quite peaceful; however, the surrounding area is chaos.

title: Beautiful place to get lost in!
content:
Small fee is charged and you have to get there through a section of shops, restaurants and street vendors (be warned!). Yu Garden offers a beautiful peaceful walk thought and over ponds, offering lots of greenery and sculptures.

Very enjoyable!

title: Beautiful traditional Chinese architecture
content: Plenty to see, beautiful gardens and light installations during Chinese new year. Mix of products to buy and a lot of choice for food.

title: Beautiful but small
content: This garden was beautiful and traditional hidden away inside the the centre of a busy city. We went first thing in the morning when it first opened and were the only ones there giving us the opportunity to take photos without other tourists in the way but within about 45 people started to build up and this can be a problem because the garden is really small. I would certainly recommend coming here while youre in shanghai since its near the bund and doesnt cost too much to get it. Just get there early.

title: Cold and misty, but enjoyable.
content: We had a great time wandering around this Ming-era garden.  It was beautiful but would have been made better if we knew more about what we were seeing.

title: Beautiful Gardens
content: Definitely worth visiting the Yu Gardens while in Shanghai to see the lovely Chinese gardens. At the entrance were many shops which were worth a visit as well and a tea house near the exit which was fun.

title: A Cultural must
content: I love strolling around this place. Its so full of history and culture. There are also shops that you can go into and buy some things that will remind you of China. It a very busy place. So full of people. But a must see one.

title: A great place to spend half a day
content: A large compound in yuyuan are with great garden, ponds and traditional architecture that was well maintained

title: A very ancient garden
content: We spent about 30 mins looking round these gardens, they were quite interesting but I wouldn't particularly go out of your way to go there. In February the temperature was 0C and so it kept us amused for a while

title: Yu yuan garden
content:
Beautiful garden peaceful away from the shopping business.
Beautiful lake in good feng shui!!
In the middle of the shopping district of the bund and nanging road.

title: Nice Tourist spot
content: Nice place to experience some history of Chinese Gardens. It's on most of the tours and is quick and informative. Wort a quick visit for  a few pictures.

title: Best place for street food
content: Compared with most Chinese Garden, Yu is not very impressive. However, local food there is fantastic! Meat-stuffed mooncakes are amazing! Steamed dumplings are amazing!... a must visit area !

title: A MUST see in Shanghai
content: These gardens are amazing. A throwback to 400yr old China. Spend a day here and you won't be disappointed. Great shopping and restaurant stalls when you exit. Make sure to negotiate!!!

title: Tranquility in the city
content: It's probably one of the biggest parks that you will come across in the city, as fascinating as Shanghai is to the eye so is its Park. It has everything that one could possibly think off and it's huge, activities galore and so are the people over a weekend. There's kite flying, people exercising, boating and much more to keep you healthy and tired. The access to the park was a bit tricky for me though but you need to get off the subway station and follow the directions which in itself is a walk, good for a warm up . Enjoy it for a afternoon or evening stroll, you'll be amazed with the elderly and their activities, something that the Chinese do well and will probably make you feel very old.

title: A beautiful insight into Old Shanghai
content: In the midst of the chaos that is Shangai this ancient ming garden is well worth a visit as it offers a small oasis as well as giving an idea as to what the beautiful gardens of ancient china must have been like.

title: Past in the city of the Future
content: This place bring the old glory of chinese history with old time buildings and loads of shopping to be done with from chinese antiques to the latest technology drones and other electronics. Really loved this place for the nice architecture of the buildings in the surrounding areas and a nice Yu garden adjoining it.

title: Yu Garden (Yuyuan)
content:
No.218 Anren Street, Huangpu District | near Fuyou Road, Shanghai 200010, China 
A delightful Chinese Garden -- Best to visit in the morning.

title: Very nice little garden - if you only go to Shanghai (Say NO to tea ceremony offers)
content: Very nice little garden. To see a beautiful chinese garden and if you don't plan to go out of Shanghai. We saw more impressive ones in Suzhou - Tiger Hill and the Humble administrator garden.

title: Average for the seasoned traveller.
content: Metro Line 10. Alight at Yu Garden Station.

title: Such a lovely spot
content: This was such a lovely spot, I could have stayed here for hours. It was quiet and peaceful and the gardens were lovley

title: Interesting
content: This 400 odd years old park is worth a visit. It is more pathways and scattered buildings than gardens. In January there wasn't a lot of greenery to see.

title: Pleasant gardens
content: Easy stroll around. Nice to see the old china and the old ways of buildings since everything gets pulled down and rebuilt. Lovely place and nice and clean

title: Beautiful Garden!
content: Beautiful gardens! Can get extremely busy though. Go around new year and you will see it decked out in some fantastic decorations! There is also and Old Town surrounding the area that is lovely, but full of touristy shops.

title: A trip to Old Shanghai
content: Not to be missed! The buildings here are exotic. Preferably visit around 6pm and see the lights come up making the place mystic. However, if you would like to enter the main garden area you have to be there before 4pm I guess.

title: Nice Garden in the midst of busy Shanghai
content: We visit the garden near the 15th day of Chinese New Year. The place is quite crowded outside but inside the Garden itself the atmosphere is different. There are visitors but still the garden is quite relax place and lots of nice things to be seen.

title: NTBM in Shanghai.  Walk through old town to find entrance
content: This is a gotta go place.  Lovely gardens and old traditional buildings.  Try to avoid weekends.  Old town surrounding it is nice but very touristy.

user_loc: 阿根廷布宜诺斯艾利斯
title: Amazing and traditional place in the middle of a modern Shanghai
content: This garden is a must seen in Shanghai. Beautiful place, very peaceful, inside the old city. There are amazing constructions and a beautiful garden. Just outside the garden there are lots of shops and places to have chinese food.

title: Yu garden
content: Nice place to visit, the garden is beautifull. Also the shop and restaurants near by are very nice. Worht to visit during your stay in Shanghai.

title: A mix of history & market
content: This is also something Tripadvisor got me interested in and since it was so close to the Bund & my hotel - I thought why not. And I am Happy that I went. It offers a mix of souvenir shopping, local authentic food and history. Pearls, Tea and typcial Chinese lamps etc.is everywhere. F

title: Interesting, but a pain to find..
content: Very interesting site. Would not recommend that you go on a very cold day like I did !

title: beautiful garden, an historic place
content: Its construction followed the precepts of Feng Shui Chinese philosophy , respecting and including elements of earth , mountains , water and air, and divided into 6 areas and main palaces , that go up losing a labirindo doors and passages

user_loc: 卡罗莱纳州戈尔兹伯勒
title: Beautiful
content: Went on an overcast day and kinda rainy, yet the garden was still very lovely. I would have liked to stay a little longer, but the rain started to come down harder and we had to leave after only one hour.

title: Lose yourself here
content: The Yu Yuan Garden is an excellent break from the hustle and haggling of the vendors in Old Shanghai. The scenery gets better at every turn it seems. The photos really do not do justice. Also the vendors at the exit seem to have pretty good deals. Location is quite ideal but you should go early to avoid the crowds.

title: Exquisitely beautiful!!!
content: This place was not on my list initially, but I'm so glad I went there after all: the garden with the little houses tucked away among the trees is absolutely charming! And the entrance fee was really low, only 30 RMB.

title: Nice garden
content:
Yu Yuan Garden located in site of City God temple.
Can find a lot of nice plant and small lake in Yu Yuan garden.
Nice and relax place for short visit.

title: Nice architecture and good place to visit
content:
Located within the Yu Yuan area where a lot of shops and restaurants outside... Entrance fee of rmb30 per adult..
Allocate around 2-3 hours to fully enjoy the garden, the interiors and the architecture.. Place is not really big.

title: Relaxing spot in the hectic city
content: Yu Yuan (Yuan means Garden) is a beautiful and typically Chinese style garden in the middle of the old town in Shanghai. There are lots of nooks and corners where you can relax and take in the scenery. Luckily it's never too crowded and there are times when you feel like you have it all to yourself. There are two entrances, but both wind up in the same vicinity. BTW, a nice thing to do is also to walk outside the garden along its walls. It's a nice part of the old city and not touristy.

title: Fun, must see, caution
content: A must see location for tourists with many fake brand offers. Watch out for pickpockets and offers of visiting tea ceremonies. Do your research (eg virtual tourist.com) before wandering out anywhere in Shanghai - it is Shanghai after all.

title: A small place, gets crowded easy
content: Very pretty, You can't see it from the street since this is at the rear of a busy "market place". If you want sunlit photos be sure to go mid day, once the sun starts to drop most of the garden is in shadows. Charges admission.

title: A must visit especially if you are a Muslim
content: This is the place to visit as it is near the Mosque and also Lanzhou Noodle style Muslim Restaurant. The zig zag bridge is unique but can be too crowded if you plan to take photos. There are lots of souvenirs stall here and they are quite cheap too.

title: Nice place
content: Nice place with a lot of historical places . Many awesome rooms and halls . The kids will love such a place

title: Mr Pan's private garden
content: Not very colourful in January. Full of history, architecture and history.Many interesting facets. Local artisans have a display within. Haggling is recommended.

user_loc: 伊利诺伊州厄巴纳-香槟
title: Very Nice Garden
content: We've reached the garden area via Shanghai metro located nearby. The streets surrounding the gardens are fashioned in ancient Chinese-like architecture and are filled with small shops and restaurants with the garden in the center of it all. The entrance fee, as most in China, was very cheap.

title: Beautiful time of the year to visit Yu Garden
content: Just decided to stop over the Yu yuan gardens since it's just 3 stops from hotel, Sheraton Hongkou.

title: Not bad, far from unforgettable.
content: Garden looks foreign to the city environment. It is pleasant to visit and gives an outlook of what houses of mandarins looked like, made of discrete but rich symbolism. No or little access to the buildings. Located to a rather kitch fake old city dedicated to Chinese fast foods and articles for tourists (the kind of things your better do not purchase). Are you in the neighborhood, visit it. Should you go across the city in order to get there, you will find better things to do and to see.

title: Little gem
content: This is a nice little gem right in the middle of town but beware it is very popular and very crowded. Must see.

title: 3rd time here
content: This is my 3rd visit over the last 10 years. It is always crowded. I like YuYuan and its surrounding streets for the old Shanghai taste. A good place to shop some souvenirs too.

title: Touristic but good.
content:
Get there early if you don't want to 'mingle' with hundreds of thousands of other tourists.
Enjoyable but to commercial. Visit one of the other water towns if you want a real and authentic experience.

title: Yu Garden is packed with tourists and trinkets
content: The delightful architecture and history is covered by local tourists, trinkets hawkers and large tourist groups.  It's almost impossible to walk around if you are not there before 11am.  It's not for people who don't want to hear constant sales tactics, noises and HUGE crowds.

title: Fun traditional section of shanghai
content: Beautiful gardens situated in the heart of a huge shopping area (bazaar). Tough to find - the entrance we found was at the dead-end of an offshoot from the bazaar. A ticket is required.

title: Different
content: Although we visited the garden when It was raining we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. when you think how long it took to build and the different areas it is amazing.

title: Visit to the Old City and Yu Garden
content: One can not visit Shanghai and forget this reminiscences of the past! Designed gardens, wood temples make part of history

title: Adorable and relaxing
content:
The Gardens are a beautiful place to rest your mind and soul in such a busy city,  The price isn't high and just a stones throw from a tourist shoppers paradise!

Have coffee and snack first^^

title: Mesmerizing during Chinese New Year
content: My friends and I visited the place on new year's eve and then the next day to see traditional new year celebration. The entire place was adorned with lights and lanterns which are traditional features of the celebration. There were restaurants, however, with the influx of locals and tourists, they ran out of food quite fast. The next day, since we came at noon, we were seated at Nanxiang for our dose of xialongbao.

title: Beauty in the Great History of Shanghai
content: We visited the Garden during Jan 2016. The decorations were up for Chinese New Year, and it was cold, but SO worth the wonderful experience! The shops surrounding the Garden even allowed you to get some great souvenirs and gifts for the family.

title: Peace and tranquility in the midst of Shanghai.
content: This is a great place to relax and see old world culture in the midst of modern and busy Shanghai. A great place to shop, people watch, and see a touch of the old culture.

title: Pretty water garden attached to sprawling tourist shopping area.
content: The Yu Garden is a large water garden that I was surprised to find in downtown Shanghai. I would not call it serene, as it was always crowded. You also have to fight through hordes of tourists (mostly local) to even get to the Garden. I'm rating this at 4 stars because I enjoyed people watching at the tourist area attached to the gardens. If you are looking for something peaceful, look elsewhere.

title: A surprise to find this park in the middle of Shanghai
content: Nice place to be. Traditional buildings and a big pond full of goldfishes. Also a lot of shops. Most of the times it is very busy.

title: The garden has nothing much to see anymore
content: I'm a foreigner staying here for 12 years and been to Yu Garden countless time ..... Last month visited the garden with some friends but its a pity that nothing was improved and I don't think they did any good maintenance as well.... You can skip it, save your money and just walk around the area of Cheng Huang Miao (the temple) but no need to buy ticket to the garden

title: Amazing!!
content: We had an incredible time wandering through the gardens and checking out the traditional style buildings. There's a tea house on the way in that's worth popping into. It's definitely worth the money but try to find a time that's not too busy.

title: Very Interesting Historical Garden
content: Very busy with tourists. The crowds turn me off, but I still visit once a year..... Because of the thick crowds (which can be a bit pushy at times) it might not be a great experience for parents with young children..... Spring flowering trees are quite special during March and April.

title: It is a beautiful garden except you have to walk through all the shops to get there
content: This garden is not far from the metro stop. easy to get too. But I am a bit sick of all the shops you have to cross in order to go to the garden. There're so many people there. I would not recommend it to people with kids. So crowded (even that I went there in a week day! But the garden is nice, well maintain. But it is smaller than I thought.

title: Beautiful!
content: Beautiful gardens tucked away in the middle of the bustling city. It was like going back in time. Peaceful and serene! A must see before heading to the markets and shops that surround it.

title: Awesome trip for a short time
content: It was amazing. Every bit as beautiful as the pictures. The history that we learned from Jenny was paramount and not attainable any other way. It was great. She named all

title: Fantastic
content: It is an ancient and beautiful garden with various plants that make it a proper place for taking memorable pictures. As we visited the garden in autumn, its beauty had been completed with colorful falling leaves.

title: Full of surprises
content: Yu Garden is a garden i guess but its very tied into the retail market/shopping streets around it .  It is also very busy but that's part of the experience.  It has great architecture and some interesting sights.  Worth a wander.

title: Feeling Shanghai
content: I loved Yu Garden it was like going into the heart of the Chinese people. The bazaar, the food, the people it seemed unreal but it was real. The gardens are beautiful old and mysterious to a certain point. History can be felt and walking through it was like making contact with the past no matter where you came from.

title: Vast garden tucked away in the middle of a busy shopping district
content: We walked by the entrance to Yu Garden a couple times before we actually noticed the entrance - it's situated in the middle of a tourist shopping area. There is an entrance fee, but it's pretty reasonable. Once inside, we were very impressed with how large the garden was. It was very serene and peaceful, and we spent several hours walking around. Would definitely recommend a visit if you are in Shanghai.

user_loc: 马其顿共和国斯科普里
title: u must to see it
content: yuyuan garden is the best attraction in Shanghai, very old and peaceful place where u can enjoy few hours

title: Beautiful!
content: Great little oldish space in the very urban Shanghai. It is a really cool place to spend a couple hours in...

title: Serenity in the middle of chaotic Shanghai
content: Yu garden is a classic royal garden that somehow survived the cultural revolution. It is a calm oasis in the bustle of Shanghai.

title: nice
content: Fine touristplace. shopping and eating. Sometimes also some show inside. Ok place for spending some hours

title: An authentic Chinese style garden
content: i love the chinese-classic ambience of this Yu Garden! too bad it was weekend when we went there, so the garden was overloaded with tourists, it's hard to find a spot for taking photos.

title: Been there several times. Worth the trip.
content: Bring a camera.  Lovely place to walk and shop. Have the tea and buy the tea. Silk shop was amazing. Completely yummy.  Great day to spend an entire day.

title: Outstanding
content: I wholeheartedly recommend this place. In this maze-like garden, one can spend an hour or two of quality time looking around. Make sure you go through all the hidden areas before you leave!

title: Ancient beauty inside the walls that hold out the commercialism.
content: To get to Yu Gardens you must walk through many shops and stands catering to tourists. I wouldn't plan to shop in this area because the prices are high and lines are long. It is interesting to see the varieties of food, but we were told by our hotel to not eat there if we want good food. It's more like fair food in the U.S.

title: Beautiful
content: Lovely place to visit with beautiful old trees and buildings. Good shopping and restaurants outside the garden too.

title: very well preserved ancient garden
content: It took me two hours to walk thru the garden and soak in the peaceful environment right next to the busiest market in Shanghai. The architecture layout and construction details are very impressive. I am happy to see that it was preserved versus being torn down to build more shopping centers.

title: not authentic
content: not old as you might think, full of people. It is nice when you come to China for the first time...but nothing special. Although some restaurants inside are good!

title: A tiny piece of history in a modern city
content: These gardens are lovely to tour, but they can become very crowded and the wear and tear from the hordes of tourists shows. Still it is well worth the visit. Go early in the day to enjoy it more.

title: Stepping back in time...
content: Absolutely amazing to go from the sky scrapers to the old town in the center of the city. Great shopping! recommend the silk museum, very informative and beautiful items for sale.

title: Crowded and overrated
content: when compared to other ancient cultural heritage of the china, this gives a very confusing picture.. and we came out confused.

title: if you are in shanghai, it's a must
content: This garden is surrounded by the hustle and bustle of shanghai. Local street vendors and some small shops make this place an ideal place to visit for any out of towner. I ended up buying tons of fabulous souvenirs for my friends and they loved em all!

title: Must Visit in Shanghai
content: Many stores and street snacks and beautiful old building (They make it into shopping place and restaurant, but still maintain the old building) Enter city of god temple 10yuan and yu garden 35yuan for sight seeing and take good photos.

title: one of my favorite areas in Shanghai
content: I love the gardens the temple and the old buildings. I was so glad we visited this, I wanted to see the real China. You have little canals and a temple near by to visit plus the old Chinese houses/buildings with traditional and old shops.

title: Nicely decorated for Chinese New Year
content:
I was very impressed by the enormous and plentiful decorations that were put in place for the upcoming celebration of the arrival of the year or the Monkey.

The area is VERY lively, beautiful and should not be missed!

title: Guyana Garden.
content: Beautiful site with street food,shopping and this area are crowded . Can reach by underground Line train.

title: Great example of Chinese garden
content: really enjoyed the walk through the garden. fantastic architecture and beautiful surroundings. Guide kept us moving so would recommend taking more time and skipping a museum or something else..

title: OK to visit
content: 30 rmb to enter the garden area. Otherwise you can walk around the area. Lots of food options around.

title: If you like nature and peace
content: You can go by metro line 10.The station is called "Yu Yuan / Yu Garden".

title: Interesting walk but crowded
content: It's a place you will end up when being in Shanghai. It would be very crowded and it's better to visit when in spring not in winter so the garden show its beauty.

title: A Day Tour.
content: This is the second time I have visited the Yu Gardens, and I have loved it each time that I have visited them. I had to go through a fish market to get to the gardens which was very busy and very crowded, but the difference when you enter the gardens is completely the opposite. They are very peaceful and tranquil and also very interesting. I was on a tour so it was good to get some interesting information on the gardens themselves.

title: Overcrowded
content: Nothing else for tourist in shanghai so this is the only place to be. It's near, reachable by mtr line 10, if ur staying at people's park / Nanjing area, 1 station away costs 3 yuan. I would not recommend it though. Waste of time.

title: Underwhelming personally
content: I would've probably given this place five stars but unfortunately for us, we live in Los Angeles and have the Huntington Library and Gardens with their beautiful Chinese garden. If you haven't been to the Huntington, then this would be a great place for you to see a great example of how Chinese gardens are designed with Yin Yang-Feng shui concepts in mind. The natural elements were all beautiful and there are very many Kodak moments to be taken. The one lesson I did learn from here is why the dragons are on the houses: to protect from fires.

title: Beautiful but wrong time of year
content: The grounds are quite extravagant with tea houses and ponds eloborately decorated. Most flowers were not in bloom but I didn't even think about it until someone else mentioned it. The lack of blooms did not take away from the beautiful buildings, pathways, hidden walkways, and ponds with bright fish. The outside area may seem busy and interesting but it is worth the money to go inside. We all (even my husband) enjoyed our time here and there are many picturesque views for the photographer in you.

title: A subtle taste of ancient China
content: Situated right after a classic ancient China- like market, Yu Garden is one of the key attractions in the city.

title: Bad timing
content: I have since been told that the best time to visit the Yuyuan is around 7 am, followed by drinking tea in the historic tea house outside the entrance: you will be taking part in a time-honoured tradition among the locals who will appreciate your presence. I made the mistake of heading there mid-Saturday morning, by which time the crowds were unbearable. People were pushing to get along the zigzag bridge entrance and it would have been very unpleasant to join them.

title: Historic gardens
content: A wonderful meandering walk through time! The historic gardens where once that famous sign was displayed! (Look it up). It is now a shopping e perience like only China can provide, wonderful art work and craftsmanship displayed alongside worthless tat. Ancient buildings, a big temple and lots of snack food outlets make this a great place to wander round for a couple of hours, pick up a piece of caligraphy and a "I heart Shanghai" fridge magnet.

title: Very Nice Garden in Shanghai
content: This is a very peaceful garden in Shanghai. It is a mad house outside but nice inside. It really is not that large. We went with a guide who helped explain some of the symbolism.

title: A lovely place to visit
content: What a lovely little garden situated right amidst the hustle and bustle of Shanghai. Really love and worth a stop. Check out the tea house across the way and learn about the tea ceremony!

title: Lovely if you are around
content: It is a highlight of the surroundings and interesting if you like history and art. I recommend buying tea as a souvenir.

title: A garden
content: This is a pleasant garden to visit when you only have a short time in the city. The garden had many interesting features such as the wooden bridges, stonework and with the well stocked ponds. it was a shame that is had been raining earlier as we did not see it at its best. There is however a sense of peace

title: Come early to enjoy the scene
content: This garden is so quiet in the early morning, and you could enjoy the scene and philosophy of the garden. After finishing, you could then do some shopping around this place.

title: Great day out!
content: If you want an authentic experience visit the Yu Garden and its surroundings! It's a maze but a fun outing! Half a day was enough in our experience.

title: Run Down Garden
content: The garden is a bit run down and no proper maintenance. If you have in your trip to visit other garden in Suzhou, you may skip this. You may still arrange a visit to Yu Garden Commercial Circle for famous Dumplings and some shopping.

title: Absolutely enchanting
content: One of my favorite things that I did while in Shanghai. Even in winter this garden is a must-see. The architecture is stunning and traditional. It's right in the center of the old town. It's 30 yuan with exceptions for children and I believe the elderly. It's very crowded at first, a little bit bottle necked, but once you get farther in to the garden that's not the case.

title: Reasonable entrance fee to visit
content: I paid RMB60 for 2 person to visit the garden, we take half hour to walk around the garden,  there is nothing much in the garden.

title: stunning, don't miss
content: This is a gorgeous garden.  Check out every little detail, from the door frames to the ground to the koi in the ponds.  It is wonderful.  expect crowds, like everywhere, but still enjoyable.

title: Yuyuan
content: just a block away from the nearest subway station. the garden itself is pretty complex, so plan to spend few hours.

title: Warning of Scams in the Area
content: We did not make it here as we were heading to Haungzhou (gardens and museums are all free there). However a warning, there is a scam going on where you'll get approached by two people (in our case two girls) who wanted us to take their picture (at the subway exit for the garden stop --- no special location). They asked questions like where are you from and explained they were tourist here and eager to practice English. Would we like to join them to a tea house to learn about the culture and see a ceremony that their friend had recommended (just down the street). They were very persistent and insisted that visiting the garden was not good timing and would be very crowded. What happens if you go with them is you get stuck with a huge bill. Be warned and don't let this happen to you!

title: The really MUST in shanghai
content: Its great place to visit. Transports you to the most traditional china culture. Highly recommend to seat down and drink a tea in the afternoon in the house of the tea that is in the middle of the fake lake in the garden (high prices but great experience). Also must visit the temple in the garden.

title: Nice garden
content: It takes about 30-45 minutes to walk through the gardens and enjoy all of the rock formations, buildings, ponds and bonsai trees. It is a very peaceful site. The day we went it was not crowded so that added to the enjoyment.

title: Hmmmm
content: Enjoyed the shopping at the shops. Good jiao zi. So so, so so ..................no bargain found.........., long queues for all the restaurant.....fortune tellers trying to con you....

title: Busy place but very beautiful.
content: After living in Shanghai as an expat for three years I have visited this area frequently. I love the history and buildings. The only thing that spoils it is the annoying people outside who approach the foreigners to sell us roller skates for our shoes, or watches, pearls or tea!!! Etc etc . Please just leave foreigners to enjoy the beauty of this area and decide for themselves if they want to do any shopping. The hard selling is not necessary, just allow us to walk around and back off a bit. The gardens are stunning, great value at 45 yuan. The traditional music on the stage is great too. Wish there was a little more information written in English too. I also enjoy the zig zag bridges, the fish, turtles. Very peaceful place. Great piece of Chinese history.m

title: Nice garden
content: This is one of the best garden I've ever seen. The price for entering is not high. You can see a lot of typical plants and buildings. Dragon walls are really particular. It's in the old town so you can also see this part of the city.

title: It's a buyer's paradise
content: Not much to say about the garden; the main thing here are the shops. Depending on the season, there may be some large displays such as dragons. It is an ok place to visit while in Shanghai but always best to do so during weekdays--avoid weekends and off-work times--it can get very crowded. This place is filled with vendors of all types of souvenirs including traditional Chinese clothes, wood carvings, self-portraits, snacks and much more.

title: Maybe not necessary to go inside.
content: The area outside the garden was really pretty- plus all the food vendors,etc. It was a very picturesque and fun spot. I don't know whether I would bother to pay to go into the garden proper- mind you, I was there in winter time so I might be judging it harshly. I felt like the small spaces within the garden seemed a bit claustrophobic because of the crowds. The areas around the garden, however- with the great snacks and picturesque little streets- really worth seeing.

title: Super example of a cinese garden. If you only choose to see one i woul recommend this one.
content: Located near the bazarr at thirty yuan entry this is good value but busy. Larger than the master of the nets garden it is surprisingly easy to get cobfused here. Beautiful pagodas, bridges and pavilions, weeping willows and rockeries. Attention to detail is eveywhere. Worth spending some time discovering.

title: Get in and Get out!
content: The garden itself is stunning - this is an important place to experience - and worth a visit. Without a doubt it will be a highlight of your Shanghai trip.

title: Hidden oasis in the city transports you back in time.
content: This is an excellent example of traditional Chinese garden design. If time is limited, it will convey much of what you would see at other popular historic gardens in and around Shanghai.

title: Very peaceful and beautiful
content: Garden is very large. There were many buildings with beautiful furniture. Many children enjoyed feeding the koi fish. There are numerous places to sit quietly and enjoy the serenity and beauty of the garden.

title: The gardens show such care and judgement in all its details
content: Shanghai is very busy but these gardens are so peaceful - once you find the rather well hidden entrance in the next door bazaar.

title: Shopping hub
content: Along with the underground market nearby Shanghai Technology museum, this is a must for bargain goods

title: Excellent place
content: Beautiful chinese architecture one can find here. Good place for street shopping to get chinese stuffs.

title: Lovely Yu Garden!
content: Enjoyed a leisurely walk through Yu Garden with our personal guide, Bonnie, from Odyssey Tours.  The best way to experience China.

title: Good place to visit in Shanghai!
content: if you are in Shanghai you should definitely visit this place to see you more traditional side. Only bad thing is that they will bother you in order to sell you watch, bag or tea during your walk. Be patientful to avoid them.

title: A nice stroll through history in Shanghai
content: On a weekend during a recent business trip, a colleague brought me to Yu Garden for a tour and some yummy street food. I don't remember the price of the ticket (maybe around $10 USD), but it was well worth the walk through the various gardens and buildings on the property. It took a couple of hours (and I took a couple hundred pictures!) and it was a great way to spend the day.

title: Lovely unexpected beauty spot
content: Hidden amongst the shanghai shower blocks is this little gem! Stunning old fashioned Chinese Buildings and water gardens very pretty but the shopping touristy area outside the gardens is very busy! Do pay the extra to go into the main bit it's worth it and has a nice tea house inside also. Lots of photos to be had here!

title: Tranquility in the middle of the city
content: They call this place a garden but I think I'd call it a sea of tranquility in the heart of a very busy shopping and touristy area. If you're in Shanghai, make the trip and you won't be disappointed. The one thing I noted is just how quiet and serene it is and just outside, there are dozens of little shops with folks hawking there wares.

title: Fabulous gardens and builidings, beautifully maintained
content: Wonderful gardens, ponds and temples, so well maintained with so much history. There is a fee to enter but its well worth it. You stroll around at your own pace finding your own route, it is a little confusing and easy to get lost in the gardens. We couldn't actually find how to get out at one point but that added to the experience. A real oasis of calm and so serene with beautiful buildings.

title: So beautiful
content: Such a pretty place! A lot to explore around the little area too ! Make sure to check the opening times!

title: beautiful garden
content: nice, beautiful and hearty garden. i like it .very different and good layout of plants.nice lack with beautiful and gutty fish.

user_loc: 新西兰奥克兰中心地区
title: Peaceful oasis in this mega city
content: What a stunning place - oozing history and such a peaceful oasis in this super busy mega city. I loved all the history throughout. It gets very busy on weekends so try to go during the week if you can. But do go!

title: Lovely architecture
content: Took a slow stroll around the garden, loads of people I must add, but the view inside the garden is breathtaking. There are toilets as well.

title: Well preserved garden
content: very small situated in the middle of crowded and market. Once you get inside the garden its quite peaceful, recommended to go there during early morning or evening time.

title: Bustling with activity and touristy
content: Lots of shops and food options. Bustling with activities and many locals and tourists. A good place to spend at least half a day exploring the gardens, eating xiao long bao and shopping.

title: Wonderful place
content: Terrific. Take your time,  wander and observe. Every corner brings a new delight. It's a fabulous place.

title: Beautiful classical Chinese garden
content: An oasis of classical Chinese garden design in the middle of Shanghai and right next to the Yuyuan market - classical Chinese buildings for various uses throughout with green planting, water and stone as well as sculptures. The haven of the Dowager Empress Xixi whose personal belongings are on exhibit inside one of the many buildings. The whole thing is lovely and well worth a visit.

title: Tiny but attractive
content:
Interesting history, Interesting Structure and Interesting Creation.
Lovely.  But, I was there after visiting Forbidden City. So I feel like I am visiting Tiny place :-P

title: FENG SHUI
content: Excellent garden to learn about feng shui. Rock, water, trees, mountains all present if different size and forms. Beautiful photo opportunities from various angles. Don't get pushed along by the crowds. Try and take your time to take it all in. Been there 4 times. Always find something new to admire.

title: Pleasant
content: Very pleasant an interesting garden to walk around. A lot of photo opportunities so charge up your batteries

title: Wonderful place
content: Wish we had found this place sooner it's beautiful and well worth a visit.

title: Staggering garden hidden in the heart of the city
content: David from Catherine Lu tours took us to the Yu Garden. You'd never guess that a place of such beauty could exist in a metropolis like Shanghai. The garden is full of has hand crafted sculptures made from wood, and others from stone. The story of the garden is one of great devotion to the creators parents, 18 years in the making.

title: Delicious : Sheng Jian Bao / Fried Dumpling
content: Recommended to eat Sheng Jian Bao / Fried Dumpling!

title: Excellent place to spend half a day ,soaked in history
content: We spend a day here. This is an excellent place soaked in history, with quite a few attractions. Luckily we had a colleague, who did the explaining of the various parts of the garden. This is very easily accessible by the metro line 10. There are lot of interesting things to see like, Sansui Hal,Wanhua Chamber,Yuhua Hall , inner garden. The place is a must for anyone interested in history & culture of China..

title: Great for photos
content: Evening is a good time to visit. Right before sunset the interior is lit up with lanterns. After visiting yuyuan, get your dinner in the area and wait for the lights to come on. Magical scene at night in the area.

title: Zig Zag
content: What a pleasant surprise, right in the middle of shopping, eating you take a step into the past and enjoy this amazing garden.

title: Peaceful walkabout
content: Nice garden with good history behind it. Afterwards you can roam around the countless shops and restaurants outside the compound.

title: Yu Garden
content: It is the most beautiful garden I've seen so far. You can spend the day there without being bored. It is really awesome!

title: A so-so attraction
content: If you have been to the Beijing Gardens , this private garden is only so-so. The external shopping areas - ancient streets sell the usual trinkets but the shops make a nice picture.

title: Interesting insight
content: A nice way to while away a couple of hours in this beautiful garden. Very tranquil and take the time to sit awhile and absorb the scenery.

title: 'you will learn the character of a person by entering his house'
content: Was not my 1st time coming to this place to buy souvenirs, but it did my 1st entering the Yu Yuan Garden.

title: Serenity in a hectic city
content: I spent just over an hour in the gardens and it was truly peaceful. Considering all the hustle and bustle just outside the gates, it is a really beautiful and quite space. It was a lovely escape.

title: Cool but  a bit overpcied
content: Is a nice place as a garden, I think a bit overpcied for what actually is, mice gardens an everything try to expend more time in the house around those are more beautiful with more things to see and do

title: Great place to see
content: It is a very busy are with many shops and little eateries. then inside you get to go into(there is a fee) the Yu garden. such a pretty place with the different temples, gates and water scenes. Very enjoyable afternoon.

title: relaxing tour
content: This is a fabulous place. You can spend as much time as you like here. Get a tour to appreciate it. It is typical china from years gone by. A must do tour.

title: Lovely, peaceful garden that represents historic dynasties of Shanghai!
content: Well conserved, beautiful garden where you must go see in Shanghai! Such a large site so I couldn't thoroughly look around but just an hour of walk in Yuyuan was enough to appreciate the style of traditional China.

title: The Yu Garden
content: We had a wonderful time at the Yu Garden. Our guide from China Odyssey, Vivian accompanied us on this visit. As usual our driver Mr. Tang dropped us right in front of the main entrance. The walk through the garden was very enjoyable. There were all kinds of shops, restaurants, cafes, arts and crafts etc. The beautiful houses with fine wood craftsmanship were just plain gorgeous. And the way the houses were supported on stilts on the lakes made them look even prettier. The city of Shanghai is a modern metropolis; yet such structures have been very well preserved for hundreds of years.

title: The main attraction is shopping.
content: The shopping has something for everyone. That is if you don't mind being followed and aggressively hounded to buy something by street peddlers. There are some fixed price shops around the entrance that are competitively priced. I did buy a few things in a fixed price store.

title: Second Visit
content: This was my second cisit to the Yu Gardens. I went on a weekday in the evening, almost night which meant that everything was less crowded (fantastic!) but as a result shops were closing earlier. The first time I went it was a Sunday and my second day in Shanghai, so I was very overwhelmed by the sheer number of people.

title: Overrated chinese classic
content: Visited this place on Saturday and my god, the place is so crowded that you hardly have a place to walk. There are several places that you need to pay for the entrances and although the garden look magnificent, it is perhaps overrated and confusing as it has many alleys and walkways actually leads you around. There is a shop inside that sells classical Chinese drawing but the price tag is incredibly high. You will have to be careful not to damage them as that's no way you can afford.

title: Yu Garden is simply amazing
content: The Yu Garden is a stunning garden that dates back from the Ming dinasty, a must do if you are visiting Shangai. Within the ground you will also find hundreds of shops and restaurants. Don't miss out on the tasty dim sums served at Lu Bo Lang, bit of a tourist magnet but well worth it, nice views over the pond as well, the dim sum are freshed and really tasty!

title: Dazzling
content: As many other attractions in China, it is crowded. If you can get passed that, this is actually quite beautiful. Well worth a visit.

title: Nice Place
content: This was a very nice place to visit and to enjoy the afternnoon, You should negociate the cost of the boat ride.  They have a lot of room on the price.  The pearl store is very expensive.

title: A hidden treasure
content: Try to arrive early so that you can appreciate this gem without big crowds.  Sit awhile & contemplate the beauty.

title: Love it
content: We were there at night. The building structure was amazing. Everything were so Chinese and it was very nice with all the lights surrounding the buildings. It's pretty crowded and people were so engrossed in photo taking. Perfect.

title: Nice to wander through
content: Great to wander though and if you are feeling like a short rest you can Sit on the many benches or walls and people watch, gather your strength and then head back to the tourist shops for further bargaining with the locals.

title: A must for any visitor........
content: I always feel classic attractions are there for a good reason and the lovely gardens are one of those.....the best part is that they are easy to get to by the super Metro or local taxi and the walk around on a summers day can be a real joy......i would avoid the weekends as it can get slightly over crowded......the gardens have heaps of good dining and lovely tea houses.....very much a nice half day trip out and about in Shanghai! Enjoy

title: Yu Yuan Garden Shopping, Commodities Markets and Cultural View
content: Yu Yuan Garden proper is a traditional old-style and large city garden (formally a private garden) in the heart of downtown Shanghai. If you have limited time and have never seen a Chinese garden then perhaps this may be of interest, but I would suggest you may spend your time better by exploring the other areas within this old part of town.

title: A nice oasis in the center of the city
content: Yu Garden is a nice place for few hours of relax. The most important thing is to chose the right period, i.e. avoid to visit there during Chinese festivities or local celebrations.

title: Beauty wherever you look
content: Around 30 Yuan for entry (as at December 2015), this wonderful place has the feel of ancient China.

title: Lovely gardens
content: I was pleasantly surprised to discover these gardens, it was like a maze of beauty that I spent a while exploring. The signage could be improved as you are often directed in a certain direction only to struggle to find what was being pointed at. It did amuse me that you'd find random cleaning equipment hidden in some of the more obscure nooks and crannies.

title: Nice, but packed by tourists and close to Public transport
content: The streets around whole place are more Chinese than Yu Garden. Yu contains a lot of souvenirs shops, western chains like Starbucks and so on.

title: Still iconic
content: It was a short visit but the garden was amazingly beautiful. Every rock must have been carefully placed by hand. Nothing seems out of place. Definitely highly recommended for any visitor.

title: A beautiful garden to visit at any time of the year
content: We have visited Yu Garden several times, in spring and in fall.  It really is a a wonderful place to spend an hour or two walking the gardens and enjoying the peace and quiet.

title: Beautiful but crowded
content: It is beautiful but don't go in the week end (at least if you are not interested is watching people doing selfies or feeding giant fishes...you won't walk around it's too crowded!!)

title: Just beautiful!
content: This is a surprisingly large and beautiful garden in the heart of this noisy traffic-jammed city. Complete with pagodas, pools of koi carp (take bread to feed them!), lovely trees, wonderfully planned walks and vistas, the gardens are popular with tour groups but there is enough space to accommodate them. Don't miss going there!

title: Great walk !
content: Really awesome garden. A MUST-DO ! Quite cheap, definitely worth the money and time. Enjoy getting lost there (:

title: Go when the crowds are down
content: If you can visit these gardens during a time when there aren't a million other tourists, it's definitely worth a visit. If, however, you find yourself in Shanghai on a holiday, do not venture here. There are lots of places to take great photos of yourself and loved ones, but if there are throngs of people, you'll miss the ambiance completely.

title: A Place of Tranquility
content: Whoever needs a place to have nice and quiet times, this is the place to be. Yu Garden is made for a special reason and that is to be close to oneself. This place gives you peace of mind and joy in heart.

title: Must see Garden in Shanghai!
content: This is a historic garden. Surprised that they can maintain this tranquility in the middle of this bustling city. The rock gardens are wonderful. There are some vendors selling souvenirs inside. If you focus on the historic nature and beauty of the garden, you will be pleasantly surprised. The area outside is historic old Shanghai and is worth exploring also.

title: Seriously, don't waste your time here
content: Yu Garden is a tourist trap, plain and simple. Whatever historical value the site once held, is pretty much lost in the endless hawkers of useless souvenirs. Shanghai is not a city for impressive sites, like Beijing. It is a city where the charm is in the old neighborhoods and the nightlife is among the best in the world.

title: A must see when in Shanghai
content: Beautiful garden.  Classic Chinese arquitecture that takes you back in time.  Just amazing. Pay a small fee to go in, well worth it.  It invites you to just forget for one moment the busy city outside the walls

title: A gem in the city
content: A short walk from Yuyuan Garden station , worth to visit ,  we spend around 1 hour in the garden, peaceful , relaxing

title: Nice!
content: If you can accept that this is basically an indoor/outdoor souvenir market in and out of an old-fashioned clutch of pagodas, then this is actually a very nice place to visit once. It's generally crowded, but that's just the way it goes.

title: Historic Chinese Gardens
content: This was my 2nd visit to these beautiful gardens. Unlike what we're used to in North America, this garden is predominantly rocks, water and buildings that are excellent examples of Chinese architecture. I'm sure that at one time this was a very peaceful place to visit but with all of the tourists around, the tranquility is long gone. It is located beside Old Town so it's easy to get to. It's worth a visit just to see what a typical Chinese garden used to look like.

title: Wonderful slice of orld China
content: Wow! I can't believe this was one a private garden. Very elaborate architecture if the interiors are a bit spare. Lovely ponds dappled throughout. Great way to escape the concrete jungle if not the crowds. Must see while in Shanghai.

title: Super place to visit!
content: Toured the gardens and it is a wonderful place to visit in Shanghai.  Bonsai tree collection was amazing. Just be sure to wear shoes with good tread as the rocks can be quite slippery in the rain.

title: Historical Chinese Gardens
content: Beautiful oasis amongst the chaos. Zig zag bridge at the entrance is fun. Surrounded by great market so you have the best of both worlds.

title: Nice old style garden
content: Yuyuan is a preserved historical garden that is located within walking distance to the Bund. It is located by the Old city temple god complex. It is a classic chinese garden with numerous ponds, winding bridges and strange rock formations. I particularly like the big dragon head tiles. There is not much to see except to look for the small hidden paths and garden. I particularly like the private theatre. Its very peaceful inside but outside you are smack into the tourist shopping area of the Old city temple god complex.

title: Fabulous
content: Breath taking traditional Chines garden with every feature you could hope to see; bonsai, rock art, ponds and shaped trees, curved corridors and dragons atop walls. Our guide took the time to explain the history and origin of the garden. Well worth a visit and there's the added bonus of nearby traditional shopping mall.

title: A little bit of tranquillty in a bustling city.
content: It is like stepping back in time, a very serene garden where you can imagine what China was like years ago, spend a little time walking around the gardens and buildings then when you leave, you are transported back to reality, watch your pockets and bags, and hawkers who will sell you genuine copies of watches, walk across the zigzag bridge and you are faced with Starbucks and various other eateries, go mid week for less crowds and be watchful of those around you.

title: Lovely Garden
content: had a stroll around the gardens early in the morning as it gets quite busy later on, found it a stunning garden and very relaxing, well worth a visit for a morning stroll

title: Live and historical and shopping
content: It is a historical Garden. Beautiful design. You have to hire a person to explain the history and function of different corner of old Garden. Around the garden you can find almost everything to buy. Silk, pearl, clothes, souvenirs , tea house, restaurants . You can easily spend one day here and enjoy.

title: Oasis in the city
content: Great little Oasis in a busy city. you can barely hear the hustle and bustle of the city outside the garden gates. the fee was minimal. Some little shops inside and a tradition tea house , where you could pay to have your tea leaves read. Very well labeled with info for a Canadian traveler with no Chinese language skills.
